object.name: AAAJWTGenerator
object.summary: Specify JWT content and cryptographic methods to generate a JWT in the AAA postprocessing phase.

property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>
A descriptive summary for the JWT Generator configuration.
property.summary: Enter a brief descriptive summary for the JWT Generator configuration.
property.name: UserSummary
Issuer
property.summary: Specify the value for the issuer claim.
property.description: The issuer claim, "iss", identifies the principal that issues the JWT. The maximum length is 256 characters. The default value is <tt>idg</tt> .

property.name: Duration
property.summary: Specify the validity period for calculating the expiration time, "exp" claim, of the JWT processing.
property.description: The validity period identifies the expiration time, "exp" claim. Enter a value in the range 1 - 31622400. The default value is 3600.

<p>Additional JWT claims, such as audience "aud" claim, not before "nbf" claim, issued at "iat" claim, JWT ID "jit" claim, "nonce" claim, and custom claim, can be added for JWT.</p><p>The subject, "sub" claim is added by default. You can override the subject claim value by specifying the "sub" claim in the Custom claims field.</p>
property.summary: Add additional JWT claims.
property.name: AdditionalClaims
Audience
property.summary: Specify the value for the audience claim.
property.description: The audience, "aud", claim identifies the recipients that the JWT is intended for. The maximum length of the Audience claim is 256 characters.

property.name: NotBefore
property.summary: Specify a delta used to calculate the not before claim.
property.description: The not before claim, "nbf", indicates the time before which the JWT must not be accepted for processing. Enter a value in the range 0 - 480. The default value is 0.

property.name: CustomClaims
property.summary: Specify custom claims.
property.description: The GatewayScript or XSLT file is processed to specify the custom claim. The GatewayScript or XSLT file must be stored in the <tt>local:</tt> or <tt>store:</tt> directory.
The signing and encryption methods can be used to secure and generate a JWT.
property.summary: Specify how to secure and generate a JWT, by using signing and encryption methods.
property.name: GenMethod
SignAlgorithm
property.summary: Specify a signing algorithm to generate the JWT signature.
property.description: Various signing algorithms can be used to generate the JWT signature, such as HS256, HS384, HS512, RS256, RS384, and RS512. The default value is RS256.

property.name: SignKey
property.summary: Specify a key alias to sign the JWT.
property.description: The key alias can be used to sign the JWT. You can get a key alias by configuring the Crypto Key.

property.name: SignSSKey
property.summary: Specify a shared secret key alias to sign the JWT.
property.description: The shared secret key alias can be used to sign the JWT. You can get the shared secret key alias by configuring the Crypto Shared Secret Key.

property.name: EncAlgorithm
property.summary: Specify the encryption algorithms to encrypt the JWT.
property.description: Various encryption algorithms can be used to encrypt the JWT, such as A128CBC-HS256, A192CBC-HS384, A256CBC-HS512, A128GCM, A192GCM, and A256GCM. The default value is A128CBC-HS256.

property.name: EncryptAlgorithm
property.summary: Specify a key management algorithm to encrypt the JWT.
property.description: Various key management algorithms can be used to encrypt the JWT, such as RSA1_5, RSA-OAEP, RSA-OAEP-256, A128KW, A192KW, A256KW, and dir. The default value is RSA1_5.

property.name: EncryptCertificate
property.summary: Specify a certificate alias to encrypt the JWT.
property.description: The certificate alias can be used to encrypt the JWT. You can get the certificate alias by configuring the Crypto Certificate.

property.name: EncryptSSKey
property.summary: Specify a shared secret key alias to encrypt the JWT.
property.description: The shared secret key alias can be used to encrypt the JWT. You can get the shared secret key alias by configuring the Crypto Shared Secret Key.

object.description: <p>The JSON Web Token (JWT) Generator specifies the JWT content and the cryptographic methods, such as signing and encryption methods, used for generating a JWT during the AAA postprocessing phase.</p>

value.description: Specify how to decrypt the encrypted JWT.
value.name: decrypt

value.description: Specify how to verify the signed JWT.
value.name: verify

value.description: Specify a custom processing to validate the JWT, by processing a GatewayScript or XSLT file. This provides additional customized verification after the DataPower Gateway has verified the JWT successfully.
value.name: customized
value.summary: Use the custom processing mechanism to validate the JWT.

value.description: Specify the public and private keypair for JWT validation.
value.name: pkix

value.description: Specify the shared secret key for JWT validation.
value.name: ssecret

value.description: Specify a remote URL, with the form of http or https, for remotely retrieving the JWK for JWT validation.
value.name: jwk-remote

value.description: Provide custom processing by retrieving the crypto materials from a custom GatewayScript or XSLT file.
value.name: custom

property.description: Specify the name of the JWT claim. A claim name is always a string.
property.name: Name
property.summary: Specify the JWT claim name.

property.description: Specify the value of the JWT claim.
property.summary: Specify the JWT claim value.
property.name: Value

property.description: Specify the data type of the JWT claim value. The type can be string, boolean, or number.
property.name: Type
property.summary: Specify the data type of the JWT claim value.

value.description: The data type of the JWT claim value is set as string.
value.name: string
value.summary: Indicate that the data type of the JWT claim value is string.

value.description: The data type of the JWT claim value is set as boolean.
value.name: bool
value.summary: Indicate that the data type of the JWT claim value is boolean.

value.description: The data type of the JWT claim value is set as number.
value.name: number
value.summary: Indicate that the data type of the JWT claim value is number.

object.name: AAAJWTValidator
object.summary: Specify credentials for validating a JWT.

property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>
A descriptive summary for the JWT Validator configuration.
property.summary: Enter a brief descriptive summary for the JWT Validator configuration.
property.name: UserSummary
Issuer
property.summary: Specify a PCRE used to verify the issuer claim.
property.description: The optional issuer claim. The "iss" PCRE can be used to verify the JWT. The maximum length of the value is 256 characters.

property.name: Aud
property.summary: Specify a PCRE used to verify the audience claim.
property.description: The optional audience claim. The "aud" PCRE can be used to verify the JWT. The maximum length of the value is 256 characters.
Various methods can be used to validate the JWT. You can decrypt the JWT, verify the JWT signature, and process a custom GatewayScript or XSLT file for further processing.
property.summary: Specify how to validate the JWT, such as by using verification methods, decryption methods, and a custom GatewayScript or XSLT file.
property.name: ValMethod
CustomizedScript
property.summary: Specify a custom GatewayScript or XSLT file to validate the JWT.
property.description: A custom GatewayScript or XSLT file is processed to validate the JWT. The GatewayScript or XSLT file must be stored in the <tt>local:</tt> (the default) or <tt>store:</tt> directory. This field is meaningful when you select <tt>Custom processing</tt> in the Validation method field.

property.name: DecryptCredentialType
property.summary: Specify how to decrypt the JWT.
property.description: Various decryption methods (such as PKIX, shared secret key, JSON Web Key (JWK), custom processing, remotely retrieve JWK) can be used to decrypt the JWT. The default method is PKIX. This field is meaningful when you select <tt>Decrypt</tt> in the Validation method field.

property.name: DecryptKey
property.summary: Specify the private key for decrypting the JWT.
property.description: The private key can be used to decrypt the JWT. You can get the key alias by configuring the Crypto Key. This field is meaningful when you select <tt>Decrypt</tt> in the Validation Method field and choose <tt>PKIX</tt> from the Decrypt method list.

property.name: DecryptSSecret
property.summary: Specify the shared secret key for decrypting the JWT.
property.description: The shared secret key can be used to decrypt the JWT. You can get the shared secret key alias by configuring the Crypto Shared Secret Key. This field is meaningful when you select <tt>Decrypt</tt> in the Validation method field and choose <tt>Shared secret</tt> from the Decrypt method list.

property.name: DecryptJWK
property.summary: Specify the JWK or key set for decrypting the JWT.
property.description: The file containing the JWK or key set is fetched to decrypt the JWT. The file must be stored in the local: or store: directory. This field is meaningful when you select <tt>Decrypt</tt> in the Validation method field and choose <tt>JWK</tt> from the Decrypt method list.

The URL indicates the source location where the decryption credentials can be fetched for decrypting the JWT. The URL must be in the format of http or https. By default, the URL is http://example.com/v3/key. This field is meaningful when you choose <tt>Decrypt</tt> in the Validation method field and choose <tt>Remotely retrieve JWK</tt> from the Decrypt method list.
property.name: DecryptFetchCredURL
property.summary: Specify the URL where the decryption credentials can be fetched.

property.name: DecryptFetchCredSSLProfile
property.summary: Specify the TLS client profile as a source where the decryption credentials can be fetched.
property.description: The TLS client profile is specified for fetching the decryption credentials. This field is meaningful when you select <tt>Decrypt</tt> in the Validation method field and choose <tt>Remotely retrieve JWK</tt> from the Decrypt method list.

property.name: ValidateCustom
property.summary: Specify a custom GatewayScript or XSLT file to provide the crypto information for decrypting or verifying the JWT.
property.description: A custom GatewayScript or XSLT file provides the key material information to decrypt or verify the JWT. This field is meaningful when you select <tt>Custom</tt> for the Decrypt method or Verify method list.

property.name: VerifyCredentialType
property.summary: Specify how to verify the JWT signature.
property.description: Various methods (such as PKIX, shared secret key, JWK, custom processing, remotely retrieve JWK) can be used to verify the JWT signature. The default method is PKIX. This field is meaningful when you select <tt>Verify</tt> in the Validation method field.

property.name: VerifyCertificate
property.summary: Specify the certificate to verify the JWT signature.
property.description: The certificate can be used to verify the JWT signature. You can get the certificate by configuring the Crypto Certificate. This field is meaningful when you select <tt>Verify</tt> in the Validation method field and choose <tt>PKIX</tt> from the Verify method field.

property.name: VerifyCertificateAgainstValCred
property.summary: Indicate whether to verify the certificate by using validation credentials.
property.description: You decide whether to use validation credentials to verify the JWT signature. This field is meaningful when you select <tt>Verify</tt> in the Validation method field and choose <tt>PKIX</tt> from the Verify method list.

property.name: VerifyValCred
property.summary: Specify validation credentials to verify the signers' certificate for the JWT.
property.description: The validation credentials can be used to verify the signers' certificate for the JWT. You can get credentials by configuring the Crypto Validation Credentials. This field is meaningful when you select <tt>on</tt> in the Signature validation credentials field.

property.name: VerifySSecret
property.summary: Specify the shared secret key to verify the JWT signature.
property.description: The shared secret key can be used to verify the JWT signature. This field is meaningful when you select <tt>Verify</tt> in the Validation method field and choose <tt>Shared secret</tt> from the Verify method list.

property.name: VerifyJWK
property.summary: Specify the JWK or key set for verifying the JWT.
property.description: The file containing the JWK or key set is fetched to verify the JWT signature. The file must be stored in the local: or store: directory. This field is meaningful when you select <tt>Verify</tt> in the Validation method field and choose <tt>JWK</tt> from the Verify method list.

The URL indicates the source location where the verification credentials can be fetched for verifying the JWT signature. The URL must be in the format of http or https. By default, the URL is http://example.com/v3/certs. This field is meaningful when you select <tt>Verify</tt> in the Validation method field and choose <tt>Remotely retrieve JWK</tt> from the Verify method list.
property.name: VerifyFetchCredURL
property.summary: Specify an URL to fetch the verification credentials.

property.name: VerifyFetchCredSSLProfile
property.summary: Specify the TLS client profile as a source where the verification credentials can be fetched.
property.description: The TLS client profile is provided for fetching the verification credentials. This field is meaningful when you select <tt>Verify</tt> in the Validation method field and choose <tt>Remotely retrieve JWK</tt> from the Verify method list.

property.name: Claims
property.summary: Specify JWT claims to be validated.
property.description: JWT claims need to be validated. You must enter the claim name, value, and data type. If the data type is string, specify the PCRE regular expression to verify the claim value.

property.name: UsernameClaim
property.summary: Specify the JWT claim name. The value of this JWT claim can be used as the extracted identity username.
property.description: This field is applicable only when the JWT Validator is used in the AAA identity extraction phase. By default, the value of the "sub" claim is populated as the username element of the identity extraction output. Ensure that the claim specified in this field is present in the incoming JWT. If no match is found, no username is populated in the AAA processing.

object.description: <p>The JSON Web Token (JWT) Validator specifies credentials and different methods to validate a JWT.</p>

property.description: The prefix (Prefix:) used to map namespaces that might be encountered in client requests.
property.name: Prefix
property.summary: Prefix for namespace

property.description: The URI (URI:) used to map namespaces that might be encountered in client requests.
property.name: URI
property.summary: URI for namespace

property.name: EIBitmap
property.summary: Select the types of identity data to extract.

property.name: EICustomURL
property.summary: URL for custom processing.
property.description: The request is forwarded to the specified URL for extracting an identity. The custom process should return an identity.

property.name: EIXPath
property.summary: XPath expression for token.
property.description: When XPath is enabled for identity extraction, this XPath expression will be applied to the entire message. The value of this expression (as a string) will be used as the extracted identity.
The optional validation credentials to validate the signer certificate when the method "Subject DN from certificate in message signature" is in use.
property.name: EISignerDNValcred
EICookieName
property.description: The name of the cookie in the HTTP Cookie header to extract and use as the identity token.

property.name: EIBasicAuthRealm
property.description: The name of the HTTP Basic Authentication Realm as described by RFC 2617. A browser might show this name to help the user determine which credentials to supply.

property.name: EIUseWSSec
property.summary: If there is more than one token available, use the token from the appropriate WS-Security Security header.
property.description: By default, the token is extracted somewhere other than WS-Security &lt;Security/> header. For example, an LTPA token is extracted from the Cookie header, set this option to 'on' to use the token from the WS-Security here, if available.

Extract the identity from processing metadata, such as variables, protocol headers and so on. For this configuration, only metadata items contained by this configuration are fetched and returned. Unless you select this method, all metadata items applicable for the current processing rule are returned.
property.name: EIMetadata
EIAllowRemoteTokenReference
property.summary: Whether allow this action to get a remote security token or not.
property.description: If the message indicates that the WS-Security token is at a remote location, for example, the SAML assertion that holds the signer public certificate or the SAML assertion that the signed Security Token Reference (STR de-reference transform) pointing at is not with the local message, this setting will determines whether retrieval of remote WS-Security token is allowed or prohibited.

property.name: EIRemoteTokenProcessService
property.summary: The URL for a service that can process the remote security token.
property.description: The remote WS-Security token can be signed, encrypted, or encoded. A firewall or proxy service with different actions can be used to process the remote token, either decrypting pieces of a remote SAML assertion, doing a XSLT transform, or using AAA to assert the token. This setting is the URL for that service that accepts the security token as the request of the SOAP call and, if successful, provides the final security token as the response.

property.name: EIPasswordRetrievalMechanism
property.summary: XPath expression for token.
property.description: <p>Select the method to obtain the user password. The password is required to calculate the derived symmetric key.</p><p>The property is available when the identity extraction method is "Derived-key UsernameToken element from WS-Security header".</p>

property.name: EIPasswordRetrievalCustomURL
property.summary: URL for custom processing.
property.description: The specified stylesheet or GatewayScript file is invoked to obtain the password.

property.name: EIPasswordRetrievalAAAInfoURL
property.summary: URL for DataPower AAA information file.
property.description: The password is obtained from the specified file.

property.name: EISSLProxyProfile
property.summary: The TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use an TLS client profile.
property.description: The TLS proxy profile references the required cryptographic configurations for the secure connection.

property.name: EIFormsLoginPolicy
property.summary: Name of an HTML forms-based login policy.
property.description: The name of the HTML forms-based login policy that specifies the form to collect username and password information.

property.name: EIOAuthClientGroup
property.label: OAuth
property.summary: Specifies the name of the OAuth client group.
property.description: When supporting OAuth through the DataPower DataPower Gateway, specify the name of the OAuth client group.

property.name: EISSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets
property.description: The TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

property.name: EISSLClientProfile
property.summary: Set the TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets
property.description: The TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

property.name: EIJWTValidator
property.summary: Configure how to verify the JWT.
property.description: Specify the JWT validator configuration that defines how to verify the JWT, such as the JWT credentials and validation methods.

property.name: EISocialLoginPolicy
property.summary: Configure the social login policy
property.description: Specify the social login policy. If you want to choose the social login policy object at run time, you can set the object name in the context variable "var:///context/AAA/social-login-policy-name" prior to invoking this AAA action. The object specified in the context variable takes precedence over the object configured here

property.name: EISAMLResponseValCred
property.summary: Validation credentials to verify the signature of the SAML response
property.description: Specify the validation credentials to verify the signature of the SAML response that wraps up the SAML assertion.

property.name: AUMethod
property.summary: Authentication method.
property.description: Select a method for authenticating the extracted identity.

property.name: AUCustomURL
property.summary: Location of the stylesheet or GatewayScript file for custom processing.
property.description: The location of the stylesheet or GatewayScript file for authentication purposes.

property.name: AUMapURL
property.summary: Mapping details in the DataPower AAA information file.
property.description: The location of the AAA information file. This XML file contains a list of authenticated identities and the various values needed to authenticate successfully.

property.name: AUHost
property.summary: Host name or IP address.
property.description: Specify the host name or IP address of the authentication server.

property.name: AUPort
property.summary: Server port.
property.description: The port number to use for the authentication server.
The optional validation credentials to authenticate the certificate sent by a remote TLS peer during the TLS handshake.
property.label: TLS validation credentials
property.name: AUSSLValcred
AUCacheAllow
property.summary: Enable caching of authentication results.
property.description: <p>Select how to control caching of AAA authentication results. The authentication cache stores authentication data to minimize the overhead of re-authenticating the same identity. Each entry in the cache must have a unique key. This key is the output from the identity extraction phase plus any ancillary data for the defined authentication method. When there is a match against a unique key, the cache returns the results from the previous authentication of this identity.</p><p>A protocol TTL is available only with SAML and LTPA.</p>

property.name: AUCacheTTL
property.summary: Time to cache authentication decisions.

property.name: AUKerberosPrincipal
property.summary: Principal name that must appear as the server name in the Kerberos ticket. This must be a full principal name, including the Kerberos realm (for example, "foo/bar@REALM").

property.name: AUKerberosPassword
property.summary: Password for the Kerberos server principal. This password is required to decrypt the client's Kerberos ticket.

property.name: AUClearTrustServerURL
property.summary: URL for accessing the ClearTrust server for authentication.

property.name: AUClearTrustApplication
property.summary: Name of the application put in the authentication request to the ClearTrust server.

property.name: AUSAMLArtifactResponder
property.summary: URL of the SAML Artifact responder.

property.name: AUKerberosVerifySignature
property.summary: Verify signature with Kerberos session key.
property.display: Verify signature with Kerberos session key
property.description: If enabled, the message must be signed with an HMAC signature based on the Kerberos session key. If the signature cannot be verified, authentication fails.

property.name: AUNetegrityBaseURI
property.summary: URI sent to CA Single Sign-On server.
property.description: The Base URI is combined with the host and port to form the URL for attempting CA Single Sign-On authentication. The Base URI should equal the concatenation of the servlet-name and its url-pattern set in its web.xml configuration file. If the servlet name is "datapoweragent" and the url-pattern is /, the Base URI is "datapoweragent/".

property.name: AUSAMLAuthQueryServer
property.summary: SAML Authentication query server.
property.description: URL to which to post an SAML Authentication query

property.name: AUSAMLVersion
property.summary: Select the version of the SAML messages.

property.name: AULDAPPrefix
property.label: Distinguished name prefix
property.summary: The prefix to construct the lookup DN.

property.name: AULDAPSuffix
property.label: Distinguished name suffix
property.summary: The suffix to construct the lookup DN.

property.name: AULDAPLoadBalanceGroup
property.label: Load balancer group
property.summary: The LDAP load balancer group.

property.name: AUKerberosKeytab
property.summary: Keytab for the Kerberos server principal. This keytab is required to decrypt the client Kerberos ticket.

property.name: AUWSTrustURL
property.summary: URL of the WS-Trust server.

property.name: AUSAML2Issuer
property.summary: The Identifier of the SAML 2.x protocol message Issuer.

property.name: AUSignerValcred
property.summary: The validation credentials for a signing certificate.
property.description: An optional set of validation credentials to verify the signature validity for the incoming message. With validation credentials, the signer certificate must be in these validation credentials or the signature is rejected as untrusted.

property.name: AUSignedXPath
property.summary: XPath expression for the XML entity protected by signature.
property.description: If the incoming message is digitally signed, first verify the signature validity; when the signature is valid, optionally verify if the specific XPath expression, defined with this optional property, is part of the signed message.

property.name: AUSSLProxyProfile
property.summary: The TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use an TLS client profile.
property.description: The TLS proxy profile references the required cryptographic configurations for the secure connection with the specified external authentication provider.

property.name: AULDAPBindDN
property.summary: Distinguished name used to bind to LDAP server.
property.description: This property is only used when the password from the identity extraction stage is a WS-Security UsernameToken PasswordDigest. In this case, the LDAP server is searched for the corresponding password so the PasswordDigest can be verified. This DN is used to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.

property.name: AULDAPBindPassword
property.summary: Password to bind to LDAP server.
property.description: This property is only used when the password from the identity extraction stage is a WS-Security UsernameToken PasswordDigest. In this case, the LDAP server is searched for the corresponding password so the PasswordDigest can be verified. This bind password is the password to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.

property.name: AULDAPSearchAttribute
property.label: Search attribute
property.summary: Attribute to search for.
property.description: This property is only used when the password from the identity extraction stage is a WS-Security UsernameToken PasswordDigest. In this case, the LDAP server is searched for the corresponding password so the PasswordDigest can be verified. This search attribute is the attribute used in the LDAP search.

property.name: AULTPATokenVersionsBitmap
property.summary: Versions of LTPA token that to accept.
property.description: Select which LTPA token versions are acceptable. For additional information about LTPA tokens, see to the information center.

property.name: AULTPAKeyFile
property.summary: The location of the key file that can validate the incoming LTPA token during AAA authentication.
property.hoverhelp: Specify the location of the LTPA key file that can validate the incoming LTPA token during AAA authentication.
property.description: The LTPA key file contains the cryptographic material to create an LTPA token for use by WebSphere (v1 and v2) or Domino. For WebSphere token creation, you must export the LTPA key file from WebSphere; this file will have portions encrypted by a password you enter below. For Domino token creation, the key file should contain only the base 64-encoded Domino shared secret.

property.name: AULTPAKeyFilePassword
property.label: Key file password
property.summary: The password that decrypts the LTPA key file.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the password that decrypts the LTPA key file.
property.description: The key file password decrypts certain entries in a WebSphere LTPA key file (v1 and v2). This password is not applicable to Domino key files.
The stash file with the LTPA key file password.
property.name: AULTPAStashFile
AUBinaryTokenX509Valcred
property.description: The validation credentials to validate the X.509 certificate in the BinarySecurityToken.

property.name: AUTAMServer
property.description: Select the IBM Security Access Manager client.

property.name: AUAllowRemoteTokenReference
property.summary: Whether to allow the retrieval of a remote security token.
property.description: If the message indicates that the WS-Security token is at a remote location; for example, the SAML assertion that holds the signer public certificate or the SAML assertion that the signed Security Token Reference (STR de-reference transform) pointing at is not with the local message, this setting determines whether retrieval of remote WS-Security token is allowed or prohibited.

property.name: AURemoteTokenProcessService
property.summary: The URL for a service that can process the remote security token.
property.description: The remote WS-Security token could be signed, encrypted, or encoded. A firewall or proxy service with different actions can be used to process the remote token, either decrypting pieces of a remote SAML assertion, doing a XSLT transform, or using AAA to assert the token. This property is the URL for the service that accepts the security token as the request of the SOAP call and provides the final security token as the response, if successful.

property.name: AUWSTrustVersion
property.summary: The version of WS-Trust or WS-SecureConversation to use. Usually both specifications are updated at the same time.
property.description: Specify the WS-Trust or WS-SecureConversation version to use when WS-Trust authentication sends a request to a remote STS. The default version is v1.2.

property.name: AULDAPSearchForDN
property.summary: Whether to retrieve the user DN with an LDAP search.
property.description: If enabled, search for the DN. The process uses the login-name and the LDAP search parameters as part of an LDAP search to retrieve the user DN. If disabled, the login-name and the LDAP prefix and the LDAP suffix construct the user DN. <p>When you use an LDAP search, you can configure an LDAP connection pool at the service level and assign it to the AAA policy's XML manager. The AAA policy can reuse the connections in the LDAP connection pool when the DataPower Gateway connects to an LDAP server.</p>

property.name: AULDAPSearchParameters
property.label: Search parameters
property.summary: The parameters for the LDAP search.
property.description: The LDAP search parameters to perform an LDAP search to retrieve the user DN. If the "LDAP Search For DN" option is enabled, this property is required; otherwise, this property is not used.

property.name: AUWSTrustRequireClientEntropy
property.summary: Require client entropy in the WS-Trust request.
property.description: A WS-Trust entropy element is sent by the client as part of the security token request exchange. If a WS-Trust encryption certificate is used, the client entropy material is encrypted. If the certificate is not configured, a WS-Trust BinarySecret element contains the entropy material. In this case, us an TLS profile to secure the exchange with the WS-Trust server.

property.name: AUWSTrustClientEntropySize
property.summary: Length of the WS-Trust client entropy value.
property.description: If client entropy is configured, this property determines the size of the entropy material. The size refers to the length of the entropy prior to base 64-encoding.

property.name: AUWSTrustRequireServerEntropy
property.summary: Require server entropy in the WS-Trust response.
property.description: A WS-Trust entropy element must be returned to the client as part of the security token request exchange.

property.name: AUWSTrustServerEntropySize
property.summary: Minimum length of the WS-Trust server entropy value.
property.description: If server entropy is required, this property determines the minimum allowable size of the received entropy material. The size refers to the length of the entropy before base 64-encoding.

property.name: AUWSTrustRequireRSTC
property.summary: Generate a WS-Trust RequestSecurityTokenCollection request.
property.description: This property determines whether a WS-Trust RequestSecurityToken or RequestSecurityTokenCollection element is sent by the client as part of the message exchange.

property.name: AUWSTrustRequireAppliesToHeader
property.summary: Generate a WS-Addressing AppliesTo header.
property.description: This parameter allows configuration of a WS-Addressing AppliesTo header.

property.name: AUWSTrustAppliesToHeader
property.summary: Value for the WS-Addressing AppliesTo header.
property.description: The value of the WS-Addressing AppliesTo header. The header element is included in the WS-Trust request security token message sent to the WS-Trust server.

property.name: AUWSTrustEncryptionCertificate
property.summary: Certificate to encrypt WS-Trust elements for the recipient.
property.description: If client entropy was configured, the certificate public key encrypts the material for the recipient. If client entropy is configured and this certificate is not specified, use an TLS profile to secure the message exchange.

property.name: AUZOSNSSConfig
property.summary: z/OS NSS client configuration for SAF communication.
property.description: Select a SAF Client.

property.name: AULDAPAttributes
property.summary: The list of the extra user attributes retrieved from LDAP for AAA processing.
property.description: Define the list of LDAP attributes as the auxiliary information for AAA processing. Use the comma sign (',') as the delimiter. For example: "email, cn, userPassword". These attributes are retrieved from the LDAP user store and kept in the 'var://context/ldap/auxiliary-attributes' context variable for future use, such as AAA postprocessing.

property.name: AUSkewTime
property.summary: Set the skew time between the DataPower Gateway and other systems.
property.description: <p>Skew time is the difference between the DataPower Gateway clock time and other system times. When the skew time is set, SAML assertion expiration takes the time difference into account when the DataPower Gateway consumes SAML tokens.</p><ul><li><tt>NotBefore</tt> is validated with <tt>CurrentTime</tt> minus <tt>SkewTime</tt> .</li><li><tt>NotOnOrAfter</tt> is validated with <tt>CurrentTime</tt> plus <tt>SkewTime</tt> .</li></ul>

property.name: AUTAMPACReturn
property.summary: Whether to return an IBM Security Access Manager attribute token for further use.
property.description: If selected, returns an IBM Security Access Manager Privilege Attribute Certificate (PAC) token on a successful authentication. The PAC token can be used in the authorization and postprocessing phases.

property.name: AULDAPReadTimeout
property.summary: Number of seconds to wait for a response from LDAP server before closing the connection.
property.description: Specify the number of seconds to wait for a response from the LDAP server before the DataPower Gateway closes the LDAP connection. Enter a value in the range 0 - 86400. The default value is 60. A value of 0 indicates that the connection never times out. <p>If you configure an LDAP connection pool and assign it to the AAA Policy's XML manager, the AAA Policy can use this LDAP connection pool. The LDAP read timer of the AAA Policy can work with the idle timer of the LDAP connection pool to remove idle LDAP connections from the LDAP connection pool.</p>

property.name: AUSSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets
property.description: The TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

property.name: AUSSLClientProfile
property.summary: Set the TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets
property.description: The TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

property.name: AULDAPBindPasswordAlias
property.summary: Password alias of the password to bind to LDAP server.
property.description: This property is only used when the password from the identity extraction stage is a WS-Security UsernameToken PasswordDigest. In this case, the LDAP server is searched for the corresponding password so the PasswordDigest can be verified. This bind password is the password to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.

property.name: AULTPAKeyFilePasswordAlias
property.label: Key file password alias
property.summary: The password alias of the password that decrypts the LTPA key file.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the password alias of the password that decrypts the LTPA key file.
property.description: The key file password decrypts certain entries in a WebSphere LTPA key file (v1 and v2). This password is not applicable to Domino key files.

property.name: AUSMRequestType
property.summary: The type of authentication request to make
property.description: Specifies the type of authentication request to make. You can make the request against the CA Single Sign-On authentication web service or CA Single Sign-On web agent.

property.name: AUSMCookieFlow
property.summary: Which flow to include the authentication session cookie
property.description: Identifies the flow to include the authentication session cookie. When selected, the session cookie is included in the DataPower Gateway request, response, or both.

property.name: AUSMHeaderFlow
property.summary: Which flow to include the CA Single Sign-On HTTP headers
property.description: Identifies the flow to include the CA Single Sign-On HTTP headers that are generated during authentication. The CA Single Sign-On HTTP headers start with <tt>SM_</tt> . When selected, the <tt>SM_</tt> HTTP headers are included in the DataPower Gateway request, response, or both.

property.name: AUSMCookieAttributes
property.summary: Cookie attributes for CA Single Sign-On cookies
property.description: Specifies the cookie attribute policy that allows predefined or custom attributes to be included in CA Single Sign-On cookies.

property.name: AUCacheControl
property.summary: Set the way to manage the caching of authentication failures
property.description: Set the way to manage the caching of authentication failures.

property.name: MCMethod
property.summary: Select the mapping method to use.

property.name: MCCustomURL
property.summary: URL for custom processing.

property.name: MCMapURL
property.summary: URL of mapping file.

property.name: MCMapXPath
property.summary: XPath expression for mapping.

property.name: MCTFIMEndpoint
property.summary: Name of Tivoli Federated Identity Manager endpoint configuration.

type.name: dmAAAPMapCredentials
type.summary: How to map credentials or resources.

property.name: ERBitmap
property.summary: Items to identify the resource.

property.name: ERXPath
property.summary: XPath expression to map resources.
property.description: When "XPath" is selected for resource extraction, the XPath expression to apply to the entire message. The resultant string is used as the resource.

Use the processing metadata as the resource to authorize access, such as variables, protocol headers, and so forth. If configured, only the metadata items in this configuration are fetched and returned. If not selected, all metadata items applicable for the current processing rule are returned.
property.name: ERMetadata

type.name: dmAAAPExtractResource
type.summary: Information to extract to identify the resource.

property.name: MRMethod
property.summary: Mapping method to use.

property.name: MRCustomURL
property.label: Custom
property.summary: URL for custom processing.

property.name: MRMapURL
property.summary: DataPower AAA information file as the mapping.

property.name: MRMapXPath
property.summary: XPath expression for mapping.

property.name: MRTAMMap
property.summary: Object space prefix style.
property.description: IBM Security Access Manager organizes resources into a hierarchical protected object space. Each protected object space has a defined convention. Select which style of object space to concatenate with the extracted resource. <p>Custom: &lt;prefix></p><p>TAMBI: /PDMQ/&lt;prefix></p><p>TFIM: /itfim-wssm/wssm-default/&lt;prefix></p><p>WebSEAL: /WebSEAL/&lt;prefix></p><p>These different options help in mapping the extracted resource to a resource string that follow IBM Security Services naming conventions.</p>

property.name: MRTAMInstancePrefix
property.summary: Object space prefix.
property.description: The prefix to use in the naming convention. The value of the entered property customizes the naming convention to your specific environment. <p>Custom: Any user defined prefix</p><p>TAMBI: The queue manager and queue separated with a forward slash</p><p>TFIM: The name of the Tivoli Federated Identity Manager domain</p><p>WebSEAL: The name of the WebSEAL instance</p>

property.name: MRTAMWebSEALDynURLFile
property.summary: WebSEAL DynURL file.
property.description: When configured and an entry is matched for a request, the DynURL output replaces the output of the extracted resource string that is appended to the IBM Security Access Manager object space prefix.

type.name: dmAAAPMapResource
type.summary: How to map credentials or resources.

property.name: AZMethod
property.summary: Authorization method.
property.description: Select the authorization method.

property.name: AZCustomURL
property.summary: URL for custom processing.

property.name: AZMapURL
property.summary: Specify the URL of the DataPower AAA information file for mapping.

property.name: AZHost
property.summary: Host name or IP address.
property.description: Specify the host name or IP address of the authorization server.

property.name: AZPort
property.summary: Port number.
property.description: Specify the listening port on the authorization server.

property.name: AZLDAPGroup
property.label: Group distinguished name
property.summary: DN of required LDAP group.

property.name: AZValcred
property.summary: Optional TLS certificates.

property.name: AZSAMLURL
property.summary: URL of SAML server.

property.name: AZSAMLType
property.summary: Match for SAML attributes.
property.description: Select the way to match SAML attribute names and values. The default is Any.

property.name: AZSAMLXPath
property.summary: The XPath expression to run against the SAML statement.

property.name: AZSAMLNameQualifier
property.summary: The value of the NameQualifier attribute of the NameIdentifier in the generated SAML query. Although an optional attribute, some SAML implementations require this attribute to be present.

property.name: AZCacheAllow
property.summary: Enable caching of authorization results.
property.description: <p>Select how to control caching of AAA authorization results. The authorization cache stores authorization data to minimize the overhead of reauthorization the same credentials-resource pair. Each entry in the cache must have a unique key. When there is a match against a unique key, the cache returns the results from the previous authorization.</p><p>A protocol TTL is available only with SAML, LTPA or OAuth with a Tivoli Federated Identity Manager endpoint.</p>

property.name: AZCacheTTL
property.summary: Time to cache Authorization decisions.

property.name: AZNetegrityBaseURI
property.summary: URI sent to CA Single Sign-On server.
property.description: The CA Single Sign-On Base URI is combined with the host, port, and CA Single Sign-On operation name extension to form the URL for attempting CA Single Sign-On authentication. The URL is of the form: http://Host:Port/NetegrityBaseURI/operationNetegrityOpNameExtension where NetegrityOpNameExtension is concatenated directly with the operation name.

property.name: AZNetegrityOpNameExtension
property.summary: Extension for URI sent to CA Single Sign-On server.
property.description: The CA Single Sign-On Base URI is combined with the host, port and CA Single Sign-On operation name extension to form the URL for attempting CA Single Sign-On authentication. The URL is of the form: http://Host:Port/NetegrityBaseURI/operationNetegrityOpNameExtension where NetegrityOpNameExtension is concatenated directly with the operation name.

property.name: AZClearTrustServerURL
property.summary: URL for accessing the ClearTrust server for authorization.

property.name: AZSAMLVersion
property.summary: Select the version to use for SAML messages.

property.name: AZLDAPLoadBalanceGroup
property.label: Load balancer group
property.summary: The LDAP load balancer group.

property.name: AZLDAPBindDN
property.summary: Distinguished name to bind to LDAP server.

property.name: AZLDAPBindPassword
property.summary: Password to bind to LDAP server.

property.name: AZLDAPGroupAttribute
property.label: Group attribute
property.summary: The LDAP group's attribute name to check for membership. The authorizing identity must exist as an attribute value in the group.

property.name: AZSSLProxyProfile
property.summary: The TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use an TLS client profile.
property.description: The TLS proxy profile references the required cryptographic configurations for the secure connection with the specified external authorization provider.

property.name: AZLDAPSearchScope
property.label: Search scope
property.summary: LDAP search scope.
property.description: Select the scope of the search relative to the input. The default value is subtree.

property.name: AZLDAPSearchFilter
property.label: Search filter
property.summary: LDAP search filter.
property.description: The LDAP search filter for the search.

property.name: AZXACMLVersion
property.summary: Version used for XACML messages.
property.description: Select the XACML version to use for the communication between the PDP and the AAA policy. The AAA policy acts as an XACML Policy Enforcement Point (PEP). The default value is 2.0.

property.name: AZXACMLPEPType
property.summary: PEP type.
property.description: Select how the AAA policy processes the PDP authorization response. The AAA policy acts as an XACML PEP. The default value is deny-biased PEP.

property.name: AZXACMLUseOnBoxPDP
property.summary: Whether to use the built-in XACML policy decision point.
property.description: If enable, the DataPower Gateway uses the built-in XACML policy decision point (PDP). The configuration of an XACML PDP or the external XACML PDP service URL is required.

property.name: AZXACMLPDP
property.summary: The name of the PDP configuration for built-in PDP feature.
property.description: Specify the name of the XACML policy decision point (PDP) configuration. This property takes effect only if the "Use on-box PDP" setting is set.

property.name: AZXACMLExternalPDPUrl
property.summary: The external service URL that this XACML PEP sends the authorization request to and gets authorization response from.
property.display: URL for external policy decision point
property.description: Specify the external service URL that this XACML PEP sends the authorization request to and gets authorization response from. This setting takes effect only if the "Use on-box PDP" setting is not set.

property.name: AZXACMLBindingMethod
property.summary: Method to generate context request.
property.description: Select the method to use to generate the XACML context request. The default value is custom processing.

property.name: AZXACMLBindingObject
property.summary: The name of the AAA XACML Binding configuration.
property.description: Specify the name of the AAA XACML Binding configuration that defines how the DataPower Gateway maps AAA results and input messages to the XACML context request. This property takes effect only if the XACML binding method uses the XACML binding tool.

property.name: AZXACMLBindingXSL
property.summary: The URL of a custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file that can generate the XACML context request.
property.display: Custom processing to bind AAA and XACML
property.description: Specify the URL of a custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file that can map AAA results and input messages to the XACML context request. This request is used to contact the PDP for an XACML decision. This property takes effect only if XACML binding method uses custom processing.

property.name: AZXACMLCustomObligation
property.summary: The URL of the custom obligation fulfillment stylesheet or GatewayScript file.
property.description: The custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file that can understand the obligations from the PDP and then take actions to fulfill the obligations base on the request context. When the obligations are fulfilled, the stylesheet or GatewayScript file should output text of &lt;xsl:value-of select="true()"/>, otherwise, output text of &lt;xsl:value-of select="false()"/>.

property.name: AZXACMLUseSAML2
property.summary: Use SAML2.0 Profile to communicate with the external PDP service.
property.description: <p>If the custom binding XSLT already generated the SAML 2.0 query, Set this property to 'off'. This property is for the external PDP only.</p><p>If 'on', this property forces the PEP to talk with the external PDP by using &lt;xacml-samlp:XACMLAuthzDecisionQuery> defined by SAML 2.0 Profile of XACML 2.0. You can combine this property with SOAP enveloping if the xacml-samlp:XACMLAuthzDecisionQuery needs to be wrapped by a SOAP Body element.</p>

property.name: AZTAMServer
property.summary: IBM Security Access Manager client.
property.description: Select the IBM Security Access Manager client.

property.name: AZTAMDefaultAction
property.summary: Default IBM Security Access Manager action.
property.description: Select the default IBM Security Access Manager action. The default value is T (traverse).

property.name: AZTAMActionResourceMap
property.summary: The XML file that contains the ISAM resource-action map.
property.description: The XML file that contains the IBM Security Access Manager resource-action map. This file contains an ordered set of regular expression-action pairs. The mapped resource is evaluated against the regular expressions. When a match is found, the corresponding IBM Security Access Manager action is used as the authorization action for the current request. If no match is found, the setting for the default action is used. The map file must be in the local: or store: directory.

property.name: AZXACMLUseSOAP
property.summary: Whether the external PDP requires SOAP envelope.
property.description: <p>If the custom binding XSLT already generated the SOAP envelope, set this property to 'off'. This setting is for the external PDP only.</p><p>If 'off', the PEP directly posts the xacml-context:Request, whether or not wrapped by SAML Profile element &lt;xacml-samlp:XACMLAuthzDecisionQuery>, to the external PDP via HTTP POST method; otherwise, the request is additionally wrapped by a SOAP Body. You can combine this property with PDP requires SAML 2.0 if the XACML request should be wrapped by xacml-samlp:XACMLAuthzDecisionQuery.</p>

property.name: AZZOSNSSConfig
property.summary: z/OS NSS client configuration for SAF communication.
property.description: Select a SAF Client configuration.

property.name: AZSAFDefaultAction
property.summary: Default action.
property.description: Select the default action. The default value is R (Read).

property.name: AZLDAPAttributes
property.summary: The list of the extra user attributes retrieved from LDAP for AAA processing.
property.description: Define the list of LDAP attributes as the auxiliary information for AAA processing. Use the comma sign (',') as the delimiter. For example: "email, cn, userPassword". These attributes are retrieved from the LDAP user store and kept in the 'var://context/ldap/auxiliary-attributes' context variable for future use, such as by AAA postprocessing.

property.name: AZSkewTime
property.summary: The skew time between the DataPower Gateway and other systems.
property.description: <p>Skew time is the difference between the DataPower Gateway clock time and other system times. When the skew time is set, SAML assertion expiration takes the time difference into account when the DataPower Gateway consumes SAML tokens.</p><ul><li><tt>NotBefore</tt> is validated with <tt>CurrentTime</tt> minus <tt>SkewTime</tt> .</li><li><tt>NotOnOrAfter</tt> is validated with <tt>CurrentTime</tt> plus <tt>SkewTime</tt> .</li></ul>

property.name: AZOAuthValidationEndpointType
property.summary: Validation endpoint type for OAuth access token.
property.description: Specifies the validation endpoint type for the OAuth access token.

property.name: AZTFIMEndpoint
property.summary: Tivoli Federated Identity Manager configuration.
property.description: Specifies the Tivoli Federated Identity Manager configuration that acts as the OAuth secure token service.

property.name: AZOAuthEnforceScope
property.summary: Enforce scope locally.
property.description: Specifies how to enforce the scope of the access token. When set to 'on', the mapped resource is enforced locally against the scope. When set to 'off', scope enforcement is performed by the back end. The default value is 'off'.

property.name: AZOAuthExportHeaders
property.summary: Export Tivoli Federated Identity Manager response attributes.
property.description: Specifies whether to export the response attributes that is returned by the Tivoli Federated Identity Manager STS as HTTP headers in the back-end request. When set to 'on', all response attributes are exported to HTTP headers. The default value is 'on'.

property.name: AZTAMPACReturn
property.summary: Whether to return an IBM Security Access Manager attribute token for further use.
property.label: Return privilege attribute certificate
property.description: If selected, returns an IBM Security Access Manager Privilege Attribute Certificate (PAC) token on a successful authorization. The PAC token can be used in the postprocessing phase. This property is mutually exclusive to the same property in the authentication phase. If you select this property for both authentication and authorization, the setting will be automatically cleared for authorization when applied.

property.name: AZTAMPACUse
property.summary: Whether to use an existing IBM Security Access Manager attribute token.
property.label: Use privilege attribute certificate
property.description: <p>If selected, uses the IBM Security Access Manager Privilege Attribute Certificate (PAC) token that was returned in a previous AAA phase. To use this property, the authentication or map credentials phase must return a PAC token. You can use the PAC token in the postprocessing phase.</p><p>If not selected, uses the existing identity.</p>

property.name: AZLDAPReadTimeout
property.summary: Number of seconds to wait for a response from LDAP server before the DataPower Gateway closes the connection.
property.description: Specify the number of seconds to wait for a response from the LDAP server before the DataPower Gateway closes the LDAP connection. Enter a value in the range 0 - 86400. The default value is 60. A value of 0 indicates that the connection never times out. <p>If you configure an LDAP connection pool and assign it to the AAA Policy's XML manager, the AAA Policy can use this LDAP connection pool. The LDAP read timer of the AAA Policy can work with the idle timer of the LDAP connection pool to remove idle LDAP connections from the LDAP connection pool.</p>

property.name: AZSSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets
property.description: The TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

property.name: AZSSLClientProfile
property.summary: Set the TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets
property.description: The TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

property.name: AZLDAPBindPasswordAlias
property.summary: Password alias of the password to bind to LDAP server.

property.name: AZSMRequestType
property.summary: The type of authorization request to make
property.description: Specifies the type of authorization request to make. You can make the request against the CA Single Sign-On authorization web service or CA Single Sign-On web agent.

property.name: AZSMCookieFlow
property.summary: Which flow to include the authorization session cookie
property.description: Identifies the flow to include the authorization session cookie. When selected, the session cookie is included in the DataPower Gateway request, response, or both.

property.name: AZSMHeaderFlow
property.summary: Which flow to include the CA Single Sign-On HTTP headers
property.description: Identifies the flow to include the CA Single Sign-On HTTP headers that are generated during authorization. The CA Single Sign-On HTTP headers start with <tt>SM_</tt> . When selected, the <tt>SM_</tt> HTTP headers are included in the DataPower Gateway request, response, or both.

property.name: AZSMCookieAttributes
property.summary: Cookie attributes for CA Single Sign-On cookies
property.description: Specifies the cookie attribute policy that allows predefined or custom attributes to be included in CA Single Sign-On cookies.

property.name: AZCacheControl
property.summary: Set the way to manage the caching of authorization failures
property.description: Set the way to manage the caching of authorization failures.

property.name: PPEnabled
property.summary: Run postprocessing stylesheet or GatewayScript file.

property.name: PPCustomURL
property.summary: URL for custom postprocessing stylesheet or GatewayScript file.

property.name: PPSAMLAuthAssertion
property.summary: Generate an SAML Authentication statement as provided by 3.8.0.x and later releases.
property.display: Generate SAML assertion with only Authentication statement
property.description: <p>Generate an SAML Authentication assertion for the authenticated identity. If a custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file successfully generates an SAML assertion, features with this setting will not generate additional SAML Assertions. This setting is functionally disabled if a custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file already provides this feature.</p><p>Enable this option to generate an SAML assertion that contains an SAML authentication statement for the authenticated user identity. The destination system might choose to rely on this SAML assertion to determine the user identity.</p><p>This setting is functionally disabled if a custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file for postprocessing already generated SAML assertions. You can enable this setting so that the custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file can customize the generation of the SAML assertion by using same configurations.</p><p>To enable the option of placing the SAML assertion within a WS-Security header, the SAML version must be 1.1.</p>

property.name: PPSAMLServerName
property.summary: The value of the Issuer attribute of the generated saml:Assertion or SAML SLO request.
property.description: <p>The value of the &lt;saml:Issuer> element. The default value is XS.</p><ul><li>If generating an SAML assertion, identifies the server that is making the assertion.</li><li>If sending an SLO request, identifies the issuer that is sending the request.</li></ul>

property.name: PPSAMLNameQualifier
property.summary: The value of the NameQualifier attribute of the NameIdentifier in the generated SAML assertion. Although an optional attribute, some SAML implementations require this attribute to be present.

property.name: PPKerberosTicket
property.summary: Include a WS-Security Kerberos AP-REQ BinarySecurityToken for the specified client and server principals in the WS-Security header.
property.display: Include a WS-Security Kerberos AP-REQ token

property.name: PPKerberosClient
property.summary: The principal name in the client portion of the Kerberos ticket.

property.name: PPKerberosClientPassword
property.summary: The password for the client. This password is required to authenticate the client to the KDC.

property.name: PPKerberosServer
property.summary: The principal name in the server portion of the Kerberos ticket.

property.name: PPWSTrust
property.summary: For a valid WS-Trust SecurityContextToken request, generate the appropriate security token response. This postprocessing works as WS-Trust STS. Currently only WS-SecureConversation SCT is supported.

property.name: PPTimestamp
property.summary: Whether to output the timestamp for the generated security context token.

property.name: PPTimestampExpiry
property.summary: Allow an explicit validity interval for the generated WS-Trust security context token. If the "defaultexpiry" system variable is set, use the value of 0 as the duration in seconds while issuing a new security context or renewing a context instance with new instance; if that system variable is not set, uses the value of 14400 (4 hours). If you use this setting to renew an existing security context or instance, the default value 0 means to use the old duration for the renewed cycle. The maximum validity is 31622400 (366 days).

property.name: PPAllowRenewal
property.summary: If selected, issued WS-Trust tokens can have their lifetime period reset without a new bootstrapping authentication event. If the WS-Trust request specifically asks that the issued should be renewable, this setting is ignored.

property.name: PPSAMLVersion
property.summary: Select the version of SAML assertion to generate.

property.name: PPSAMLSendSLO
property.summary: Send an SAML 2.0 Single Logout request.
property.display: Send SAML Single Logout request (SAML 2.0 only)
property.description: <p>Sends an SAML 2.0 Single Logout (SLO) request to revoke the SAML Assertion token used for single-sign-on (SSO). The SLO is a request-response that the DataPower Gateway handles differently when it is working as a service provider (SP) or identity provider (IdP).</p><ul><li>When an SP, the DataPower Gateway sends an SLO request to the SAML SLO endpoint (IdP). On response, the DataPower Gateway processes the SLO response for its status.</li><li>When an IdP, the request to the DataPower Gateway contains the SLO request. The DataPower Gateway postprocessing validates against the SAML metadata file and sends the corresponding endpoint the SLO response.</li></ul>

property.name: PPSAMLSLOEndpoint
property.summary: Endpoint URL for SAML 2.0 SLO request.
property.description: The endpoint URL for SAML 2.0 Single Logout (SLO) messages. This endpoint is the authority that authenticated the assertion subject.

property.name: PPSSLProxyProfile
property.summary: The TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use an TLS client profile.
property.description: The TLS proxy profile references the required cryptographic configurations for the secure connection with the specified SAML Single Logout (SLO) session authority.

property.name: PPWSUsernameToken
property.summary: Add WS-Security UsernameToken.
property.description: Add an WS-Security UsernameToken to the message. The username and password are taken from the output from the credential mapping phase.
Select the type of password that the UsernameToken provides.
property.name: PPWSUsernameTokenPasswordType
PPSAMLValidity
property.summary: The value of the SAML assertion validity. This value and the skew time are for fine control of assertion validity duration.

property.name: PPSAMLSkew
property.summary: The IdP and SP system clocks can have a skew time. When the SAML assertion is generated, the expiration takes the skew time setting value into account. NotBefore has the value of (CurrentTime - SkewTime). NotOnOrAfter has the value of (CurrentTime + Validity + SkewTime).

property.name: PPWSUsernameTokenIncludePwd
property.summary: Whether the password must be included in the WS-Security UsernameToken.
property.description: Whether the password must be included in WS-Security UsernameToken.

property.name: PPLTPA
property.summary: Generate an LTPA token.
property.description: Generate an LTPA token.

property.name: PPLTPAVersion
property.summary: Version of the LTPA token to create.
property.description: Select the LTPA token version to generate. For additional information about LTPA tokens, see the information center.

property.name: PPLTPAExpiry
property.summary: Lifetime of LTPA token.

property.name: PPLTPAKeyFile
property.summary: The location of the LTPA key file that can protect the LTPA token generated by the postprocessing action.
property.hoverhelp: Specify the location of the LTPA key file that can protect the LTPA token generated by the postprocessing action.
property.description: The LTPA key file contains the cryptographic material to create an LTPA token that can be consumed by WebSphere (v1 and v2) or Domino. For WebSphere token creation, you must export the LTPA key file from WebSphere. This file has portions encrypted by a password you enter. For Domino token creation, the key file should contain only the base 64-encoded Domino shared secret.

property.name: PPLTPAKeyFilePassword
property.label: Key file password
property.summary: The password that decrypts the LTPA key file.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the password that decrypts the LTPA key file.
property.description: The key file password decrypts certain entries in a WebSphere LTPA key file (v1 and v2). This password is not applicable to Domino key files.

property.name: PPLTPAStashFile
property.summary: The stash file with the LTPA key file password.

property.name: PPKerberosSPNEGOToken
property.summary: Generate a Kerberos SPNEGO token to be inserted into the WWW-Authenticate HTTP header.

property.name: PPKerberosBstValueType
property.summary: Value of the ValueType attribute in the Kerberos AP-REQ message.
property.description: Select the value for the ValueType attribute of the WS-Security BinarySecurityToken. The Kerberos AP-REQ message contains the ValueType attribute.

property.name: PPSAMLUseWSSec
property.summary: Generate a WS-Security Security header to wrap the token.
property.display: Wrap SAML assertion in WS-Security Security header
property.description: By default, the SAML assertion is inserted as a child element of the SOAP header. Setting to 'on' places the SAML assertion in a WS-Security compliant header, as detailed in the WS-Security SAML token profile.

property.name: PPKerberosClientKeytab
property.summary: The keytab for the client. This keytab is required to authenticate the client to the KDC.

property.name: PPUseWSSec
property.summary: Generate a WS-Security Security header to wrap the token.
property.display: Wrap token in WS-Security Security header
property.description: By default, the token cannot be wrapped by the WS-Security standard &lt;Security/> header. Set to 'on' to generate a WS-Security header that contains the token. Otherwise, the default wrapping for that token type is used. Use this setting for the LTPA token.

property.name: PPActorRoleID
property.summary: Specify the actor role identifier for the WS-Security Security header.
property.description: Specify the identifier for the SOAP1.1 actor or SOAP1.2 role for the DataPower DataPower Gateway in processing a WS-Security Security header. The DataPower Gateway works as that actor or role in consuming the input and generating the output for the next SOAP endpoint. This property is only effective when a SOAP message is being used for WS-Security 1.0 or 1.1. Some well-known values are as follows: <table border="1"><tr><td valign="left">http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/actor/next</td><td>Every one, including the intermediary and ultimate receiver, receives the message should be able to processing the Security header.</td></tr><tr><td valign="left">http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope/role/none</td><td>No one should process the Security Header.</td></tr><tr><td valign="left">http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope/role/next</td><td>Every one, including the intermediary and ultimate receiver, receives the message should be able to processing the Security header.</td></tr><tr><td valign="left">http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope/role/ultimateReceiver</td><td>The message ultimate receiver can process the Security header. This is the default value if such setting is not configured.</td></tr><tr><td valign="left">&lt;blank or empty string></td><td>The empty string "" (without quotes) indicates that no "actor/role" identifier is configured. If no actor/role setting is configured, the ultimateReceiver is assumed when processing the message, and no actor/role attribute will be added when generating the WS-Security Security header. Note: This value will NOT generate an attribute with an empty value, which is the behavior as defined by constant string "USE_MESSAGE_BASE_URI". There should not be more than one Security header omitting the actor/role identifier.</td></tr><tr><td valign="left">USE_MESSAGE_BASE_URI</td><td>The constant value "USE_MESSAGE_BASE_URI" without quotes indicates that the actor/role identifier will be the base URL of the message. If the SOAP message is transported using HTTP, the base URI is the Request-URI of the http request.</td></tr><tr><td valign="left">any other customized string</td><td>You can input any string to identify the Security header's actor or role.</td></tr></table>

property.name: PPTFIMTokenMapping
property.summary: Request Tivoli Federated Identity Manager token mapping.
property.display: Request Tivoli Federated Identity Manager token mapping

property.name: PPTFIMEndpoint
property.summary: Tivoli Federated Identity Manager endpoint configuration.

property.name: PPWSDerivedKeyUsernameToken
property.summary: Add WS-Security Derived-Key UsernameToken.
property.display: Use Derived-Key variant of WS-Security UsernameToken
property.description: Add a WS-Security Derived-Key UsernameToken to the message, and add an HMAC signature using the derived key. The username and password are taken from the output of the credential mapping phase.

property.name: PPWSDerivedKeyUsernameTokenIterations
property.summary: Number of rounds of hashing to perform.
property.description: Number of rounds of hashing to use when generating a derived key from a password. The default value is 1000. The minimum value is 2.

property.name: PPWSUsernameTokenAllowReplacement
property.summary: Whether to replace an existing UsernameToken.
property.description: If postprocessing requests the generation of a UsernameToken but the message already contains a UsernameToken, the default behavior is to retain the original token and not generate a new one. Setting to 'on' causes the generated token to replace any existing ones.

property.name: PPTFIMReplaceMethod
property.summary: Method to use with Tivoli Federated Identity Manager responses.
property.description: Select how to handle the token that Tivoli Federated Identity Manager returns.

property.name: PPTFIMRetrieveMode
property.summary: Method to retrieve token from Tivoli Federated Identity Manager.
property.description: Select the method to retrieve the token from Tivoli Federated Identity Manager.

property.name: PPHMACSigningAlg
property.summary: The algorithm to sign the token.
property.description: Select the HMAC algorithm to sign the token. This option is available if WS-Security UsernameToken was requested in postprocessing and WS-Security Derived-Key UsernameToken is added to the message with an HMAC signature.

property.name: PPSigningHashAlg
property.summary: Signing message digest algorithm.
property.description: Select the algorithm for the message digest when generating a digital signature. This algorithm is used with only the UsernameToken postprocessing method.

property.name: PPWSTrustHeader
property.summary: Return the WS-Trust token in the SOAP header rather than in the SOAP body.
property.display: Return the WS-Trust token as SOAP header
property.description: Rather than being put inside the SOAP Body, the wst:RequestedSecurityToken is wrapped by a wst:IssuedToken element and returned as a SOAP header.

property.name: PPWSSCKeySource
property.summary: Where to get the shared secret to initialize the WS-Trust or WS-SecureConversation SecurityContext.
property.display: Source of shared secret to initialize SecurityContext
property.description: With the WS-Trust postprocessing method, processing works as an on-box WS-Trust STS backed by WS-SecureConversation. A symmetric shared secret key is needed to initialize the WS-SecureConversation SecurityContext. This key can be an authenticated token from the request message (such as Kerberos token), a token generated by the DataPower DataPower Gateway (not supported), a randomness key, or a static shared secret.

property.name: PPSharedSecretKey
property.summary: Static shared secret defined by the Shared Secret Key configuration.
property.description: A shared secret key that can be used to initialize the SecurityContext. This setting specifies a static symmetric key to use for every SecurityContext. Therefore, this method is less secure than any other key types and not recommended.

property.name: PPWSTrustRenewalWait
property.summary: How long the service can keep the expired token before a renewal is requested.
property.description: Specify the number of seconds that you allow STS to keep the expired SecurityContext. By default, after a WS-Trust token expires, it can be removed from the STS and is not allowed to renew after expiration. Therefore, you would have to renew it before a token expires. If the WS-Trust request specifically asks that the issued can be renewed after expiration and this setting has a value of 0, the token is issued or renewed with 1 hour (3600 seconds) wait time. The default value is 0. The maximum TTL is 2678400 (31 days).

property.name: PPWSTrustNewInstance
property.summary: Issue a new Instance when the request is to renew the WS-Trust token.
property.display: Issue new Instance for WS-Trust renewal
property.description: When set to 'on', the SCT renewal request creates a new Instance of the current context, if the request does not have an Instance name. If the request is for a valid existing Instance, renews that Instance.

property.name: PPWSTrustNewKey
property.summary: Use a different key than the current one for requests to renew the WS-Trust token.
property.display: Update context key for WS-Trust renewal
property.description: When set to 'on', the SCT renewal request does not use the existing shared secret key of the renewed context.

property.name: PPWSTrustNeverExpire
property.summary: Force the SecurityContext or Instance to live forever unless explicitly changed afterwards.
property.description: When set to 'on', the SCT or Instance will be initialized to live forever. The duration can still be changed afterwards with an explicit number of seconds.

property.name: PPICRXToken
property.summary: Create an ICRX token from the authenticated credentials.
property.display: Generate ICRX token for z/OS identity propagation
property.description: Create an ICRX token from the authenticated credentials. When generated, the WS-Security binary token with an ICRX token is inserted into the WS-Security header. This token can be used for interoperability with the CICS Transaction Server for z/OS identity propagation support.

property.name: PPICRXUserRealm
property.summary: ICRX realm as defined in the SAF configuration.
property.description: The ICRX realm as defined in the SAF configuration. Generally, this value is the equivalent of the prefix for a DN in a user registry.

property.name: PPSAMLIdentityProvider
property.summary: Generate a general SAML assertion with flexible format.
property.description: <p>This postprocessing method provides more flexible features than the "Generate SAML assertion with only Authentication statement" postprocessing method, which is kept to support earlier releases.</p><p>Enable this option to generate an SAML assertion in a more flexible format. The SAML assertion can contain an authentication statement, an authorization statement, or an attribute statement.</p><p>The SAML attribute value can be a user LDAP attribute value, which can be fetched directly by the LDAP authentication or authorization method with the list of LDAP attribute names defined by user auxiliary LDAP attributes, or available indirectly with the 'var://context/ldap/auxiliary-attributes' variable by a custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file, such as the dp:ldap-search call to the LDAP, and put the &lt;attribute-value/> elements of the LDAP results to the variable.</p><p>This postprocessing method provides options so that different SAML subject confirmation method can be configured.</p><p>To sign the SAML assertion, configure a WS-Security sign action or SAML enveloped sign action after the AAA action in the processing rule.</p>

property.name: PPSAMLProtocol
property.summary: Scenario to generate the SAML assertion for.
property.description: Select the SAML protocol to wrap up the SAML assertion.

property.name: PPSAMLResponseDestination
property.summary: Value of the optional destination attribute for the SAML 2.0 Response element.
property.description: A URI reference that indicates the address where this request was sent. This attribute is useful to prevent malicious forwarding of requests to unintended recipients, which is a required protection by some protocol bindings. If present, the actual recipient must check that the URI reference identifies the location at which the message was received. If the location is not checked, the request must be discarded. Some protocol bindings require the use of this attribute

property.name: PPResultWrapup
property.summary: Define how to wrap up the result being generated.
property.description: Select the method to output the result being generated. When the DataPower DataPower Gateway is configured for SOAP or WS-Security processing, different output methods are used.

property.name: PPSAMLAssertionType
