property.name: FactorID
property.summary: Enter the string that identifies the results of factor authentication.
property.description: The string that identifies the results of factor authentication in the API context.

property.name: ExtractIdentityMethod
property.summary: Determines which identity extraction method to use
property.description: The method to extract end user credentials.

property.name: EIStopOnError
property.summary: Indicates whether to stop processing if identity extraction fails.
property.description: Whether to stop processing if identity extraction fails. If failed, stops the assembly and return an error.

property.name: UserContextVariable
property.summary: Enter the period-delimited string to locate the context variable that contains the user's name.
property.description: The period-delimited string to navigate the API context to locate the context variable that contains the user's name.

property.name: PassContextVariable
property.summary: Enter the period-delimited string to locate the context variable that contains the user's password.
property.description: The period-delimited string to navigate the API context to locate context variable that contains the user's password.

property.name: RedirectURL
property.summary: Enter the URL fragment to redirect the request, which can include context variables
property.description: The URL fragment to redirect the request to obtain user credentials. The value can include one or more run time context variables in the format <tt>$(context-variable)</tt> .

property.name: RedirectTimeLimit
property.summary: Enter the allowable time for the transaction to complete before the redirect fails.
property.description: The allowable time in seconds for the transaction to complete before the redirect fails.

property.name: QueryParameters
property.summary: Query parameters to append to the redirect.
property.description: Enter query parameters to append to the redirect. Query parameters provide additional information.

property.name: EIDefaultForm
property.summary: Indicates whether to use the default form or a custom form.
property.description: Whether to use the default form or a custom form. When enabled, returns the default login page to obtain credentials. When disabled, define the configuration to return the custom login page.

property.name: EICustomForm
property.summary: Enter the URL fragment of the custom login page, which can include context variables
property.description: The URL fragment of the custom login page. This page collects user name and password information. The value can include one or more run time context variables in the format <tt>$(context-variable)</tt> .

property.name: EICustomFormClientProfile
property.summary: Specify the TLS client profile to secure the connection to retrieve the custom login page.
property.description: The TLS client profile to secure the connection to the remote server to retrieve the custom login page.

property.name: EICustomFormContentSecurityPolicy
property.summary: Specify the value to use for the HTTP Content-Security-Policy response header for the custom login page.
property.description: The value to use for the HTTP <tt>Content-Security-Policy</tt> response header for the custom login page. This response header allows you to control which resources the user agent can load. Generally, you set server origins and script endpoints to detect and mitigate cross-site scripting (XSS), clickjacking, and other injection attacks.

property.name: EIFormTimeLimit
property.summary: Enter the time to limit the transaction.
property.description: The time to limit the transaction before the identity extraction request fails.

property.name: UserAuthMethod
property.summary: Specify which authentication method to use.
property.description: Which authentication method to use.

property.name: AUStopOnError
property.summary: Indicates whether to stop processing if authentication fails.
property.description: Whether to stop processing if authentication fails. If failed, stops the assembly and return an error.

property.name: UserRegistry
property.summary: The user registry to authenticate the incoming API request.
property.description: Specifies the API user registry to authenticate incoming API requests. The supported registries are API authentication URL and API LDAP.

property.name: AuthResponseHeadersPattern
property.summary: Enter the regular expression to select which response headers to add to the API context, which can include context variables.
property.description: The regular expression to select which response headers to add to the API context for access by subsequent actions. The default value is a case-insensitive search on the <tt>x-api</tt> prefix. The value can include one or more run time context variables in the format <tt>$(context-variable)</tt> .

property.name: AuthResponseCredentialHeader
property.summary: Enter the response header that contains the authenticated credentials, which can include context variables.
property.description: The response header that contains the authenticated credentials. The default value is <tt>X-API-Authenticated-Credential</tt> . The value can include one or more run time context variables in the format <tt>$(context-variable)</tt> .

property.name: UserAZMethod
property.summary: Specify which authorization method to use.
property.description: Which authorization method to use.

property.name: AZStopOnError
property.summary: Indicates whether to stop processing if authorization fails.
property.description: Whether to stop processing if authorization fails. If failed, stops the assembly and return an error.

property.name: AZDefaultForm
property.summary: Indicates whether to use the default form or a custom form.
property.description: Whether to use the default form or a custom form. When enabled, returns the default authorization page to obtain authorization. When disabled, define the configuration to return the custom authorization page.

property.name: AZCustomForm
property.summary: Enter the URL fragment of the custom authorization page, which can include context variables.
property.description: The URL fragment of the custom authorization page. This page obtains permission from the end user. The value can include one or more run time context variables in the format <tt>$(context-variable)</tt> .

property.name: AZCustomFormClientProfile
property.summary: Specify the TLS client profile to secure the connection to retrieve the custom authorization page.
property.description: The TLS client profile to secure the connection to the remote server to retrieve the custom authorization page.

property.name: AZCustomFormContentSecurityPolicy
property.summary: Specify the value to use for the HTTP Content-Security-Policy response header for the custom authorization page.
property.description: The value to use for the HTTP <tt>Content-Security-Policy</tt> response header for the custom authorization page. This response header allows you to control which resources the user agent can load. Generally, you set server origins and script endpoints to detect and mitigate cross-site scripting (XSS), clickjacking, and other injection attacks.

property.name: AZFormTimeLimit
property.summary: Enter the time to limit the transaction.
property.description: The time to limit the transaction before the authorization request fails.

property.name: AZTableDisplayCheckboxes
property.summary: Add check boxes to the entries.
property.description: Allows entries to be selected.

property.name: AZTableDynamicEntries
property.summary: Enter a period-delimited context variable that adds dynamic entries to display.
property.description: The period-delimited context variable supports space delimited names, a JSON array of names, or a JSON array of objects with name and description.

property.name: AZTableDefaultEntry
property.summary: Add an entry to the table. The entry contains a name and description.
property.description: The table displays entries that are being authorized.

property.name: Hostname
property.summary: The hostname to set instead of the incoming hostname
property.description: The hostname for the original URL in the redirect or HTML form requests.

type.display: Type of Schema to Validate Against
type.name: dmValidateAgainstType

value.description: Indicates that the assembly validate action uses a specified JSON, XML, GraphQL, or WSDL schema to validate payloads.
value.name: url

value.description: Indicates the XML schema in the WSDL file associated with the API. JSON payloads are rejected.
value.name: wsdl

value.description: Indicates the schema that is associated with the body parameter of the request. The assembly validate action uses the XML or JSON request schema associated with the API operation or the API path. If a request schema is defined for the API operation, it overrides the request schema defined for the API path, if any.
value.name: body-param

value.description: Indicates the transaction response associated with the response parameter. The assembly validate action uses the transaction response based on the response status code to choose the schema to validate payloads.
value.name: response-param

value.description: Indicates one of the schemas defined in the API definition.
value.name: definition

value.description: Indicates the GraphQL schema associated with the API. XML and WSDL payloads are rejected.
value.name: graphql

type.summary: The type of schema to validate against

property.summary: The schema object to validate the message.
property.description: The schema object to validate the message.

property.name: Input
property.summary: The name of a variable in the API context. Data represented by the variable can be validated.
property.description: The name of a variable in the API context. The content of the <tt>body</tt> field of the variable is the input to validate. The default variable name is <tt>message</tt> .

property.name: Output
property.summary: The name of a variable in the API context where the result of validation data, with defaults added, is stored.
property.description: <p>The name of a variable in the API context. If the validation passes, the <tt>body</tt> field of the output variable stores the output of the assembly validate action.</p><ul><li>If the schema to validate is a JSON schema, the validation also adds any default values that are missing from the payload.</li><li>If an output variable is not specified, the results of the validation are not stored. By default, no output variable is specified.</li><li>If the validation fails, no output is stored.</li></ul>

property.name: Definition
property.summary: The path to a schema in the API definition.
property.description: The path to a schema in the API definition. Use the format <tt>#/definitions/mySchema</tt> or <tt>mySchema</tt> to specify a previously defined schema to be used for validation.

object.description: You use the assembly validate action to validate payloads against a schema.

property.description: Specifies whether to serialize the XSLT output tree into binary data after the transformation. The serialized output is not accessible as XML unless it is re-parsed. To access the output as XML after serialization, the API rule must contain an assembly parse action after the XSLT action.

object.description: <p>You use the XSLT action to run a stylesheet from within your assembly.</p><p>This action is not supported in IBM Cloud. Any assembly that includes it will fail.</p>

type.name: dmXml2JsonConversionType

value.description: Indicates that <tt>BadgerFish</tt> convention is used. In this situation, the whitespace text node in the XML input is preserved in the JSON output only when it does not have element node siblings.
value.name: badgerfish

value.description: Indicates that <tt>BadgerFish</tt> convention is also used. But special conversion rules apply to achieve compatibility with IBM API Connect Version 5.0. The whitespace text node in the XML input is preserved in the JSON output if the following conditions are met. Otherwise, the whitespace text node is stripped. <ul><li>An ancestor element of the text node has the <tt>xml:space</tt> attribute with the <tt>preserve</tt> value.</li><li>No nearer ancestor element of the text node has the <tt>xml:space</tt> attribute with the <tt>default</tt> value.</li></ul>
value.name: apicv5

property.name: ConversionFormat
property.summary: The conversion type for converting XML input to JSON output
property.description: Indicates the supported conversion type that determines the target format of the JSON output. The default setting is <tt>badgerfish</tt> .

property.name: Input
property.summary: The name of a variable where the XML input is stored.
property.description: Specifies the name of a variable in the API context that contains the input message to convert. The content of the <tt>body</tt> field is the input. The default variable is <tt>message</tt> , so the input to convert is <tt>message.body</tt> .

Specifies the name of a variable in the API context to store the conversion results. The conversion results are written to the <tt>body</tt> field of the specified variable. The output variable cannot be a read-only variable. <ul><li>When you want the converted output to be returned to the client, you must use <tt>message</tt> as the output variable.</li><li>When you do not specify an output variable, the variable name matches the input variable name. For example, if the input variable is <tt>message</tt> , the output variable is also <tt>message</tt> . Therefore, if the input variable is <tt>foo</tt> , the output variable is also <tt>foo</tt> .</li><li>When you use an output variable other than <tt>message</tt> , the content is converted but not returned to the client.</li></ul>
property.summary: The name of a variable where the result of the conversion is stored.

If the default value is a JSON payload, enter the value as a JSON string. The default parameter value is required if the assembly function is called in an assembly function call action and no parameter value is defined in the action.</p><ul><li>When the assembly function is used as a user-defined policy in the API Connect Gateway Service.</li><li>When the assembly function is called in an assembly function call action and no default parameter value is defined in the action.</li></ul>

ValueType

property.description: Specifies the type of the parameter value.

type.description: A parameter to pass to the assembly function.
type.name: dmAssemblyFunctionParameter
dmAssemblyFunctionParameterValueType

value.description: Indicates that the value type is a string. The value is set on the parameter as a JSON string. For example, if the parameter name is <tt>foo</tt> , the value is set on <tt>local.parameter.foo</tt> in the API context. This setting is the default value.
value.name: string

value.description: Indicates that the value type is a payload. The payload is set on the <tt>body</tt> key of the parameter as a binary blob. For example, if the parameter name is <tt>foo</tt> , the payload is set on <tt>local.parameter.foo.body</tt> in the API context. If the root of the payload value is a JSON object, it must include a space after the first opening curly bracket <tt>{</tt> . For an XML tree or JSON document, the payload must be explicitly parsed before being used.
value.name: payload

value.description: Indicates that the value type is a message. The message contents are copied and set on the parameter. For example, if the message is <tt>foo</tt> and the parameter name is <tt>bar</tt> , then the keys and values of <tt>foo</tt> are copied and set on <tt>local.parameter.bar</tt> in the API context. The message must be a JSON object. The message must have a payload set to the <tt>body</tt> key. The payload cannot be a stream.
value.name: message

object.description: <p>An assembly function augments the actions performed by the API Gateway. You can implement an assembly function in one of the following ways.</p><ul><li>Define an assembly function to add custom logic to an assembly. After you define the assembly function, you can add it to an assembly function call action.</li><li>When you configure the API Connect Gateway Service as not V5 compatible, use assembly functions to specify user-defined policies that API Connect advertises and makes available in the API Connect assembly editor. User-defined policies provide custom processing control of APIs in the Gateway server.</li></ul><p>For an assembly function that is intended to be used as a user-defined policy in the API Connect Gateway Service configuration, it is recommended to configure the assembly function using a mechanism other than a configuration file processed by a configuration sequence. Objects created using configuration files are not persisted to the domain startup configuration.</p>

<p>The audit log settings control the configuration of the audit log of the system. The audit log configuration can be specified to keep a number of rotations of a specific size.</p><p>This object also controls the level of audit. When set to full level of audit, connection information will be logged. More information is logged when in Common Criteria Compliance mode.</p>

property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>

property.name: Size
property.summary: Maximum log size
property.description: Specify the maximum size of audit log rotations. Enter a value in the range 250 through 500000. The default value is 1000.

property.name: Rotate
property.summary: Maximum number of rotations
property.description: Specify the maximum number of rotations to permit. Enter a value in the range 1 through 100. The default value is 3.

property.name: AuditLevel
property.summary: Desired level of audit
property.description: Specify the level of audit. Full includes all incoming connection information.

object.name: AuditLog

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: CPAId
property.summary: CPA ID
property.description: <ul><li>For outbound transactions, indicates the CPA ID in the outbound ebXML message that you send to the external partner.</li><li>For inbound transactions, indicates the CPA ID that you use to identify the inbound ebXML message.</li></ul> It is recommended that the CPA ID be a URI.

property.name: Name
property.summary: ID of action binding
property.description: Specifies an ID for naming the action

property.name: Value
property.summary: Value of action
property.description: Specifies the value of Action. For outbound message, the value will be used in the Action element of the ebXML Message Header; for inbound transaction, the Action value will be used to identify the action binding for processing the incoming message within the Service.

property.name: Capability
property.summary: Type of action binding
property.description: Specifies the type of this action binding.

property.name: SenderSetting
property.summary: Setting for this sender action
property.description: Specifies the name of sender setting to bind. A sender setting defines the Message-sending characteristics in Delivery Channels. It consists of document-exchange configurations and transport configurations.

property.name: ReceiverSetting
property.summary: Setting for this receiver action
property.description: Specifies the name of receiver setting to bind. A receiver setting defines the Message-receiving characteristics in Delivery Channels. It consists of document-exchange configurations and transport configurations.

property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: InternalRole
property.summary: Role of internal party
property.description: Specifies the authorized role, such as "buyer", of the internal party in particular Business Collaboration. When sending an outbound message, the Internal Role is used as the Role element of the From Party; when receiving an inbound message, the Internal Role is used to authorize the Role element of the To Party. Required for a Business Collaboration. Imported from CPA the Role/@name value under the selected internal party. Correspondence between CPA and ebMS message header: Role/@name value of the To party when receiving an incoming ebMS message or of the From party when sending an outbound ebMS message.

property.name: ExternalRole
property.summary: Role of external party
property.description: Specifies the authorized role, such as "seller", of the external party in particular Business Collaboration. When sending an outbound message, the External Role is used as the Role element of the To Party; when receiving an inbound message, the External Role is used to authorize the Role element of the From Party. Required for a Business Collaboration. Imported from CPA the Role/@name value under the external party. Correspondence between CPA and ebMS message header: Role/@name value of the From party in the received incoming ebMS message or of the From party in the outbound ebMS message to be sent.

property.name: Service
property.summary: Value of service
property.description: The required Service identifies the service that acts on the message. For outbound message, the value of the Service is used as the value of the Service element in the ebXML Message Header. For inbound transaction, the Service along with CPAId, Internal Partner, and External Partner are used to identify the CPA Entry; the Service value of Collaboration and the Action value of Action binding then provide routing of received message to correct endpoint. Imported from CPA the Service element under ServiceBinding element. Correspondence between CPA and ebMS message header: Service element.

property.name: ServiceType
property.summary: Type attribute of service
property.description: If the type is specified, the value will be present in the type attribute of the Service element within the message being sent. If the type is empty, the value of the Service element should be a URI. Imported from CPA the type attribute within the Service element.

property.name: SenderMshSetting
property.summary: Default setting for sending ebMS MSH level signals
property.description: Specifies the default sender action binding within the MSH Signal Service Collaboration in which the Service attribute is valued "urn:oasis:names:tc:ebxml-msg:service". This identifies the deafult setting for sending standalone MSH level signals (i.e., Acknowledgment, Error, StatusRequest, StatusResponse, Ping, Pong). The default can be overridden by Action entry. Created by referencing to the defaultMshChannelId of both parties when CPA import.

property.name: ReceiverMshSetting
property.summary: Default setting for receiving ebMS MSH level signals
property.description: Specifies the default receiver action binding within the MSH Signal Service Collaboration in which the Service attribute is valued "urn:oasis:names:tc:ebxml-msg:service". This identifies the deafult setting for receiving standalone MSH level signals (i.e., Acknowledgment, Error, StatusRequest, StatusResponse, Ping, Pong). The default can be optionally overridden by the receiver action entry which is named as the MSH level signal identifier. Created by referencing to the defaultMshChannelId of both parties when CPA import.

property.name: Actions
property.summary: Actions
property.description: Defines the actions to bind. For a business Collaboration, each Action entry identifies an business message that a Party is capable of sending or receiving. For a Collaboration of MSH level signal, override the sending or receiving behaviors of default sender setting or default receiver setting using the value of "Acknowledgment", "MessageError", "StatusRequest", "StatusResponse", "Ping", or "Pong". Created when importing a CPA and are configurable.

value.description: Request for acknowledgment/error documents to be sent back over a synchronous connection.
value.name: mshSignalsOnly
value.summary: Request for synchronous reply of Acknowledgment/Error message

value.description: Do not request receiver to send acknowledgment/error documents back in a synchronous connection.
value.name: none
value.summary: Not request for synchronous reply of Acknowledgment/Error message

value.name: never
value.summary: Indicates that the incoming message should not have the request element present else it will fail.

value.name: always
value.summary: Indicates that the incoming message should have the request element present else it will fail.

value.name: perMessage
value.summary: Indicates that whether the request element present is a "perMessage" basis. And the request will be used for processing the inbound message in question.

value.name: never
value.summary: Never allow or reprocess a duplicate message.

value.name: always
value.summary: Always allow and reprocess a duplicate message. The DataPower Gateway uses a new record for the reprocessed transaction instead of updating the record for the previous transaction.

value.name: on-error
value.summary: Allow and reprocess a duplicate message only when an error occurs during the previous transaction. The error excludes failures in sending asynchronous MDN, ACK, or Receipt.

property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.description: <p>Specifies the URI where messages can be received.</p><p>Implied by CPA the Endpoint element of the internal (receiving) party's TransportReceiver element. If the value is specified, then the incoming URI received by the Frontside Handler should match the pattern specified otherwise the transaction will fail and the gateway will attempt to report the error to the sender.</p>
property.summary: URI to receive the message
property.name: LocalEndpointURI
SyncReplyMode
property.summary: Sync reply mode the receiver expects
property.description: <p>Specifies the type of sync reply mode the receiver expects. The value of "none", which is the default value, indicates that all MSH level and Business level messages will be returned as separate asynchronous messages. The value other than "none" indicates the synchronous connection will be used to exchange all messages necessary for conducting the business transaction.</p><p>Imported from CPA the internal party's DeliveryChannel's syncReplyMode attribute within the MessagingCharacteristics element.</p><p>If the value configured is not identical to the implied mode requested by the received ebMS message, for example, the value is "none" but a SyncReply element is present in the received ebMS message header, the gateway will attempt to report the error to the sender.</p>

property.name: AckRequested
property.summary: Whether the receiver expects request for Acknowledgment
property.description: <p>Used by the receiver to control whether to expect the incoming message to request an Acknowledgment.</p><p>If the value is set to "always" (or "never"), then the AckRequested element should (not) be present within the MessageHeader element in the ebMS SOAP Header otherwise it will fail and the gateway will attempt to report the error to the sender. If the value is set to "perMessage", then it means whether the AckRequested element is present or absent can be varied on a "per message" basis and the receiving gateway will return an Acknowledgment signal if requested.</p><p>Imported from CPA the internal party's DeliveryChannel's ackRequested attribute within the MessagingCharacteristics element.</p>

property.name: AckSignatureRequested
property.description: <p>Used by the receiver to control whether to expect the incoming message to request a signed Acknowledgment.</p><p>If the value is set to "always" (or "never"), then the signed attribute within the AckRequested element should be set to "true" (or "false") otherwise it will fail and the gateway will attempt to report the error to the sender. If the value is set to "perMessage", then it means the receiving gateway will sign the Acknowledgment if requested.</p><p>Imported from CPA the internal party's DeliveryChannel's ackRequested attribute within the MessagingCharacteristics element.</p>

property.name: AllowDuplicateMessage
property.summary: When to allow and reprocess duplicate inbound messages
property.description: Controls when to allow and reprocess duplicate AS or ebMS inbound messages. Note that this option does not apply to MDN or ACK.

property.name: PersistDuration
property.summary: Duration of message to be persisted
property.description: <p>Indicates to the receiving gateway the minimum length of time the message should be kept in persistent storage. When receiving inbound message, the Persist Duration is used to compute the expiry time using the formula: Time to Persist = Persist Duration + Current Time. When a message is not expired, it is not eligible to be archived; once a message's expiry time has elapsed, the message will be archivable when performing archive operation.</p><p>Default to 0 to expire the received document at the time we receive the document.</p><p>Imported from CPA, the PersistDuration element within ReliableMessaging element under DocExchange/ebXMLReceiverBinding element.</p>

property.name: EncryptionRequired
property.summary: Whether the incoming message should be encrypted
property.description: <p>Controls whether the body of received ebMS messages should be encrypted. The default is off. Note that this option is not applied for the MSH level signals which is not to be encrypted.</p><p>Implied by CPA the isConfidential attribute within this party action binding's BusinessTransactionCharacteristics element.</p>

property.name: DecryptIdCred
property.summary: Identification credentials used to decrypt inbound messages
property.description: <p>Sets the identification credentials to decrypt inbound messages.</p><p>Created when importing a CPA. Please set the correct identification credentials after import.</p>

property.name: SignatureRequired
property.summary: Whether the incoming message should be signed
property.description: <p>Controls whether the received ebMS messages should be signed. The default is off.</p><p>Implied by CPA the isNonRepudiationRequired attribute within this party action binding's BusinessTransactionCharacteristics element.</p>

property.name: VerifyValCred
property.summary: Validation credentials used to verify inbound message
property.description: <p>Sets the validation credentials to verify inbound messages' signature.</p><p>Imported from CPA. If the isNonRepudiationReceiptRequired is set true, the SenderNonRepudiation element under DocExchange/ebXMLSenderBinding and the ReceiverNonRepudiation element under DocExchange/ebXMLReceiverBinding describe the parameters related to the implementation of non-repudiation of origin - which includes the signing certificate, signature algorithm, the hashing algorithm, etc.</p>

property.name: DefaultSignerCert
property.summary: Default validation certificate used to verify the signature of inbound message
property.description: Set the default validation certificate to verify the signature of an inbound ebMS message or an acknowledgment. The default signature validation certificate is used if either keyInfo element is missing or signature method is not supported.

property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: EnabledDocType
property.summary: Enabled Document Type
property.description: Indicates which document types to support.

property.name: DestEndpointURL
property.summary: Destination URL
property.description: <p>Specify the destination URL for sending the message to the external party's endpoint. The URL is parsed to determine the protocol to use. If the URL starts with <tt>http://</tt> , the service uses the HTTP protocol. If the URL starts with <tt>https://</tt> , the service uses the HTTPS protocol.</p><p>Imported from CPA the Endpoint element for the external party's TransportReceiver element.</p><p>To use a load balancer, specify the name of an existing Load Balancer Group instead of the address-port pair in the URL.</p>

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: The TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use an TLS client profile.
property.description: <p>Sets the TLS proxy profile to establish an TLS-enabled, secured connection.</p><p>Imported from CPA, the TransportServerSecurity element provides details about establishing the secure connection between the sender and receiver.</p>

property.name: UserName
property.summary: User name
property.description: <p>Overrides the user name in the basic authentication policy for the user agent that the B2B gateway uses.</p><p>The setting for HTTP Basic Authorization is not imported from CPA.</p>

property.name: Password
property.summary: Password
property.description: <p>Overrides the password for the user in the basic authentication policy for the user agent that the B2B gateway uses.</p><p>The setting for HTTP Basic Authorization is not imported from CPA.</p>

property.name: PasswordAlias
property.summary: Password Alias
property.description: <p>Overrides the password for the user in the basic authentication policy for the user agent that the B2B gateway uses.</p><p>The setting for HTTP Basic Authorization is not imported from CPA.</p>

property.name: ConnectionTimeout
property.summary: Override timeout
property.description: <p>Specifies the maximum number of seconds to maintain an idle connection. Use any value of 3 - 7200. The default is 300.</p><p>This setting is not imported from CPA.</p>

property.name: SyncReplyMode
property.summary: Type of synchronous response
property.description: <p>Specifies the type of synchronous response requested by the message which is being sent. The value of "none", which is the default value, indicates that all MSH level and Business level messages will be returned as separate asynchronous messages. For the value of "mshSignalsOnly", the ebMS's SyncReply element will be included in the SOAP Header of the outbound message.</p><p>Imported from CPA the internal party's DeliveryChannel's syncReplyMode attribute within the MessagingCharacteristics element.</p>

property.name: DuplicateElimination
property.summary: Whether to request duplicate elimination
property.description: <p>When sending an outbound ebMS message, this option controls whether the internal sending party requests the external receiving party to check duplicate elimination. If set to "always", the default value, the request for duplicate elimination will be made by presenting the DuplicateElimination element within the MessageHeader element in the ebMS SOAP Header.</p><p>Imported from CPA the internal party's DeliveryChannel's duplicateElimination attribute within the MessagingCharacteristics element.</p>

property.name: AckRequested
property.summary: Whether to request an Acknowledgment
property.description: <p>Used by the sending party to control whether to request the receiving MSH to return the Acknowledgment signal. If set to "always", then the AckRequested element within the MessageHeader element in the SOAP Header is to be present.</p><p>Imported from CPA the internal party's DeliveryChannel's ackRequested attribute within the MessagingCharacteristics element. As a sender the possible value is "always" (enabled) or "never" (disabled).</p>

property.name: AckSignatureRequested
property.summary: Whether to request signed Acknowledgment
property.description: <p>Used by the sending party to control whether the receiving MSH should return a signed Acknowledgment signal - containing a Signature element. If set to "always", then the message being sent outbound will have the signed attribute of the AckRequested element set to "true".</p><p>Imported from CPA the internal party's DeliveryChannel's ackSignatureRequested attribute within the MessagingCharacteristics element. As a sender the possible value is "always" (enabled) or "never" (disabled).</p>

property.name: Retry
property.summary: Whether to retransmit an unacknowledged message
property.description: <p>Controls whether to enable the logic for the retransmission of unacknowledged outbound messages. The default is off.</p><p>Imported from CPA, described by the ebXMLSenderBinding element's ReliableMessaging element.</p>

property.name: MaxRetries
property.summary: Maximum number of retries
property.description: <p>Specifies the permitted number of retransmission of a message. Use an integer between 1 through 30. The default is 3, which means an outbound message can potentially be sent four times (the initiative one and successive 3 retries).</p><p>Imported from CPA, described by the ebXMLSenderBinding element's ReliableMessaging element.</p>

property.name: RetryInterval
property.summary: Time interval of each retry attempt
property.description: <p>Specifies the interval in seconds between retry attempts. Use any value of 1 - 86400. This default is 1800.</p><p>Imported from CPA, described by the ebXMLSenderBinding element's ReliableMessaging element.</p>

property.name: PersistDuration
property.summary: Duration of message to be persisted
property.description: <p>Indicates to the sending gateway the minimum length of time the message should be kept in persistent storage and is used to compute the TimeToLive value to be packaged in the outbound message. When sending outbound message, the TimeToLive is computed using the formula: with Retry, Current Time + ((Maximum Retries + 2) * Retry Interval); without Retry, Persist Duration + Current Time. When a message is not expired, it is not eligible to be archived; once a message's TimeToLive has elapsed, the message will be archivable when performing archive operation.</p><p>Default to 0 to expire the sent document at the time it is being sent.</p><p>Imported from CPA, the PersistDuration element within ReliableMessaging element under DocExchange/ebXMLSenderBinding element.</p>

property.name: IncludeTimeToLive
property.summary: Lifetime of the message
property.description: Controls whether the sending partner includes the &lt;TimeToLive> element in the outbound ebMS message header. The &lt;TimeToLive> element indicates when the message expires. <ul><li>If the receiving partner receives the message before it expires, the receiving partner accepts the message.</li><li>If the receiving partner receives the message after it expires, the receiving partner rejects the message.</li></ul>

property.name: EncryptionRequired
property.summary: Whether to encrypt messages
property.description: <p>Controls whether to encrypt the body of outgoing ebMS messages. The default is off. This encryption is not applied for the MSH level signals.</p><p>Implied by the CPA element SenderDigitalEnvelope under DocExchange element's ebXMLSenderBinding.</p>

property.name: EncryptCert
property.summary: Certificate used to encrypt outbound messages
property.description: <p>Sets the certificate that encrypts outbound messages. Use the name of a certificate.</p><p>Imported from CPA, the EncryptionCertificateRef which is within the DocExchange/ebXMLReceiverBinding/ReceiverDigitalEnvelope of the other party to point to what the other (external receiving) Party's encryption certificate to be applied.</p>

property.name: EncryptAlgorithm
property.description: <p>Sets the encryption algorithm that encrypts outbound ebMS messages.</p><p>Imported from CPA the EncryptionAlgorithm element under DocExchange/ebXMLSenderBinding identifies the encryption algorithm to be used.</p>

property.name: SignatureRequired
property.summary: Whether to sign message being sent
property.description: <p>Controls whether to digitally sign the messages being sent from this internal partner. The default is off.</p><p>Implied by CPA the isNonRepudiationRequired attribute within this party action binding's BusinessTransactionCharacteristics element.</p>

property.name: SignIdCred
property.summary: Credentials used to sign outbound messages and the MSH signal response.
property.description: <p>Sets the identification credentials used by this internal party to digitally sign an outbound message being sent and the MSH level signals being responded from this internal partner when requiring a signature.</p><p>Created when importing a CPA. Set the correct identification credentials after import.</p>

property.name: SignatureAlgorithm
property.summary: Signature algorithm
property.description: <p>Sets the algorithm used to sign messages from this internal partner. The default is dsa-sha1 recommended by the ebMS specification.</p><p>Imported from CPA. The SenderNonRepudiation element under DocExchange/ebXMLSenderBinding and the ReceiverNonRepudiation element under DocExchange/ebXMLReceiverBinding describe the parameters related to the implementation of non-repudiation of origin - which includes the signing certificate, signature algorithm, the hashing algorithm, etc.</p>

property.name: SignDigestAlgorithm
property.summary: Digest algorithm used in the XML Signature when hashing the payloads during signing
property.description: <p>Sets the algorithm used to hashing the payloads during signing. The default is sha1. Refer to http://www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/.</p><p>Imported from CPA. If the isNonRepudiationReceiptRequired is set true, the SenderNonRepudiation element under DocExchange/ebXMLSenderBinding and the ReceiverNonRepudiation element under DocExchange/ebXMLReceiverBinding describe the parameters related to the implementation of non-repudiation of origin - which includes the signing certificate, signature algorithm, the hashing algorithm, etc.</p>

property.name: SignatureC14NAlgorithm
property.summary: Signature canonicalization algorithm used before signing process
property.description: <p>Sets the algorithm used to canonicalize the SOAP Envelope XML and exclude comments before signing messages. The default is Canonical XML 1.0with Comments, which is recommended by the ebMS specification.</p><p>Not imported from CPA but is required when Require Signature is set to true.</p>
