property.name: CPA
property.summary: CPA
property.description: Indicates the CPA to attach.

property.name: Collaboration
property.summary: Value of Service element in outbound ebMS request
property.description: Indicates the service to attach. A service is either a business collaboration service for exchanging business messages, or an MSH signal service for exchanging MSH signals, including Acknowledgment, Error, StatusRequest, StatusResponse, Ping, and Pong. The value of an MSH signal service is "urn:oasis:names:tc:ebxml-msg:service"; A value other than this one represents a business collaboration service.

property.name: InternalPartner
property.summary: Name of the internal partner profile
property.description: Indicates the name of the internal partner profile to attach.

property.name: ExternalPartner
property.summary: Name of the external partner profile
property.description: Indicates the name of the external partner profile to attach.

object.name: B2BGateway

property-group.description: The MultiStep Probe allows developers to view the changing value of variables and the changing contents of processing contexts. The developer can step through each action for any given transaction, up to a configured number of transactions. The Probe Settings page turns on this debugging tool and also sets the number of concurrently captured transactions. <p><b>Note: The number of concurrent xml sessions is limited to the value of the transaction history size.</b></p>
property-group.name: Probe
property-group.summary: Click Tab to display optional probe settings

property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: Priority
property.summary: Service scheduling priority
property.description: Control the service scheduling priority. When system resources are in high demand, "high" priority services will be favored over lower priority services.

property.name: DocStoreLocation
property.summary: Storage location for documents
property.description: <p>The URL to save copies of inbound documents, outbound documents, and intermediate documents that might be needed for retransmission. The location can be an NFS mount or an iSCSI server (deprecated), which stores documents off of the appliance. However, iSCSI locations cannot be set from the WebGUI.</p><ul><li>To use an NFS mount, select the NFS mount point. The list shows these mount points in the <tt>nfs- <i>name</i> :</tt> format, where <i>name</i> is the name of the NFS static mount.</li><li>To use an iSCSI mount (deprecated), configure and initialize an iSCSI volume. Because the iSCSI volume is mounted in the local: directory, use the <tt>local:/// <i>directory</i></tt> format, where <i>directory</i> is the value defined by the directory property while in the iSCSI Volume configuration.</li></ul><p>If unspecified, these documents are stored in the encrypted area on the RAID volume. If using this location, set the maximum disk use to 30 gigabytes.</p>

property.name: ASFrontProtocol
property.summary: Front Side Protocol Handlers
property.description: The front side protocol handlers to assign to the B2B gateway. Handlers determine the network communication protocol, address communication protocol, address, port, and other protocol-specific settings.

For asynchronous MDN scenarios, the default e-mail address to send an AS1 asynchronous MDN. When sending outbound AS1 e-mail messages that request an MDN, this e-mail address can be used as the default e-mail address to send the response MDN. An e-mail address in the destination overrides this value.
property.summary: Default e-mail address for AS1 asynchronous MDN
property.name: AS1MDNEmail

property.description: When an incoming AS1 message requests an MDN be sent as an e-mail request, the SMTP server connection describes how to send the MDN response to the specified e-mail address.
property.summary: SMTP server connection to send asynchronous MDN responses
property.name: AS1MDNSMTPServerConnection
AS2MDNURL
property.summary: Default URL for AS2 asynchronous MDN
property.description: <p>For asynchronous MDN scenarios, an explicit MDN URL can be provided for AS2 protocol. It can point to gateway itself or a firewall or proxy service that will eventually route the message back to gateway.</p><p>If the firewall or proxy between the external partner and the appliance does not forward the MDN to the appliance, the B2B gateway will keep retransmitting the message to the external partner. This property can be overridden in the destination configuration for the external partner.</p>

property.name: AS3MDNURL
property.summary: Default URL for AS3 asynchronous MDN
property.description: <p>For AS3 asynchronous MDN scenarios, an explicit MDN URL can be provided for AS3 protocol. It can point to gateway itself or a firewall or proxy service that will eventually route the message back to gateway.</p><p>If the firewall or proxy between the external partner and the appliance does not forward the MDN to the appliance, the B2B gateway will keep retransmitting the message to the external partner. This property can be overridden in the destination configuration for the external partner.</p>

property.name: B2BProfiles
property.summary: Active partner profiles
property.description: Assigns B2B Partner Profile objects to the gateway.

property.name: B2BGroups
property.summary: Active profile groups
property.description: Assigns B2B Partner Profile Groups objects to the gateway.

property.name: DocumentRoutingPreprocessorType
property.summary: File type of document routing preprocessor
property.description: Specifies the file type of the document routing preprocessor to run against messages that are not received through AS or ebMS protocols. The default value is stylesheet.

property.name: DocumentRoutingPreprocessor
property.summary: Location of the document routing preprocessor file
property.description: Specifies the location of a stylesheet or a GatewayScript file, based on the processor type, to run against transactions that cannot be handled by B2B-specific handlers. <ul><li>A stylesheet examines information from transport headers and other non-content sources to select relevant trading partners. The default stylesheet is <tt>store:///b2b-routing.xsl</tt> .</li><li>A GatewayScript examines information from transport headers and payloads to select relevant trading partners. A Gatewayscript can parse messages of different data types, such as JSON, XML, and non-XML. A sample GatewayScript file is <tt>store:///gateayscript/example-b2b-routing.js</tt> .</li></ul>

property.name: DocumentRoutingPreprocessorDebug
property.summary: Whether to enable GatewayScript debugger for document routing preprocessor
property.description: Specifies whether to enable the GatewayScript debugger to detect and diagnose errors in your document routing preprocessor file. To debug a file, make sure that the file contains one or more debugger; statements at the points in your script where you want to start debugging.

property.name: ArchiveMode
property.summary: Archive mode
property.description: Indicates whether to perform archive operations before removing messages.

property.name: ArchiveLocation
property.summary: Location of the message archive
property.description: Specifies the URL of the directory that contains archive files. Use the fully qualified name of the directory. The supported off-device protocol schemes are: HTTP (http://) and HTTPS (https://), NFS (dpnfs://), FTP and FTPS (ftp://), and SFTP (sftp://). To store locally in RAID volume, specify a subdirectory in the configured Hard Disk Array; for example, local:///ondisk. The message archive is in Binary. When archiving to an FTP (or FTPS) destination, ensure that the FTP policies in the associated XML manager enable "Image (Binary) Data" for data transfer.

property.name: ArchiveFileName
property.summary: Base file name
property.description: Specifies the base file name for archive files. When archiving, the archive operation appends the current timestamp.

property.name: ArchiveMinimumSize
property.summary: Minimum size
property.description: Specifies the minimum size of the document store before triggering the archive operation. The default is 1024.

property.name: ArchiveDocumentAge
property.summary: Maximum age of processed documents
property.description: Specifies the maximum duration to retain processed documents. After exceeding this duration, automatically archive or purge processed documents. Use any value of 1 - 3650. The default is 90.

property.name: ArchiveMinimumDocuments
property.summary: Minimum number of documents to retain
property.description: Specifies the minimum number of documents to retain in the document store at the end of an archive operation. The minimum is 1. The default is 100.

property.name: DiskUseCheckInterval
property.summary: Interval between checks
property.description: Sets the interval between checks for documents that exceed the maximum age. During the check, documents that exceed the maximum age are archived or purged. Use any value of 1 - 1440. The default is 60.

property.name: MaxDocumentDiskUse
property.summary: Maximum storage for documents
property.description: Specifies the maximum storage size for documents. When storage exceeds this value, documents are archived or purged. The default is 25165824.

property.name: ArchiveMonitor
property.summary: Whether to use a monitor for the archive task
property.description: The monitor can limit the message injection rate to prevent archive problems in a critical situation like performance testing or on a heavily loaded device. When enabled, specify the threshold for the archive monitor in the <b>Threshold for Archive Monitor</b> field.

property.name: ShapingThreshold
property.summary: Threshold for archive monitor in transactions per second
property.description: Specifies the maximum number of transactions to allow per second during the archive task. When the maximum number is reached, the service queues incoming transactions for later processing. If the queue is full, the service rejects incoming transactions and generates a log message. Use any value in the range 10 - 10000. The default value is 200.

property.name: ArchiveBackupDocuments
property.summary: Types of document to back up
property.description: Specifies which type of documents to back up. The transaction viewer lists four types of documents: Content, Input, Output, and MDN/ACK/Receipt. Inbound Message, Outbound Message, and Inbound and outbound MDN/ACK/Receipt correspond to "Input", "Output", and "MDN/ACK/Receipt" respectively. This property does not indicate the inbound or outbound transaction to archive, instead, the property indicates the file type to archive. When the Inbound MDN/ACK/Receipt or Outbound MDN/ACK/Receipt is selected, the DataPower Gateway archives the MDN/ACK/Receipt message documents. When none of four AS/ebMS2/ebMS3 document types are selected, the DataPower Gateway does not archive any type of message documents for any transactions.

property.name: XPathRoutingPolicies
property.summary: XPath Routing Policy
property.description: Specifies the set of policies to extract partner identifiers from XML EDI messages.

property.name: XMLManager
property.summary: XML Manager
property.description: The XML manager to manage the DataPower service. The XML manager contains the reference to a user agent. The user agent defines the default settings for how the service connects to external services.

property.name: DebugMode
property.summary: Controls transaction diagnostic mode
property.description: <p>Select the diagnostic mode for processing policies. When enabled, you can view details about the state of variables and contexts for a captured transaction in the probe. The default value is <tt>off</tt> .</p><p>Transaction diagnostic mode is not intended for use in a production environment. Transaction diagnostic mode consumes significant resources that can slow down transaction processing.</p>

property.name: DebugHistory
property.summary: Set the number of records for transaction diagnostic mode in the probe
property.description: Set the number of records for transaction diagnostic mode in the probe. Enter a value in the range 10 - 250. The default value is 25.

property.name: CPAEntries
property.summary: CPA Entries
property.description: Each CPA entry binds an ebXML messaging service (ebMS) to provide partnership interactions between the internal partner and the external partner. If the message is sent by or to the external partner through an ebMS communication protocol (ebms2:// or ebms2s://), specify <b>CPA ID</b>, <b>Service</b>, <b>Internal Partner Profile</b>, and <b>External Partner Profile</b> to identify the received ebMS message or route the ebMS message to be sent. <p>You can ping ebMS destination to send an ebMS ping message to the external partner, and requests a synchronous or an asynchronous pong message. The response can be: <ul><li><b>Success</b>: The connection to the external partner is successful.</li><li><b>Unexpected Error</b>: An error occurs when getting the pong message. Go to <b>View Logs</b> from the Control Panel for details about the error.</li></ul><p>If you request an asynchronous pong message, the timeout for getting the response is 30 seconds. If you do not get any response after 30 seconds, go to <b>View Logs</b> from the Control Panel to find the response in the system log.</p></p>

The SQL Data Source object that is associated with current B2B gateway. For transactions using IBM MQFTE destination, IBM MQFTE transfer metadata can be retrieved by clicking the integration ID from B2B viewer as long as IBM MQFTE logger is enabled and this SQL data source object is configured correctly to connect to the database which stores IBM MQFTE transfer metadata. It is recommended that all transactions within one B2B gateway that utilize IBM MQFTE front side handler or IBM MQFTE URL opener should use the same database as IBM MQFTE logger backend database because only one SQL data source object can be associated per B2B gateway.
property.summary: SQL Data Source
property.name: SQLDataSource
FrontSideTimeout
property.summary: The idle time allowed for a front side connection before the connection is canceled during a transaction.
property.description: Controls the amount of time when a front side client connection can be idle before the connection is canceled within a transaction. For a B2B outbound transaction, a front side connection means the connection between an internal back-end application and a B2B gateway. For aB2B inbound transaction, a front side connection means the connection between an external partner and a B2B gateway

object.description: The configuration for a B2B gateway instance. A B2B gateway can handle B2B messages transmitted over a variety of AS and non-AS protocols for inbound and outbound flows, as well as MDN messages.

property.name: Hostname
property.summary: Replication Remote Hostname
property.description: The host name of the other appliance in the high availability cluster.

property.name: Port
property.summary: Replication Remote Port
property.description: The TCP port of replication listener running on the other appliance in the high availability cluster.

object.name: B2BPersistence

property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: RaidVolume
property.summary: Location of the data store
property.description: <p>Specifies the location of the persistent data store. The location must be the <tt>raid0</tt> RAID volume.</p><p>During firmware initialization, the <tt>raid0</tt> volume is associated with persistent storage.</p>

property.name: StorageSize
property.summary: Maximum size for the data store
property.description: <p>Sets the maximum size for the persistent data store in megabytes. This data store is for all B2B Gateway services. These services store transaction metadata on the unencrypted partition of the RAID volume. These services store copies of the messages on the encrypted portion of the RAID volume.</p><p>The storage location for messages is defined on a service-by-service basis during the configuration of the B2B Gateway object.</p><p><b>Attention:</b> The maximum size for the persistent data store cannot be changed to a smaller value. Changing to a larger value might interrupt transactions that are in flight.</p><p>Use an integer in the range 1024 - 65536. The default is 1024.</p>

property.name: HAEnabled
property.summary: Enables high availability configuration
property.description: When on, the appliance is in active-passive high availability mode with the configured 'Alternate Host'.

property.name: HAOtherHosts
property.summary: Alternate host
property.description: Specifies the alternate host name and port of the other appliance in the active-passive high availability configuration.

property.name: HALocalIP
property.summary: Replication listener address
property.description: The IP address that the persistence store uses to support replication of data between appliances in the high availability cluster.

property.name: HALocalPort
property.summary: Replication listener port
property.description: The TCP port that the persistence store uses to support replication of data between appliances in the high availability cluster.

property.name: HAVirtualIP
property.summary: Virtual IP address
property.description: The virtual IP address that is used by the high availability cluster to process B2B transactions.

object.description: Data storage for B2B transaction data

value.description: Sets the partner as an internal partner. An internal partner receives inbound documents from the B2B Gateway and sends outbound documents to the B2B Gateway. An internal partner is a trading partner, probably in the same company, that implements some B2B processing logic and exchanges messages with the B2B Gateway with HTTP, IBM MQ, or some other non-AS protocol.
value.name: internal

value.description: Sets the partner as an external partner. An external partner is a trading partner, usually in a separate company, that sends inbound documents to the B2B Gateway and receives outbound documents from the B2B Gateway using one of the supported B2B protocols.
value.name: external

value.description: The traffic is XML formatted in accordance with the SOAP schema standards. The service validates the message against SOAP schemas that are currently in use.
value.name: soap

value.description: The traffic is formatted in XML. The service validates the message against XML schemas that are currently in use.
value.name: xml

value.description: The traffic is passed unaltered.
value.name: unprocessed

value.description: The traffic can be any format. However, for traffic that is flat file text or binary, you must use this option. The service passes the contents of the message unaltered. Document processing will not operate directly on the message content, but actions that authenticate and authorize access, set a destination, or attach variables to the context can be performed.
value.name: preprocessed

property.name: DestName
property.summary: Name to identify the destination
property.description: Specify the name to identify this destination in the profile.

property.name: DestURL
property.summary: URL for the destination
property.description: <p>Specify the URL for the destination. The URL is parsed to determine the protocol to use. To use a load balancer, specify the name of an existing Load Balancer Group instead of the address-port pair in the URL. <ul><li>If the URL starts with as1:// or dpsmtp://, the service uses the ESMTP protocol. These protocols require an SMTP server connection and e-mail address. Specify the URL in either of the following formats: <ul><li><tt>as1://mailExchange[:port][/queryParameters]</tt></li><li><tt>dpsmtp://mailExchange[:port][/queryParameters]</tt></li></ul></li><li>If the URL starts with as2://, ebms2://, ebms3://, or http://, the service uses the HTTP protocol. The syntax for the URL is in the format of <tt>hostname:port/uri</tt> .</li><li>If the URL starts with as2s://, ebms2s://, ebms3s://, or https://, the service uses the HTTPS protocol. The syntax for the URL is in the format of <tt>hostname:port/uri</tt> .</li><li>If the URL starts with as3:// or ftp://, the service uses the FTP protocol. <ul><li>For an absolute path to the root directory, specify the URL in the format of <tt>ftp://user:password@host/%2Fpath</tt> . %2F is the URL encoding of a forward slash.</li><li>For a relative path to the login directory of the user, specify the URL in the format of <tt>ftp://user:password@host:port/path</tt> .</li></ul></li><li>If the URL starts with sftp://, the service uses the SSH FTP protocol. <ul><li>For an absolute path to the root directory, specify the URL in the format of <tt>sftp://host:port/path</tt> .</li><li>For a relative path to the login directory of the user, specify the URL in the format of <tt>sftp://host:port/~/path</tt> .</li></ul></li><li>If the URL starts with dpnfs://, the service uses the NFS protocol. <ul><li>For static mounts, specify the URL in the format of <tt>dpnfs://MountObjectName</tt> , where <tt>MountObjectName</tt> is the name of an existing NFS mount.</li><li>For dynamic mounts, specify the URL in the format of <tt>dpnfs://host</tt> or <tt>dpnfs://host/path</tt> .</li></ul></li><li>If the URL starts with dpims:// or dpimsssl://, the service uses the IMS protocol. Specify the URL in either of the following formats: <ul><li><tt>dpims://Connect-object/?parameters</tt></li><li><tt>dpimsssl://Connect-object/?parameters</tt></li></ul></li><li>If the URL starts with dpmq://, the service uses the IBM MQ protocol. The queue manager that is referenced in the URL must exist in the current application domain. <ul><li>To send a message, specify the URL in the format of <tt>dpmq://mqQueueManagerObject/URI?RequestQueue=requestQueueName;queryParameters</tt> .</li><li>To retrieve a message, specify the URL in the format of <tt>dpmq://mqQueueManagerObject/URI?ReplyQueue=replyQueueName;queryParameters</tt> .</li></ul><p>If the URL starts with mq://, the protocol is for dynamic routing.</p></li><li>If the URL starts with dpmqfte://, the service uses the IBM MQ-FTE protocol. The queue manager that is referenced in the URL must exist in the current application domain. <ul><li>To send a message, specify the URL in the format of <tt>dpmqfte://queue_manager_name/?RequestQueue=request_queue_name;queryParameters</tt> .</li><li>To retrieve a message, specify the URL in the format of <tt>dpmqfte://queue_manager_name/?ReplyQueue=reply_queue_name;queryParameters</tt> .</li></ul><p>If the URL starts with mqfte://, the protocol is for dynamic routing.</p></li><li>If the URL starts with dptibems://, the service uses the TIBCO EMS protocol. The server that is referenced in the URL must exist. <ul><li>To send a message, specify the URL in the format of <tt>dptibems://server-object/?RequestQueue=queue;RequestReply=queue;query-parameters</tt> .</li><li>To retrieve a message, specify the URL in the format of <tt>dptibems://server-object/?ReplyQueue=queue;query-parameters</tt> .</li></ul><p>If the URL starts with tibems://, the protocol is for dynamic routing.</p><p>This protocol is available on licensed DataPower Gateways only.</p></li><li>If the URL starts with dpwasjms://, the service uses the WebSphere JMS protocol. The server that is referenced in the URL must exist. <ul><li>To send a message to a request queue, specify the URL in the format of <tt>dpwasjms://server-object/?RequestQueue=queue;RequestReply=queue;query-parameters</tt> .</li><li>To send a message to a request topic space, specify the URL in the format of <tt>dpwasjms://server-object/?RequestTopicSpace=topic-space;RequestReply=queue;query-parameters</tt> .</li><li>To retrieve a message from a reply queue, specify the URL in the format of <tt>dpwasjms://server-object/?ReplyQueue=queue;query-parameters</tt> .</li><li>To retrieve a message from a reply topic space, specify the URL in the format of <tt>dpwasjms://server-object/?ReplyTopicSpace=topic-space;query-parameters</tt> .</li></ul></li></ul></p>

property.name: EnabledDocType
property.summary: Enabled document type
property.description: Indicates which document types to support.

property.name: SMTPServerConnection
property.summary: SMTP server configuration
property.description: The SMTP server connection to which to send e-mail messages. By default, the gateway uses the default SMTP server connection.

property.name: EmailAddress
property.summary: Destination e-mail address for messages
property.description: The destination e-mail address for messages sent to this partner.

property.name: SSHClientConnection
property.summary: SSH client connection profile
property.description: Specifies the SSH profile used for SSH client connection and authentication.

property.name: UseUniqueFilenames
property.summary: Use unique file names
property.description: <p>Specifies whether to enable the generation of a unique file name for puts to a remote directory.</p><p>If you enable the use of a unique file name: <ul><li>Specifying a directory in the destination URL generates a unique file name for puts to a remote directory.</li><li>Specifying a file name in the destination URL generates a unique file name that is appended to the specified file name for puts to a remote directory. <p><b>Note:</b> On the SFTP protocol, if the specified file name is unique to the remote directory, the DataPower Gateway generates the same file name as what you specify in the destination URL. For example, specify <tt>host/01/temp</tt> in the SFTP destination URL: <ul><li>If there is no file named <tt>temp</tt> in the directory, the generated file is <tt>host/01/temp</tt> .</li><li>If a file named <tt>temp</tt> already exists in the directory, the generated file is <tt>host/01/temp.unique</tt> .</li></ul></p></li></ul></p>

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: The TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use a TLS client profile.
property.description: Sets the TLS proxy profile to establish a TLS-enabled, secured connection.

property.name: OverrideTimeout
property.summary: Override timeout
property.description: Specifies the maximum number of seconds to maintain an idle connection. Use any value of 3 - 7200. The default value is 300.

property.name: EnableFTPSettings
property.summary: Control for AS3/FTP settings
property.description: <p>Indicates whether to override the FTP client policy for the user agent that is associated with the B2B Gateway. This user agent is defined in the XML manager assigned to the B2B Gateway.</p><ul><li>When When enabled, define overrides to the original FTP client policy with the advanced AS3 or FTP settings.</li><li>When disabled, uses the original FTP client policy.</li></ul><p>The default behavior is off.</p>

property.name: UserName
property.summary: User name
property.description: Overrides the user name in the basic authentication policy for the user agent that the B2B Gateway uses.

property.name: Password
property.summary: Password
property.description: Overrides the password for the user in the basic authentication policy for the user agent that the B2B Gateway uses.

property.name: PasswordAlias
property.summary: Password alias
property.description: Overrides the password for the user in the basic authentication policy for the user agent that the B2B Gateway uses.

property.name: EBMSMPCAuthMethod
property.summary: How MPC authenticates pull request
property.description: Specifies how the MPC authenticates the incoming pull requests. By default, the MPC authenticates requests through username token.

property.name: UserNameToken
property.summary: Username token to secure messages
property.description: For ebMS3, the DataPower Gateway applies the Web Services Security UsernameToken to authorize the received messages. Enter the user name for the wsse:UsernameToken element to be packaged into the SOAP header of the message to send. <ul><li>For one-way push exchange pattern, specify the username token to be packaged into messages to send.</li><li>For one-way pull exchange pattern outbound messages, when the MPC authentication method is username token, specify the user name that is used for storing messages in the MPC.</li><li>For one-way pull exchange pattern inbound messages, specify the username token to be packaged into the pull request.</li></ul>

property.name: UserNameTokenPassword
property.summary: Username token password
property.description: Enter the password of the user name for the wsse:UsernameToken element.

property.name: UserNameTokenPasswordAlias
property.summary: Username token password alias
property.description: Select the password alias of the user name for the wsse:UsernameToken element.

property.name: EBMSMPCVerifyValCred
property.summary: Validation credential to secure messages
property.description: When the MPC authentication method is validation credential, specifies the certificate to be associated to messages that are submitted to the MPC.

property.name: Passive
property.summary: Controls the use of FTP Passive mode
property.description: <p>Overrides the Passive Mode setting in the FTP client policy for the user agent that the B2B Gateway uses. If overriding, indicate how to use the passive mode with the FTP <b>PASV</b> command.</p>

property.name: AuthTLS
property.summary: Controls the use of TLS to secure connections
property.description: <p>Overrides the Encrypt Command Connection setting in the FTP client policy for the user agent that the B2B Gateway uses. If overriding, indicate how to use authentication and encryption of the command channel with the FTP <b>AUTH TLS</b> command.</p>

property.name: UseCCC
property.summary: Controls the use of command encryption after authentication
property.description: <p>Overrides the Stop Command Encryption After Authentication setting in the FTP client policy for the user agent that the B2B Gateway uses. If overriding, indicate how to use command channel encryption after user authentication with the FTP <b>CCC</b> command.</p>

property.name: EncryptData
property.summary: Controls encryption of file transfers
property.description: <p>Overrides the Encrypt File Transfers setting in the FTP client policy for the user agent that the B2B Gateway uses. If overriding, indicate how to use data connection encryption with the FTP <b>PROT P</b> command.</p>

property.name: DataType
property.summary: Data type of file transfers
property.description: Overrides the Data Type setting in the FTP client policy for the user agent that the B2B Gateway uses. If overriding, indicate how to transfer data.

property.name: SlashSTOU
property.summary: Controls unique files if name contains a trailing slash
property.display: Write unique filename if trailing slash
property.description: <p>Overrides the unique filename if trailing slash setting in the FTP client policy for the user agent that the B2B Gateway uses. If overriding, indicate how to use sever-generated unique file names when the URL being written to ends in a slash.</p><p>Some FTP servers provide the <b>STOU</b> command. Use the command only if the FTP server supports this command. The <b>STOU</b> command allows the FTP server to choose the unique file name in the current directory. Using the <b>STOU</b> command does not require the client to choose a unique file name.</p><p>When enabled and a URL being written to ends in a /, the FTP server uses the <b>STOU</b> command instead of the <b>STOR</b> command.</p>

property.name: QuotedCommands
property.summary: FTP quoted commands list
property.description: <p>Overrides the Quoted Commands setting in the FTP client policy for the user agent that the B2B Gateway uses. If overriding, specify the FTP Quoted Commands List to send to the FTP server before each <b>STOU</b>, <b>STOR</b>, or <b>RETR</b> command.</p><p>A typical use would be to use <b>SITE</b> commands, such as <tt>SITE RECFM=FB</tt> for the MVS domain on a z/OS system. The commands in the list cannot be data-transfer related, such as <b>STOU</b>, <b>RETR</b>, <b>PORT</b>, <b>PASV</b>, and so forth.</p>

property.name: SizeCheck
property.summary: Constrols the use of a size check after file transfer
property.description: <p>Overrides the Size Check setting in the FTP client policy for the user agent that the B2B Gateway uses. If overriding, indicate how to use a size check after a data transfer with the FTP <b>SIZE</b> command.</p><p>If optional and the FTP server does not support the <b>SIZE</b> command, no error results. Some FTP servers, particularly vsftpd in the default configuration, provide inaccurate responses for files transferred in ASCII mode. If you get such errors, disable this feature. Alternatively, you can reconfigure vsftpd.</p>

property.name: BinaryTransferMode
property.summary: Whether to transfer the message payload in binary mode.
property.description: Controls whether to transfer the message payload in binary mode.

property.name: ASCompress
property.summary: Whether to compress messages
property.description: Controls whether to compress the body of outbound AS messages. The default behavior is off.

property.name: ASCompressBeforeSign
property.summary: Whether to compress before signing
property.description: <p>Controls whether to compress the body of outbound AS messages before signing. The default behavior is off.</p><ul><li>If enabled, compresses the message body before signing.</li><li>If disabled, signs the message before compressing the message body.</li></ul>

property.name: ASSendUnsigned
property.summary: Whether to override the signing of messages to this destination
property.description: <p>Controls whether to override the signing of messages to this destination. Whether to sign outbound message is part of the configuration of the internal partner. This property cannot be used to cause a message to be signed. The default behavior is off.</p><ul><li>If enabled, never signs messages.</li><li>If disabled, signs messages if the sender has signing credentials.</li></ul>

property.name: ASEncrypt
property.summary: Whether to encrypt messages
property.description: Controls whether to encrypt the body of outgoing AS messages. The default behavior is off.

property.name: ASEncryptCert
property.summary: Certificate to encrypt outbound AS messages
property.description: Sets the certificate that encrypts outbound messages. Use the name of a certificate.

property.name: ASMDNRequest
property.summary: Whether to request an MDN
property.description: Controls whether to request an MDN for outbound AS messages. The default behavior is off.

property.name: ASMDNRequestAsync
property.summary: Whether the MDN request is synchronous or asynchronous
property.description: <p>Controls whether the MDN request for outbound AS messages is asynchronous. The default behavior is off.</p><ul><li>If enabled, the MDN request is asynchronous</li><li>If disabled, the MDN request is synchronous</li></ul>

property.name: AS1MDNRedirectEmail
property.summary: Specifies the redirection e-mail address for an AS1 MDN
property.description: The explicit, redirection e-mail for the MDN to outbound AS1 messages. The partner that receives the outbound AS1 message will send the MDN to this e-mail address. If not specified, the redirection e-mail will be the From address of the outgoing message (the default e-mail address of the sending internal partner).

property.name: AS2MDNRedirectURL
property.summary: Redirection URL for an AS2 MDN
property.description: Specifies the explicit, redirection URL for the MDN to outbound AS2 messages.

property.name: AS3MDNRedirectURL
property.summary: Redirection URL for an AS3 MDN
property.description: Specifies the explicit, redirection URL for the MDN to outbound AS3 messages.

property.name: ASMDNRequestSigned
property.summary: Whether to request a signed MDN
property.description: Controls whether to request a signed MDN, as opposed to an unsigned one. The default behavior is off.

property.name: Retransmit
property.summary: Whether to retransmit messages
property.description: Controls whether to enable the logic for the retransmission of messages. The default behavior is off.

property.name: ACKTime
property.summary: Time to wait before the retransmission of a message.
property.description: Specifies the maximum number of seconds to wait for the acknowledgment before the retransmission of a message. Use an integer between 1 through 3600. The default value is 1800.

property.name: MaxResends
property.summary: Maximum number of retransmissions
property.description: Specifies the maximum number of times to attempt the retransmission of a message. Use an integer between 1 through 30. The default value is 3.

property.name: ASEncryptAlg
property.summary: AS Symmetric encryption algorithm
property.description: Sets the symmetric encryption algorithm that encrypts outbound AS messages.

property.name: ASMDNRequestSignedAlgs
property.summary: Which digest algorithms to request for a signed MDN
property.description: <p>Controls which digest algorithms to ask for when requesting a signed MDN. The value can be a single algorithm or any combination of two or more different algorithms that are separated by a comma. For example, <tt>md5,sha256</tt> . The default value is <tt>sha1,md5</tt> . The following algorithms are supported.</p><ul><li><tt>md5</tt></li><li><tt>sha1</tt> or <tt>sha-1</tt></li><li><tt>sha256</tt> or <tt>sha-256</tt></li><li><tt>sha384</tt> or <tt>sha-384</tt></li><li><tt>sha512</tt> or <tt>sha-512</tt></li></ul>

property.name: EBMSCpaId
property.summary: CPA ID
property.description: Specifies the CPA ID in the message that is sent to the destination partner. You can use the value to identify the sender and the recipient. This value is used when the B2B Gateway is not CPA-enforced.

property.name: EBMSService
property.summary: Value of service element in outbound ebMS2 request
property.description: Specifies the service that acts on the message. For example, <tt>urn:services:SupplierOrderProcessing</tt> . This value is used when the B2B Gateway is not CPA-enforced. The value can be a string or a URI. If a non-URI string is specified, you need to specify the value of <b>Service Type</b>.

property.name: EBMSServiceType
property.summary: Value of type attribute associated with Service
property.description: Specifies the value of the type attribute in the ebMS SOAP message. If you do not specify the service type, make sure that the service value is a URI.

property.name: EBMSAction
property.summary: Value of action element in outbound ebMS2 request
property.description: Specifies the action in a service. For example, <tt>NewPurchaseOrder</tt> . This value is used when the B2B Gateway is not CPA-enforced.

property.name: EBMSSendUnsigned
property.summary: Whether to override the signing of messages to this destination
property.description: <p>Controls whether to override the signing of messages to this destination. Whether to sign outbound message is part of the configuration of the internal partner. This property cannot be used to cause a message to be signed. The default behavior is off.</p><ul><li>If enabled, never signs messages.</li><li>If disabled, signs messages if the sender has signing credentials.</li></ul>

property.name: EBMSEncrypt
property.summary: Whether to encrypt messages
property.description: Controls whether to encrypt the body of outgoing ebMS messages. The default behavior is off.

property.name: EBMSEncryptCert
property.summary: Certificate to encrypt outbound messages
property.description: Sets the certificate that encrypts outbound messages. Use the name of a certificate.

property.name: EBMSEncryptAlg
property.summary: ebMS2 encryption algorithm
property.description: Sets the encryption algorithm that encrypts outbound ebMS2 messages.

property.name: EBMSDuplicateEliminationRequest
property.summary: Whether to request elimination of duplicate messages for outbound messages
property.description: Controls whether to request the receiving partner to check for duplicate messages for the outbound message. If enabled, the receiving business partner should ignore duplicate message received. The default behavior is on.

property.name: EBMSAckRequest
property.summary: Whether to request an Acknowledgment
property.description: Controls whether to request an Acknowledgment for outbound ebMS2 messages. The default behavior is off.

property.name: EBMSAckRequestSigned
property.summary: Whether to request a signed Acknowledgment
property.description: Controls whether to request the Acknowledgment message signed. The default behavior is off.

property.name: EBMSSyncReplyMode
property.summary: Whether the response/acknowledgment is synchronous or asynchronous
property.description: Select syncReplyMode parameter, which can be obtained from CPA, to indicate to the receiving partner whether to return the besiness response or Acknowledgment in the same connection. None means asynchronous by default.

property.name: EBMSRetry
property.summary: Whether to retransmit an unacknowledged message
property.description: Controls whether to enable the logic for the retransmission of unacknowledged outbound messages. The default behavior is off.

property.name: EBMSMaxRetries
property.summary: Maximum number of retries
property.description: Specifies the maximum number of times, which can be obtained from a CPA, to attempt the retransmission of a message. Use an integer between 1 through 30. The default value is 3, which means a message sent can potentially be sent four times (the initiative one and successive 3 retries).

property.name: EBMSRetryInterval
property.summary: Time interval of each retry attempt
property.description: Specifies the interval in seconds between retry attempts. Use any value of 1 - 3600. This default is 1800.

property.name: EBMSIncludeTimeToLive
property.summary: Lifetime of the message
property.description: Controls whether the sending partner includes the &lt;TimeToLive> element in the outbound ebMS2 message header. The &lt;TimeToLive> element indicates when the message expires. <ul><li>If the receiving partner receives the message before it expires, the receiving partner accepts the message.</li><li>If the receiving partner receives the message after it expires, the receiving partner rejects the message.</li></ul>

property.name: SSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets
property.description: The TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

property.name: SSLClient
property.summary: Set the TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets
property.description: The TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

property.name: EBMSMessageExchangePattern
property.summary: Message exchange pattern
property.description: Select the message exchange pattern (MEP) to use. The MEP defines how a business partner exchanges messages with another business partner. The default value is one-way push.

property.name: EBMSMessagePartitionChannel
property.summary: Message partition channel
property.description: When the MEP is one-way pull, specify the message partition channel (MPC) to pull message from. In the one-way pull mode, a message remains in the MPC storage until the DataPower Gateway receives an authenticated and authorized pull request.

property.name: EBMSOutboundRequestReceipt
property.summary: Whether to request a receipt for a sent message
property.description: Controls whether to request a receipt signal for a sent ebMS3 message. The default behavior is off.

property.name: EBMSOutboundRequestSignedReceipt
property.summary: Whether to request the receipt to be signed
property.description: Controls whether to request the receipt message to be signed. The default behavior is off.

property.name: EBMSOutboundReceiptReplyPattern
property.summary: Specify the pattern to send the receipt signal.
property.description: Specifies the pattern to send the receipt signal. The default behavior is response.

property.name: EBMSOutboundReceptionAwarenessNotification
property.summary: Whether to notify the message producer when the receipt for a sent message is not received
property.description: Controls whether to send a reception awareness error notification to the ebMS3 message producer. The default behavior is off. The DataPower Gateway reports a reception awareness error to the message producer if the receipt signal message is not received for a sent message.

property.name: EBMSOutboundReceptionAwarenessTimeout
property.summary: Maximum number of seconds to wait for the receipt
property.description: Specifies the maximum number of seconds to wait for the receipt signal. Enter a value in the range 3 - 7200. The default value is 300. If the DataPower Gateway does not receive the receipt signal message for a sent message after this time, the DataPower Gateway sends a reception awareness error notification to the message producer.

property.name: EBMSCompress
property.summary: Whether to compress messages
property.description: Controls whether to compress the body of outbound ebMS messages. The default behavior is off.

property.name: FamilyName
property.summary: Family name
property.description: Specifies the family name of the person to contact. A family name is the surname borne by family members.

property.name: GivenName
property.summary: Given name
property.description: Specifies the given name of the person to contact. A given name is the name used to identify an individual within a family.

property.name: Title
property.summary: Title
property.description: Specifies the title of the person to contact.

property.name: Phone
property.summary: Phone number
property.description: Specifies the telephone number to use for the person to contact.

property.name: Email
property.summary: E-mail address
property.description: Specifies the e-mail address to use for the person to contact.

value.name: never
value.summary: Never allow or reprocess a duplicate message.

value.name: always
value.summary: Always allow and reprocess a duplicate message. The DataPower Gateway uses a new record for the reprocessed transaction instead of updating the record for the previous transaction.

value.name: on-error
value.summary: Allow and reprocess a duplicate message only when an error occurs during the previous transaction. The error excludes failures in sending asynchronous MDN, ACK, or Receipt.

value.description: Request the receiver to send the receipt and error signal messages over a synchronous connection.

value.description: Request the receiver to send the receipt and error signal messages over an asynchronous connection.
