property.name: IPPreference
ForceIPPreference
property.summary: Indicate whether to restrict DNS queries to the preferred IP version.
property.description: Whether to restrict DNS queries to the preferred IP version to resolve host names. You want to force the IP preference except when both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses are in use. When not forced, the appliance resolves each host name by querying A and AAAA records and waiting for both responses or a timeout. Waiting for the response or timeout for both records can introduce unnecessary latency in DNS resolution.

property.name: LoadBalanceAlgorithm
property.summary: Set the load balancing algorithm.
property.description: The load balancing algorithm to use to resolve host names. The default algorithm is first-alive.

property.name: MaxRetries
property.summary: Set the maximum number of resolution attempts.
property.description: For the first alive algorithm, the maximum number of times to send a query to the list of name servers before an error is returned. By default, an unacknowledged resolution request is attempted 3 times.

property.name: Timeout
property.summary: Set the response timer.
property.description: For the first alive algorithm, the time that the resolver waits for a response from a DNS server. After expiry, the resolver attempts the query to a different DNS server. The default value is 5.

object.description: <p>An application domain contains the resources that support DataPower services. A DataPower supports multiple application domains. Application domains can share read access to files in their <tt>local:</tt> directory. All application domains share the contents of the <tt>store:</tt> directory.</p><p>After a user logs in to an application domain, everything the user does applies to only that application domain.</p><p>Except for the <tt>default</tt> application domain, all application domains can be restarted independently. For the <tt>default</tt> application domain, you must restart the DataPower Gateway. When an application domain or the DataPower Gateway is restarted, the persisted configuration is used. The persisted configuration can differ from the running configuration.</p><p>The configuration of an application domain can be locally stored or can be retrieved from a remote server. The use of a remote configuration file enables centralized management of application domains.</p>

object.name: DomainAvailability
object.summary: Monitors services and their front-side handlers to determine when the domain is ready to accept traffic.

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

object.description: Domain Availability monitors the services within the domain. If the operational state of any service in the domain is in the down state, then the operational state for Domain Availability goes down, indicating that all services are not up and ready to accept traffic. Otherwise, the operational state for Domain Availability is up. At startup time, Domain Availability maintains all front-side handlers in a quiesced state until the associated services are fully configured, and a log event is created, indicating that the domain is ready to process traffic.

property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: LocalAddress
property.summary: Local IP address
property.description: The address on which the service listens. The default value of 0.0.0.0 indicates that the service is active on all addresses. Local host aliases help to ease migration tasks between machines.

property.name: LocalPort
property.summary: The local TCP port number that supports server operations
property.description: Specifies the port monitored by the HTTP service. Enter a value in the range 1 - 65535. The default value is 80.

property.name: HTTPVersion
property.summary: Front side HTTP version
property.description: Select the HTTP version to use on the front (client) side connection. The default is HTTP 1.1.

property.name: PersistentConnections
property.summary: Whether to enable persistent connections
property.description: Controls whether to enable persistent connections on the front side. The default is enabled.

property.name: AllowCompression
property.summary: Whether to enable GZIP compression
property.description: Controls whether to enable GZIP compression on the front side. The default is disabled.

property.name: MaxURLLen
property.summary: Longest incoming URL that is accepted
property.description: An integer in the range 1 to 128000 that specifies the longest incoming URL that is accepted in bytes. The length includes any query string or fragment identifier. The default value is 16384.

property.name: MaxTotalHdrLen
property.summary: Maximum aggregate size of incoming headers
property.description: Specifies the maximum aggregate size of incoming HTTP headers in bytes. Enter a value in the range 5 - 128000. The default value is 128000.

property.name: MaxHdrCount
property.summary: Maximum number of HTTP request headers
property.description: Specifies the maximum number of headers that is allowed in the request message. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

property.name: MaxNameHdrLen
property.summary: Maximum length of HTTP header name
property.description: Each HTTP Header is expressed as a name and value pair. This property specifies the maximum length of the name portion of the header. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

property.name: MaxValueHdrLen
property.summary: Maximum length of HTTP header value
property.description: Each HTTP Header is expressed as a name and value pair. This property specifies the maximum length of the value portion of the header. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

property.name: MaxQueryStringLen
property.summary: Maximum query string length
property.description: The maximum length of the query string that is allowed in the client requests. The query string is the portion of the URL after the question mark (?) character. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: The TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use a TLS server profile or TLS SNI server profile.
property.description: Select an existing TLS proxy profile from the list to assign the TLS proxy profile to this handler. Click the + button to create a new TLS proxy profile and assign that TLS proxy profile to the handler.

The access control list (ACL) allows or denies access to this service based on the IP address of the client. When attached to a service, an ACL denies all access by default. To deny access to only selected addresses, first grant access to all addresses (allow 0.0.0.0) and then create deny entries for the desired hosts.

property.description: Specifies the character encoding of the original basic authentication values. Basic authentication credentials are combined and base64 encoded in the authorization header of the request. The DataPower Gateway transcodes the contents of the authorization header to UTF-8. The default value is Protocol, which indicates ISO-8859-1, Latin 1.

object.name: ErrorReportSettings

property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: UploadReport
property.summary: Whether to upload the error report to a specific destination
property.description: <p>Specify whether to upload the error report to an NFS, iSCSI (deprecated), RAID, SMTP, or FTP destination or write the error report to the local temporary directory. If you enable this feature:</p><ul><li>It enables the Failure Notification status provider, which tracks previous error reports</li><li>It changes the naming convention to include the serial number of the appliance and the timestamp, which prevents one report overwriting another</li></ul>

property.name: UseSmtp
property.summary: Whether to send e-mail notification at start-up
property.description: Specify whether to send an e-mail at start-up only that contains the error report. If you want to receive e-mail notification, use the upload error report property instead of this property.

property.name: InternalState
property.summary: Whether to include the internal state in the error report
property.description: Specify whether to include the internal state of the appliance in the error report. The internal state can be useful in diagnosing the cause of the error.

property.name: FFDCPacketCapture
property.summary: Whether to use a background packet capture
property.description: <p>Specify whether to use a background packet capture. This feature enables network packet capture for all interfaces including the internal loopback interface. When enabled, this feature runs continuously.</p><p>If the appliance encounters a problem or a user triggers the generation of an error report, the error report includes the data from this packet capture data. This data helps to determine the messages that the appliance was processing when it encountered the problem.</p>

property.name: FFDCEventLogCapture
property.summary: Whether to use a background log capture
property.description: <p>Specify whether to use a background log capture. This feature enables the capture of all log and trace points with minimal overhead. When enabled, this feature runs continuously.</p><p>If the appliance encounters a problem or a user triggers the generation of an error report, the error report includes data from this log capture. This data can help IBM Support identify the problem.</p><p>These messages are independent of messages written to log and trace targets.</p>

property.name: FFDCMemoryLeakCapture
property.summary: Whether to use automatic leak detection
property.description: <p>Specify whether to enable automatic leak detection. This feature finds gradual memory leaks that occur steadily over time. This feature does not help in situations where messages are larger than the appliance can parse.</p><p>When enabled and if memory falls below an internal threshold, the appliance tracks all memory allocations. When the appliance reaches a critical condition that will lead to a crash, it generates an error report that contains information about memory allocation.</p><p>The configuration of the Throttle Settings affects this feature. The throttle settings can prevent the appliance from reaching the internal threshold.</p>

property.name: AlwaysOnStartup
property.summary: Whether to generate an error report when the appliance reboots or reloads
property.description: <p>Specify whether the appliance generates an error report when it reboots or reloads. If this feature is enabled logs will be collected before they are overwritten when the system reloads. When the appliance reboots or reloads and when using the upload error report feature, the status provider lists <tt>on-start</tt> as the reason code. If the appliance reloads due to a crash, the status provider lists <tt>crash</tt> as the reason code.</p><p><b>Best Practices:</b></p><ul><li>In general enable this feature.</li><li>In particular when in production, enable this feature to track reloads and reboots.</li></ul>

property.name: AlwaysOnShutdown
property.summary: Whether to generate an error report when the appliance shuts down
property.description: <p>Specify whether the appliance generates an error report when it shuts down. When the appliance shuts down and when using the upload error report feature, the status provider lists <tt>on-shutdown</tt> as the reason code. If the appliance shuts down due to a crash, the status provider lists <tt>crash</tt> as the reason code.</p><p><b>Best Practices:</b></p><ul><li>In general enable this feature.</li><li>In particular when in production, enable this feature to make sure debugging information is captured when the appliance shuts down.</li></ul>

property.name: Protocol
property.summary: Protocol to use to upload the error report
property.description: Specify the protocol to use to upload the error report. Note that the selection you will see depends on your device features and licenses.

property.name: LocationIdentifier
property.summary: Text to include in the subject of an e-mail notification
property.description: Specify text to include in the subject of an e-mail notification. In general, this value should be how you identify this appliance in your environment. When using the upload error report feature, this property is not necessary. In this case, failure notification uses the serial number of the appliance and the timestamp of the error report.

property.name: SmtpServer
property.summary: Host name or IP address of the SMTP server
property.description: Specify the host name or IP address of the remote SMTP server to which to send the error report.

property.name: EmailAddress
property.summary: E-mail address of the recipient
property.description: Specify the e-mail address to which to send the error report.

property.name: EmailSenderAddress
property.summary: E-mail address of sender
property.description: Specify the e-mail address of the sender ( <tt>MAIL FROM</tt> ). If not specified, the configuration uses the e-mail address of the recipient.

property.name: FTPServer
property.summary: Host name or IP address of the FTP server
property.description: Specify the host name or IP address of the remote FTP server to which to upload the error report.

property.name: FTPPath
property.summary: Directory on FTP server to upload the error report
property.description: Specify the directory on the FTP server to which to upload the error report. Use <tt>%2F</tt> to specify an absolute path.

property.name: FTPUserAgent
property.summary: User Agent for FTP access
property.description: Specify the User Agent that describes how to connect to remote FTP servers. In addition to the FTP Policy to define the connection, ensure that this User Agent defines the basic authentication policy (user name and password) to connect to the FTP server.

property.name: NFSMount
property.summary: NFS Mount
property.description: Specify the NFS mount point to which to upload the error report.

property.name: NFSPath
property.summary: NFS Path
property.description: This describes the NFS path location for the Error Report

property.name: RaidVolume
property.summary: RAID volume
property.description: Specify the volume on the RAID array to which to upload the error report.

property.name: RaidPath
property.summary: Directory on RAID volume
property.description: Specify the directory on the RAID volume to which to upload the error report.

property.name: IScsiVolume
property.summary: iSCSI volume
property.description: <p>The iSCSI protocol is deprecated.</p><p>Specify the iSCSI volume to which to upload the error report.</p>

property.name: IScsiPath
property.summary: Directory on iSCSI volume
property.description: <p>The iSCSI protocol is deprecated.</p><p>Specify the directory on the iSCSI volume to which to upload the error report.</p>

property.name: ReportHistoryKept
property.summary: Number of local error reports to maintain
property.description: <p>Specify the maximum number of local error reports to maintain when using the upload error report feature. After reaching this limit, the next local error report overwrites the oldest local error report. Use any value of 2 - 10. The default value is 5.</p><p>This feature only applies to locally stored error reports, including temporary and Raid.</p><p>To view the history, see the Failure Notification status provider.</p>

object.description: <p>Failure notification is a serviceability tool. By default, failure notification is disabled. To use failure notification, you must enable the configuration and allow the error report to be uploaded.</p><p>The uploading of an error report allows the capture of more diagnostic information, which safely improves serviceability. Although there is a tradeoff between performance and serviceability, you should choose serviceability by enabling the following properties:</p><ul><li>Include Internal State</li><li>Background Packet Capture</li><li>Background Log Capture</li><li>Background Memory Trace</li></ul><p>When you allow the error report to be uploaded, this setting enables the Failure Notification status provider. This status provide in combination with the report history tracks the error reports that the appliance generates, the reason why the appliance generated the error report, and its upload status to the specific destination.</p><p>You can specify an NFS, iSCSI (deprecated), RAID, SMTP, or FTP destination. You can also specify the local temporary directory as the destination. The appliance generates error reports, the naming convention includes the serial number of the appliance and the timestamp of the report. This naming convention prevents one report from overwriting another.</p><p>You can use Event Triggers to generate error reports automatically when specific events occur.</p>

property.description: <p>Specify the IP address and netmask for each destination network address. The netmask is in CIDR format is the integer that specifies the prefix length.</p><ul><li>For IPv4, the prefix length can be in the range 0 - 32.</li><li>For IPv6, the prefix length can be in the range 0 - 128.</li></ul>
