object.name: GatewayPeering
object.summary: A gateway peering configuration synchronizes the distributed state.

property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>
Specifies a brief, descriptive summary for the configuration.
property.summary: A descriptive summary for the configuration
property.name: UserSummary
LocalAddress
property.summary: Management address that the gateway service listens on
property.description: <p>Specifies the management address of the member that the gateway service listens on. The IP address can be the address of any DataPower network interface and must be accessible by other peers in the peer group. The IP address cannot be 127.0.0.1, 0.0.0.0 or ::. When gateway peering is peer group mode, this IP address uniquely identifies the API gateway among a peer group.</p><p>You can use a local host alias instead of a static IP address. A host alias resolves a locally configured alias to a static IP address. Aliasing can help when you move configurations.</p>

property.name: LocalPort
property.summary: TCP port that the gateway service listens on
property.description: <p>Indicates the TCP port that the gateway service listens on. The default port is 16380.</p><p><b>Note:</b> When gateway peering is peer group mode, ensure that all peers in a group use the same TCP port.</p>

property.name: MonitorPort
property.summary: Monitor port that is used for state synchronization
property.description: <p>Specifies the port to listen for state synchronization. The default port is 26380.</p><p><b>Note:</b> When gateway peering is peer group mode, ensure that all peers in a group use the same monitor port.</p>

property.name: EnablePeerGroup
property.summary: Whether to enable the peer group mode
property.description: Indicates whether the API gateway is defined to work in peer group mode. <ul><li>When disabled, the API gateway works in standalone mode.</li><li>When enabled, you can add peers for the API gateway. In peer group mode, distributed state and configuration data is synchronized across API gateway members of the peer group. This setting is the default setting.</li></ul>

property.name: Peers
property.summary: Management address of the peer members
property.description: <p>Specifies a list of peers for the current member. To add a peer, enter the management address of the target member. The member connects to each peer in the order that the peers are added in the list. It is not necessary to specify all peers in the list. When you add a peer into the group, the DataPower Gateway checks whether this peer is defined for any existent peer group:</p><ul><li>When no existent group is found, the current member is the primary member of a new peer group.</li><li>When an existent group is found, the current member joins the existent group as a secondary member.</li></ul><p>You can use a local host alias instead of a static IP address. A host alias resolves a locally configured alias to a static IP address. Aliasing can help when you move configurations among gateways.</p><p><b>Note:</b> Do not specify the IP address or hostname of this gateway peering configuration.</p>

property.name: Priority
property.summary: The priority of the peer member
property.description: <p>Indicates the priority that is used to elect the new primary. When failover occurs, the secondary member with the lowest priority number is promoted as the new primary.</p><p>Enter a value in the range 0 - 255. The default value is 100. A secondary member with priority of 0 can never be promoted.</p>

property.name: EnableSSL
property.summary: Whether to enable TLS for secure connection
property.description: <p>Indicates whether to use TLS to secure the connection among the members in the peer group. By default, TLS is enabled.</p><p><b>Note:</b> When gateway peering is peer group mode, ensure that all peers in a group use the same TLS configuration.</p>

property.name: Idcred
property.summary: The identification credentials that contains the credentials that the current member uses to identify itself to other peers.
property.description: Optionally specifies the identification credentials that the current member uses to identify itself to other peers. Client authentication uses mutual TLS.

property.name: Valcred
property.summary: The validation credentials to validate the client certificate during the handshake.
property.description: Specify the validation credentials to validate the client certificate during the handshake.

property.name: SSLCryptoKey
property.summary: Private key alias
property.description: Specifies the alias of the private key that the current member uses to secure the connection with its peers.

property.name: SSLCryptoCertificate
property.summary: Certificate alias
property.description: Specifies the alias of the public key that the peers use to negotiate secure connection to the current member.

property.name: PersistenceLocation
property.summary: Whether to store the data in the memory, local filestore, or RAID volume
property.description: <p>Specifies where the peering data resides. When in the peer group mode, ensure that all peers in a group store data in the same location. <ul><li>When you select <tt>memory</tt> , the data is stored in the memory and cannot persist across a restart. This setting is the default value.</li><li>When you select <tt>local</tt> , the data is stored in the local filestore and can persist across a restart.</li><li>When you select <tt>raid</tt> , the data is stored in the RAID partition that can persist across a restart.</li></ul></p>

property.name: LocalDirectory
property.summary: Local filestore directory to persist the peering data in
property.description: When the persistence location is <tt>local</tt> , specifies the local filestore directory to persist the peering data in. Example: <tt>local:///my_directory</tt>

property.name: MaxMemory
property.summary: The maximum memory size allowed for the gateway peering to use. The default value is 0, which means no limits.
property.description: Do not allow the gateway peering to use more memory than the specified amount of bytes. When the memory limit is reached, gateway peering will attempt to remove keys according to least recently used (LRU) algorithm.

object.description: <p>The gateway peering configuration can work in standalone or in peer group mode. Standalone mode should be used for only development or testing purposes. When you enable peer group mode, you can add peers to the group and configure the connection among the peers.</p>

property.name: DependentRules

object.description: The Generated Policy consists of generated configuration objects, such as Processing Rules. Generated configuration objects are automatically created based on the policy associated with a service. An example of a generated policy is a WS-Policy attached to a WSDL binding in a Web Service Proxy. This configuration ensures that the operational state of the service depends on the state of the Generated Policy and the state of the generated configuration objects.

value.description: The expected encoding is plain text and the requested processing is to XML escape the input. All &lt;, >, and &amp; characters are replaced by &amp;lt;, &amp;gt;, and &amp;amp; respectively. This option is synonymous with URL-encoded, because URL-encoding in an HTTP GET or POST is always decoded.
value.name: plain

value.description: The expected encoding is URL-encoded, as in HTML forms, and the requested processing is to URL unescape, then XML escape the input. All &lt;, >, and &amp; characters are replaced by &amp;lt;, &amp;gt;, and &amp;amp; respectively.
value.name: urlencoded

value.description: The expected encoding is an XML fragment and the requested processing, because the input is a literal, is no processing. If the fragment includes a leading XML declaration (of the form &lt;?xml ?>), the declaration is removed. All other characters are passed unchanged. The input must be a balanced block of XML. If not balanced, the generated XML will not parse correctly. This option is synonymous with URL-encoded XML, because URL-encoding in an HTTP GET or POST is always decoded.
value.name: xml

value.description: The expected encoding is a URL-encoded XML fragment and the requested processing, because the input is a literal, is no processing. If the fragment includes a leading XML declaration (of the form &lt;?xml ?>), the declaration is removed. All other characters are passed unchanged. The input must be a balanced block of XML. If not balanced, the generated XML will not parse correctly.
value.name: urlencoded-xml

value.description: The expected encoding is Base 64 and the requested processing is to pass the input through but add the XML attribute encoding="base64" to the generated &lt;arg> element for each argument which has this input encoding. If the base 64 data should include any illegal &lt;, >, or &amp; character, it is replaced by &amp;lt;, &amp;gt;, and &amp;amp; respectively.
value.name: base64

value.description: The expected encoding is a JSON structure and the requested processing is convert to XML according to the JSONx XML specification. JSON content cannot be specified as part of a multipart form and is only supported as the default encoding. When specifying JSON as the default encoding type, a name-value encoding map is not used.
value.name: json

type.description: Controls how the value in an HTTP form is traslated to generate XML. All of the options start with URL-decoding, except in an HTTP MIME POST. URL-decoding is not required for an HTTP MIME POST.
type.name: dmHTTPInputEncoding

property.description: The PCRE pattern that will be matched against the name of an HTTP form field. If the name matches this PCRE, the associated value will be processed by the rules of the Encoding. If a form field has no name, an empty string is used for the pattern matching.
property.summary: The PCRE to match an HTTP form name against.
property.name: InputMatch

property.description: Select how to translate the value of a form field to the contents of the &lt;arg> element in the generated XML.
property.summary: The Encoding used for values whose name matches the Input Match

property.description: Select the default encoding to use for any name-value pair in an HTTP form where the name does not match any of the patterns in the Encoding Map.
property.summary: The default Encoding that each value is assumed to have.
property.name: DefaultInputEncoding
InputEncoding
property.summary: A map from HTTP form name patterns to Encoding rule.
property.description: This allows selecting the Encoding for values based on their name. The names are matched by PCREs. Each PCRE is associated with an Encoding that controls how the value is mapped to the contents of an &lt;arg> element in the resulting XML. This is an ordered list, comparision of the name proceeds until the first match. If there is no match, the Encoding will be selected by the Default Encoding of this HTTP Input Conversion Map.

object.description: This defines the rules for handling HTTP to XML conversion of form values in an HTTP GET or POST of a form. There are different conversion (Encoding) rules for the values. They control how the value is mapped to the contents of its &lt;arg> element in the resulting XML. There is a default Encoding, which is all that is required. There can also be specific Encodings applied to values based on the name associated with a value, which is done using an ordered list of PCREs.

property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>

A descriptive summary for the configuration.
property.summary: Enter a descriptive summary for the configuration.
property.name: UserSummary
LocalAddress
property.label: IP address
property.summary: Enter the IP address or host alias on which the HTTPS handler listens.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the IP address or host alias on which the HTTPS handler listens. The default value indicates that The handler listens on all IPv4 addresses.
property.description: The address on which the HTTPS handler listens. The default value 0.0.0.0 indicates that The handler listens on all IPv4 addresses.

property.name: LocalPort
property.summary: Enter the port on which the HTTPS handler listens.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the port on which the HTTPS handler listens. The default value is 443.
property.description: The port on which the HTTPS handler listens. The default value is 443.

property.name: HTTPVersion
property.summary: Set the HTTP version for client side connections.
property.description: The HTTP version for client side connections. The default value is HTTP 1.1. For the HTTP/2 protocol, requests and responses are always HTTP/2. When HTTP/2, this setting is ignored.

property.name: AllowedFeatures
property.summary: Set the methods and versions to allow for incoming requests.
property.description: The methods and versions to allow for incoming requests.

property.name: PersistentConnections
property.summary: Indicate whether to negotiate persistent client side connections.
property.description: Whether to negotiate persistent client side connections. The default is enabled. The HTTP/2 protocol controls persistent connections and reuse. Therefore, these settings are ignored.

property.name: MaxPersistentConnectionsReuse
property.summary: Enter the maximum number of times a persistent client side connection is reused.
property.description: The maximum number of times a persistent client side connection is reused. When the maximum reuse count is reached, an explicit <tt>HTTP Connection: close</tt> header is sent in the response, and the TCP connection is closed. The default value is 0, which means unlimited reuse.

property.name: AllowCompression
property.summary: Indicate whether to negotiate GZIP compression for client side connections.
property.description: <p>Whether to negotiate GZIP compression for client side connections.</p><p>The default is disabled. If enabled, the DataPower service uses GZIP to compress HTTP transmissions when the <tt>Accept-Encoding</tt> HTTP header indicates that compressed documents can be processed.</p><p>The <tt>Transfer-Encoding</tt> HTTP header indicates compression.</p>

property.name: AllowWebSocketUpgrade
property.summary: Indicate whether to allow WebSocket upgrade requests from clients.
property.description: Whether to allow WebSocket upgrade requests from clients. The default is disabled. This request is to switch the existing connection to use the WebSocket protocol. WebSocket upgrade requests require that The handler allows GET methods.

property.name: WebSocketIdleTimeout
property.summary: Enter the maximum idle time for client connections.
property.description: The maximum idle time for client connections. This timer monitors the idle time in the data transfer process. When the specified idle time is exceeded, the connection is torn down. Enter a value in the range 0 - 86400. The default value is 0, which indicates that the timer is disabled.

property.name: MaxURLLen
property.summary: Enter the length of the longest incoming URL to accept.
property.description: The length of the longest incoming URL to accept. The length includes any query string or fragment identifier. Enter a value in the range 1 - 128000. The default value is 16384.

property.name: MaxTotalHdrLen
property.summary: Enter the maximum aggregate length of HTTP headers to allow.
property.description: The maximum aggregate length of HTTP headers to allow. Enter a value in the range 5 - 128000. The default value is 128000.

property.name: MaxHdrCount
property.summary: Enter the maximum number of headers to allow in client requests.
property.description: The maximum number of headers to allow in client requests. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

property.name: MaxNameHdrLen
property.summary: Enter the maximum length of a header name to allow in client requests.
property.description: The maximum length of a header name to allow in client requests. Each HTTP header is expressed as a name-value pair. This setting sets the maximum length of the name portion of a header. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

property.name: MaxValueHdrLen
property.summary: Enter the maximum length of a header value to allow in client requests.
property.description: The maximum length of a header value to allow in client requests. Each HTTP header is expressed as a name-value pair. This setting sets the maximum length of the value portion of a header. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

property.name: MaxQueryStringLen
property.summary: Enter the maximum length of the query string to allow in client requests.
property.description: The maximum length of the query string to allow in client requests. The query string is the portion of the URL after the question mark (?) character. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.
The access control list uses the defined client IP addresses to allow or deny access.
property.summary: Assign the access control list.
property.name: ACL
CredentialCharset
property.summary: Set the character encoding of the original basic authentication values.
property.description: The character encoding of the original basic authentication values. Basic authentication credentials are combined and base64 encoded in the authorization header of the request. The DataPower Gateway transcodes the contents of the authorization header to UTF-8. The default value represents ISO-8859-1 Latin 1.

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: The TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use a TLS server profile or TLS SNI server profile.
property.description: The TLS proxy profile with the cryptographic profiles to secure connections.

property.name: SSLServerConfigType
property.summary: Set the TLS profile type to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway
property.description: The TLS profile type to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway.

property.name: SSLServer
property.summary: Set the TLS server profile to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway
property.description: <p>The TLS server profile to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway.</p><p><b>Note:</b> The TLS server profile that secures the HTTP/2 connection must use the TLS 1.2 or better protocol with a cipher that is secure according to RFC 7540.</p>

property.name: SSLSNIServer
property.summary: Set the TLS SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway
property.description: <p>The TLS SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway.</p><p><b>Note:</b> The TLS SNI server profile that secures the HTTP/2 connection must use the TLS 1.2 or better protocol with a cipher that is secure according to RFC 7540.</p>

property.name: HTTP2MaxStreams
property.summary: Enter the maximum number of current streams that a client can have
property.description: <p>The maximum number of concurrent streams that the client can have outstanding at the same time with The handler. The limit applies to the number of streams that the client allows the target to create.</p><p>The greater the number of streams in use, the more resources the client uses. Resources include memory and the network connections to the destination.</p><p>Enter a value in the range 1 - 500. The default value is 100.</p>

property.name: HTTP2MaxFrameSize
property.summary: Enter the largest payload frame size that clients can send
property.description: The largest payload frame size that the client can send. Enter a value in the range 16384 - 16777215. The default value is 16384.

property.name: HTTP2StreamHeader
property.summary: Whether to enable the HTTP/2 stream identifier header in the request or response
property.description: <p>Indicates whether to enable the HTTP/2 stream identifier header in the request or response. When enabled, the HTTP/2 stream identifier is included in the <tt>X-DP-http2-stream</tt> header. With this header, you can correlate the HTTP/2 stream. The default behavior is disabled.</p>

property.name: ChunkedEncoding
property.summary: Whether to enable the responses to use Transfer-Encoding: chunked
property.description: When enabled, the HTTP response will use Transfer-Encoding: chunked. The default behavior is enabled.

property.name: LocalAddress

property.description: <p>Enter a host alias or the IP address that the service listens on. Host aliases can ease migration tasks among appliances.</p><ul><li>0 or 0.0.0.0 indicates all configured IPv4 addresses.</li><li>:: indicates all configured IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.</li></ul><p><b>Attention:</b> For management services, the value of 0.0.0.0 or :: is a security risk. Use an explicit IP address to isolate management traffic from application data traffic.</p>

If no Start Page file exists in this directory, the server will return an automatically generated index of the contents of the directory.

A descriptive summary for the configuration.
property.summary: Enter a descriptive summary for the configuration.
property.name: UserSummary
LocalAddress
property.label: IP address
property.summary: Enter the IP address or host alias on which the HTTP handler listens.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the IP address or host alias on which the HTTP handler listens. The default value indicates that The handler listens on all IPv4 addresses.
property.description: The address on which the HTTP handler listens. The default value indicates that The handler listens on all IPv4 addresses.

property.name: LocalPort
property.summary: Enter the port on which the HTTP handler listens.
property.hoverhelp: Enter the port on which the HTTP handler listens. The default value is 80.
property.description: The port on which the HTTP handler listens. The default value is 80.

property.name: SocketPath
property.summary: Unix domain socket Path.
property.description: Unix domain socket Path.

property.name: HTTPVersion
property.summary: Set the HTTP version for the client side connection.
property.description: The HTTP version for the client side connection. The default value is HTTP 1.1. For the HTTP/2 protocol, requests and responses are always HTTP/2. When HTTP/2, this setting is ignored.

property.name: AllowedFeatures
property.summary: Set the methods and versions to allow for incoming requests.
property.description: The methods and versions to allow for incoming requests.

property.name: PersistentConnections
property.summary: Indicate whether to negotiate persistent client side connections.
property.description: Whether to negotiate persistent client side connections. The HTTP/2 protocol controls persistent connections and reuse. Therefore, these settings are ignored.

property.name: MaxPersistentConnectionsReuse
property.summary: Enter the maximum number of times a persistent client side connection is reused.
property.description: The maximum number of times a persistent client side connection is reused. When the maximum reuse count is reached, an explicit <tt>HTTP Connection: close</tt> header is sent in the response, and the TCP connection is closed. The default value is 0, which means unlimited reuse.

property.name: AllowCompression
property.summary: Indicate whether to negotiate GZIP compression for client side connections.
property.description: <p>Whether to negotiate GZIP compression for client side connections.</p><p>If enabled, the DataPower service uses GZIP to compress HTTP transmissions when the <tt>Accept-Encoding</tt> HTTP header indicates that compressed documents can be processed.</p><p>The <tt>Transfer-Encoding</tt> HTTP header indicates compression.</p>

property.name: AllowWebSocketUpgrade
property.summary: Indicate whether to allow WebSocket upgrade requests from clients.
property.description: Whether to allow WebSocket upgrade requests from clients. The default is disabled. This request is to switch the existing connection to use the WebSocket protocol. WebSocket upgrade requests require that The handler allows GET methods.

property.name: WebSocketIdleTimeout
property.summary: Enter the maximum idle time for client connections.
property.description: The maximum idle time for client connections. This timer monitors the idle time in the data transfer process. When the specified idle time is exceeded, the connection is torn down. Enter a value in the range 0 - 86400. The default value is 0, which indicates that the timer is disabled.

property.name: MaxURLLen
property.summary: Enter the length of the longest incoming URL to accept.
property.description: The length of the longest incoming URL to accept. The length includes any query string or fragment identifier. Enter a value in the range 1 - 128000. The default value is 16384.

property.name: MaxTotalHdrLen
property.summary: Enter the maximum aggregate length of HTTP headers to allow.
property.description: The maximum aggregate length of HTTP headers to allow. Enter a value in the range 5 - 128000. The default value is 128000.

property.name: MaxHdrCount
property.summary: Enter the maximum number of headers to allow in client requests.
property.description: The maximum number of headers to allow in client requests. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

property.name: MaxNameHdrLen
property.summary: Enter the maximum length of a header name to allow in client requests.
property.description: The maximum length of a header name to allow in client requests. Each HTTP header is expressed as a name-value pair. This setting sets the maximum length of the name portion of a header. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

property.name: MaxValueHdrLen
property.summary: Enter the maximum length of a header value to allow in client requests.
property.description: The maximum length of a header value to allow in client requests. Each HTTP header is expressed as a name-value pair. This setting sets the maximum length of the value portion of a header. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

property.name: MaxQueryStringLen
property.summary: Enter the maximum length of the query string to allow in client requests.
property.description: The maximum length of the query string to allow in client requests. The query string is the portion of the URL after the question mark (?) character. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.
The access control list uses the defined client IP addresses to allow or deny access.
property.summary: Assign the access control list.
property.name: ACL

property.description: The character encoding of the original basic authentication values. Basic authentication credentials are combined and base64 encoded in the authorization header of the request. The DataPower Gateway transcodes the contents of the authorization header to UTF-8. The default value represents ISO-8859-1 Latin 1.
property.summary: Set the character encoding of the original basic authentication values.
property.name: CredentialCharset
HTTP2MaxStreams
property.summary: Enter the maximum number of current streams that a client can have
property.description: <p>The maximum number of concurrent streams that the client can have outstanding at the same time with The handler. The limit applies to the number of streams that the client allows the target to create.</p><p>The greater the number of streams in use, the more resources the client uses. Resources include memory and the network connections to the destination.</p><p>Enter a value in the range 1 - 500. The default value is 100.</p>

property.name: HTTP2MaxFrameSize
property.summary: Enter the largest payload frame size that clients can send
property.description: The largest payload frame size that the client can send. Enter a value in the range 16384 - 16777215. The default value is 16384.

property.name: HTTP2StreamHeader
property.summary: Whether to enable the HTTP/2 stream identifier header in the request or response
property.description: <p>Indicates whether to enable the HTTP/2 stream identifier header in the request or response. When enabled, the HTTP/2 stream identifier is included in the <tt>X-DP-http2-stream</tt> header. With this header, you can correlate the HTTP/2 stream. The default behavior is disabled.</p>

property.name: ChunkedEncoding
property.summary: Whether to enable the responses to use Transfer-Encoding: chunked
property.description: When enabled, the HTTP response will use Transfer-Encoding: chunked. The default behavior is enabled.

property.summary: Stops command encryption after authentication
property.description: Select how to control the cessation of FTP command channel encryption after user authentication. Encryption must be stopped for compatibility with NAT (Network Address Translation) and other firewall applications. Although this might be a security risk, there is no other option when NAT is in use.

property.name: EncryptData

property.description: Select how to control encryption of file transfers. Compatible with NAT in all settings.

property.name: DataType

property.name: SlashSTOU
property.summary: Creates a unique file if the name contains a trailing slash
property.display: Write Unique Filename if Trailing Slash
property.description: <p>Select how to create unique files if the name contains a trailing slash.</p><p>Some FTP servers provide the STOU command. Use the command only if the FTP server supports this command. The STOU command allows the server to choose the unique file name in the current directory. Using the STOU command does not require the client to choose a unique file name.</p><p>When enabled and a URL is given to write that ends in a /, the server uses the STOU command instead of the STOR command.</p>

This specifies a list of FTP commands to be sent to the server before each FTP STOR, STOU, or RETR command. A typical use would be to use "SITE" commands, such as "SITE RECFM=FB" for the MVS domain on a z/OS system. These commands cannot be data-transfer related, such as STOU, RETR, PORT, PASV, etc.
property.name: QuotedCommands
property.summary: Quoted Commands

property.description: If set to Optional, do a size check after the file transfer is complete. This uses the SIZE command, and compares the returned number to the number of bytes transferred "over the wire" for the file transfer. If the number is not equal, the file transfer is marked as failing. If the FTP server does not support the SIZE command, no error results. Some FTP servers, particularly vsftpd in the default configuration, provide inaccurate SIZE responses for files transferred in ASCII mode. If you get such errors, you can disable this feature. (Alternately you can reconfigure vsftpd.)
property.summary: Perform Size check after file transfer
property.name: SizeCheck

type.name: dmFTPCCCPolicy

value.name: ccc-off

type.display: FTP Stop Encryption After Authentication Policy

value.description: Even when the command channel is encrypted, do not encrypt FTP data connections. Use the FTP PROT C command when the command channel is or has been encrypted.
value.name: enc-data-off

value.description: Request encryption of FTP data connections using the FTP PROT P command. Required when the command channel is or has been encrypted. Do not fail if server does not support data encryption.

value.description: Request encryption of FTP data connections using the FTP PROT P command. Required when the command channel is or has been encrypted. Fail if server does not support data encryption.
value.name: enc-data-req

value.description: Transfer files as ASCII data. This mode allow standardization of end-of-line conventions between different operating systems. This mode increases the overhead at both ends. Uses the FTP TYPE A command.
value.name: ascii

value.description: Transfer files as image data. This mode transfers data as binary 8-bit bytes. This mode is more efficient (less overhead at both ends). Some XML files, such as signed files, must be transferred in this mode. Uses the FTP TYPE I command.
value.name: binary

value.description: <p>Always use the supplied file name in the URL to generate the target file name requested on the server. If the URL ends in a slash, the request generally fails.</p><p>Uses the FTP STOR command to initiate the transfer. The STOR command is only a directory specification, without a file name specification.</p>
value.name: slash-stou-off

value.display: Request Unique File Name When Trailing Slash
value.description: <p>If the supplied file name ends in a slash, use the STOU command to write a unique file name. The slash must be before the ? that initiates the query parameters or before the ; that begins the suffix.</p><p>Uses the FTP STOU command to initiate the transfer and requests that the server generate a unique file name within the target directory. This approach is the only safe way to have multiple systems write files to the same directory without overwriting any files.</p><p>The transfer fails if the FTP server does not support the STOU command.</p>
value.name: slash-stou-on

value.description: If the FTP SIZE command is available, uses this command to check the file transfer size after file transfer.
value.name: size-check-optional

object.name: HTTPUserAgent

property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.description: An optional string that specifies the contents of the User-Agent request-header field. By default, a User Agent request-header field is not transmitted.
property.summary: User Agent request-header field contents
property.name: Identifier
MaxRedirects
property.summary: Maximum number of redirects
property.description: An integer (within the range 0 through 128, with a default of 8) that specifies the maximum number of HTTP redirect messages received before the target URL is declared unreachable.

property.name: Timeout
property.summary: Seconds of Idle time Allowed
property.description: An integer (within the range 1 through 86400, with a default of 300) that specifies the maximum amount of idle time on an established connection before the connection is aborted.

property.name: ProxyPolicies
property.summary: User Agent policy definition
property.description: Configure a proxy policy that associates a set of URLs with a specific HTTP proxy

property.name: SSLPolicies
property.summary: User Agent TLS policy definition
property.description: Configure a policy that associates a set of URLs with a specific TLS Profile. Whenever the Agent is given a URL that matches the set defined, it will use the corresponding TLS Profile for TLS communications with the resource.

property.name: BasicAuthPolicies
property.summary: User Agent policy definition
property.description: Configure a proxy policy that associates a set of URLs with a specific username and password for Basic-Auth authentication.

property.name: SoapActionPolicies
property.summary: User Agent policy definition
property.description: Configure a policy that associates a set of URLs with a specific Soap-Action HTTP header

property.name: PubkeyAuthPolicies
property.summary: User Agent policy definition
property.description: Configure a proxy policy that associates a set of URLs with a specific private key for Pubkey authentication. Note that this setting defines the private key used in Pubkey authentication; the remote host to which the Agent is connecting must possess and reference the corresponding certificate in order to successfully communicate.

property.name: AllowCompressionPolicies
property.summary: Enable Compression policy definition
property.description: The User Agent will compress messages that are sent to URLs that match the URL Matching Expression.

property.name: HeaderRetentionPolicies
property.summary: Header Retention policy definition
property.description: The User Agent retains the specified headers in messages that are sent to URLs that match the URL Matching Expression.

property.name: Restrict10Policies
property.summary: Restrict to HTTP 1.0 Policy
property.description: Associate a set of URLs with a specific policy limiting http request versions to 1.0. This policy is cumulative - if any transaction, url match, or gateway should have a restrictive policy, that transaction will be carried out at HTTP/1.0.

property.name: AddHeaderPolicies
property.summary: Inject Header Policy
property.description: Configure one or more URL Match Expressions and corresponding Header Injection Policies. If the URL matches the expression, the corresponding HTTP Header is injected into the message.

property.name: UploadChunkedPolicies
property.summary: Enabled/Disable HTTP/1.1 Chunked Request Bodies
property.description: When the device employs the HTTP/1.1 protocol, the body of the document can be delimited by either Content-Length or chunked encodings. While all servers will understand how to interpret Content-Length, many applications will fail to understand Chunked encoding. For this reason, Content-Length is the standard method used. However doing so interferes with the ability of the device to fully stream. To stream full documents towards the back end server, this property should be turned on. However, the back end server must be RFC 2616 compatible, because this feature cannot be renegotiated at run time, unlike all other HTTP/1.1 features which can be negotiated down at runtime if necessary.

property.name: FTPPolicies
property.summary: FTP Client Policies
property.description: Associate a set of FTP URLs with a specific policy that controls the default values of many client options for outgoing connections. These settings override the compiled-in defaults and can be further overridden by query parameters in the URL that initiates the file transfer.

property.name: SMTPPolicies
property.summary: SMTP Client Policies
property.description: Associate a set of SMTP URLs with a specific policy that controls the default values of many client options for outgoing connections. These settings override the compiled-in defaults and can be further overridden by query parameters in the URL that sends the e-mail message.

property.name: SFTPPolicies
property.summary: SFTP Client Policies
property.description: Associate a set of SFTP URLs with a specific policy that controls the default values of many SSH client options for outgoing connections. These settings override the compiled-in defaults and can be further overridden by query parameters in the URL that initiates the file transfer.

object.description: <p>Use this page to configure a User Agent, which the device uses to retrieve resources (for example, stylesheets or XML documents) from remote servers.</p><p>A User Agent can also affect the messages emitted by a Multi-Protocol Gateway</p>

IPAddress
property.summary: Enter the local IP address that corresponds to the alias.
property.description: The local IP address that corresponds to the alias.

object.description: A host alias is a map between a local IP address to a local alias. The host alias is resolved like a static host entry. Host aliases provide a level of abstraction between concrete network addresses and configuration. You can use host aliases where you can define local IP addresses. Host aliases ease the export and migration of service among DataPower appliances. The alias is exported, but the alias map is not. If the alias is defined on the destination system, the alias resolves to the IP address that is defined on the destination system.

object.description: <p>For DataPower Gateway for VMware, you can create IBM License Metric Tool packages on a schedule or on demand. Independent of how you create packages, these packages with the scan results are created in the <tt>local:///ilmt/output</tt> directory. The package name includes the time stamp of when the package was created.</p><p>By default, the DataPower Gateway does not create ILMT packages. <ul><li>To create packages on a schedule, you must enable the disconnected ILMT scanner. When enabled, packages are once a week. You can change scan interval.</li><li>To create a package on demand, you force a scan.</li></ul></p>

property.description: Specifies the IMS OTMA tpipe names. A tpipe is also known as an alternate client ID. The value can be up to eight characters in length and cannot be blank. The value can use all alphanumeric characters and the following special characters: @ # $.

property.name: RetryErrorLimit
property.summary: Number of times to attempt to resume a tpipe
property.description: Specifies the number of times to attempt to resume a transaction pipe (tpipe) after processing encounters an error. Enter a value in the range 1 - 256. The default value is 5.

property.name: RetryInterval
property.summary: Interval to wait before processing attempts to resume the tpipe
property.description: Specifies the number of seconds to wait before processing attempts to resume the transaction pipe (tpipe). The minimum value is 1. The default value is 3.

property.name: ConnectTimeout
property.summary: Time to wait to establish a connection
property.description: Specifies the number of seconds that the DataPower Gateway waits to establish a connection to IMS Connect. A value of 0 disables the timeout. The default value is 10.

property.name: ResponseConcurrency
property.summary: Number of response processors to allocate for concurrent transactions processing.
property.description: <p>Specifies the number of response processors to allocate for each tpipe for concurrent transaction processing. Enter a value in the range 1 - 32. The default value is 1.</p><p>For example, when you set response concurrency to 2 and you have 5 tpipe definitions, the number of response processors is 10. The maximum number of response processors is 50.</p>

property.name: TraceFile
property.summary: Location for the trace file
property.description: Enables IMS tracing and specifies the location of the trace file. You can use the following directories as the location when you enable tracing: <ul><li>logtemp</li><li>logstore</li><li>temporary</li></ul><p><b>Note:</b> Enable tracing when instructed by IBM Support to help in problem determination.</p><p>If you enabled tracing and want to disable, remove the directory and apply the configuration.</p>

property.description: <p>Specify the exit identifier to use for all the IMS connections. If no exit identifier is specified, *SAMPLE* is used.</p><p>The appliance supports the standard exit identifiers *SAMPLE* and *SAMPL1* and any identifiers that implement exits that conform to these wire protocols. If *SAMPL1*, or an identifier that conforms to *SAMPL1* wire protocol, is specified, set the Expect LLLL Response Header property to "on". Otherwise, the Expect LLLL Response Header property must be set to "off".</p>

property.name: Exit
EBCDICConversion
property.summary: Convert headers to EBCDIC
property.description: This option can be turned on for converting the headers to EBCDIC. The IMS Connect exit should be able to process EBCDIC data. Some IMS Connect exits can handle both UTF-8 and EBCDIC. This conversion affects only the headers. Any data conversion should be done in the policy using transformation.
Select the Unicode encoding schema. Leave as (none) to be set dynamically in the IMS header. (For example, in the IMS proxy scenario, incoming IMS header value could be used directly.)
property.summary: Encoding scheme

IRMTimer
property.summary: IRM Timer values
property.description: Set the IRM_TIMER value to an appropriate wait time for IMS to return data to IMS Connect. See the IMS Connect documentation for details. An example value of 21 sets an IRM Timer value of 0.21 sec.
Two letter prefix for the generated client ID. "DP" is used if not specified.
property.name: GenerateClientIDPrefix
property.summary: Generate Client ID Prefix

property.name: MaxSegmentSize
property.summary: Maximum Segment Size
property.description: Specify "0" (OFF) or an integer in the range 1 - 32 that represents the segment size in kilobytes. The default value is 0, which disables segmentation.

property.name: ExpectLLLLHeader
property.summary: Expect 4-Byte LLLL Response Message Header
property.description: Indicates whether the response message includes an extra 4-byte LLLL header that specifies the total response message size back from IMS Connect. The default value is off.

<p>Indicates whether the Sync Level is 0x00 (NONE) or 0x01 (CONFIRM). The default value is 0x00 (NONE).</p><p>When communicating with the IMS Connect server and a transaction is specified with a Sync Level of 0x01 (CONFIRM), the client must send an ACK (successful) or a NAK (unsuccessful) after processing the response. The IMS Connect server then sends DEALLOCATE CONFIRM (successful) or DEALLOCATE ABORT (unsuccessful) back to the client.</p><p>The appliance always sends an ACK upon receiving the response and then checks for the DEALLOCATE CONFIRM.</p>
property.summary: Sync Level: 0x00 (NONE) or 0x01 (CONFIRM)
property.name: SyncLevel
CommitMode
property.summary: Commit Mode: 0 or 1
property.description: Commit mode 0 (CM0) is known as commit-then-send, which is the IMS standard flow. When set to 0, IMS processes the transaction and commits the data before the response is returned to the DataPower service. The default commit mode is 1.

property.name: PurgeNotDeliv
property.summary: Whether to purge or queue undeliverable transactions
property.description: <p>Indicates whether to purge or queue undeliverable IMS transaction output that use commit mode 0. Undeliverable transaction output is when the IMS output cannot be returned to the OTMA client application that initiated the transaction. The OTMA client application is the DataPower service that initiated the original transaction. The default behavior is to queue undeliverable transaction output.</p><ul><li>When purge, the IRM_F3_PURGE flag is set in the IRM_F3 field. This flag with commit mode 0 configures IMS to purge transaction output when the IMS output cannot be delivered or returned to the DataPower appliance.</li><li>When queue, IMS stores undeliverable transaction output on the asynchronous hold queue. The undeliverable IMS output message remains on the IMS hold queue until you run the /DEQ TMEMBER TPIPE command to clean up the queue.</li></ul>

property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation
property.name: UserSummary
JSONMaxNestingDepth
property.summary: Maximum number of levels to nest label-value pairs.
property.description: The maximum nesting depth provides threat protection by limiting the number of nested label-value pairs allowed in the JSON message. Enter a value in the range 64 - 256. The default value is 64.

property.name: JSONMaxLabelLength
property.summary: Maximum length of the label portion of label-value pairs.
property.description: The maximum label length limits the number of bytes in the label portion of the JSON label-value pair. The length includes any white space that is contained between quotation marks. Enter a value in the range 256 - 8192. The default value is 256.

property.name: JSONMaxValueLength
property.summary: Maximum number of bytes for string values of label-value pairs.
property.description: The maximum value length limits the number of bytes in the value portion of a label-value pair when the value is a string. The length includes any white space that is contained between quotation marks. Enter a value in the range 8192 - 5368709121. The default value is 8192.

property.name: JSONMaxNumberLength
property.summary: Maximum number of bytes for number values of label-value pairs.
property.description: The maximum number length limits the number of bytes in the value portion of a label-value pair when the value is a number. The number must be a contiguous string of bytes that contain no white space. The number can include a minus sign and a positive or negative exponent. Enter a value in the range 128 - 256. The default value is 128.

property.name: JSONDocumentSize
property.summary: Maximum size of the JSON message in bytes.
property.description: The maximum document size provides threat protection by limiting the number of bytes in the body of the JSON message. If the message is converted to JSONx, the maximum document size specifies the size before conversion to JSONx. Note that the document size of the JSON message and the size of the JSONx equivalent might differ. Enter a value in the range 4194304 - 5368709121. The default value is 4194304.

object.description: The JSON settings specify constraints for parsing JSON messages. JSON settings work in conjunction with the parser limits specified in the XML Manager. The more restrictive limits apply.

property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: Protocol
property.summary: Protocol for bootstrap connection
property.description: Select the predefined protocol that is supported by the Kafka server and used for information exchange between the Kafka Server object and the bootstrap server.

property.name: Endpoint
property.summary: Kafka endpoint
property.description: <p>Identifies the connection host and port to use for the bootstrap process.</p><p>A bootstrap server uses a host name or IP address and a port number to define an endpoint address.</p><p>You can add multiple nondefault bootstrap servers. For failover capability, the endpoints must be members of the same cluster.</p>

property.name: SASLMechanism
property.summary: Simple Authentication and Security Layer mechanism
property.description: Select the appropriate SASL mechanism necessary to communicate with the Kafka Cluster. The default value is plaintext.

property.name: UserName
property.summary: Username to use for connecting to the server
property.description: Specifies the account name used to access the remote server.

property.name: PasswordAlias
property.summary: Password alias of the password to use for connecting to the server
property.description: Specifies the password alias of the password used to access the remote server.

property.name: SSLClient
property.summary: Set the TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets
property.description: The TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

property.name: MemoryThreshold
property.summary: Maximum memory size allowed for pending messages
property.description: Specifies the maximum memory allocation for pending messages. Enter a value in the range 1048576 - 1073741824 that specifies the maximum memory in bytes to allocate for pending messages. By default, the maximum memory allocation is set at 268435456.

property.name: MaximumMessageSize
property.summary: Maximum message size the DataPower Gateway sends to the remote server
property.description: Specifies the maximum message size that the DataPower Gateway supports over a connection to the remote server. Enter a value in the range 0 - 1073741824 that specifies the maximum message size in bytes. By default, the maximum message size is set at 1048576 bytes. You can use the special value, 0, to disable the enforcement of maximum message sizes.

property.name: TotalConnectionLimit
property.summary: Total number of connections limit
property.description: <p>Specifies the maximum number of simultaneous open connections to the remote server.</p><p>Session requests in excess of the total allowable number of sessions per connection trigger the establishment of a new connection to the remote server. The DataPower Gateway cannot establish a new connection unless the number of concurrent connections is less than the allowable total number of connections.</p><p>For example, with values of 20 for sessions per connection, 5 for connection limit and 3 active fully-subscribed connections, then a new session request generates the establishment of a 4th connection.</p>

property.name: AutoRetry
property.summary: Advanced recovery after critical error.
property.description: Enables (on, the default state) or disables (off) an automatic critical error-recovery procedure that attempts to re-establish a connection that has been broken in response to an error condition.

property.name: RetryInterval
property.summary: Seconds to wait before retrying failing connections.
property.description: <p>If <em>Automatic Retry</em> is enabled (the default state), specifies the interval in seconds between connection re-establishment attempts.</p>

property.name: Property
property.summary: Additional propeties to configure the Kafka server connection
property.description: Add additional properties to further configure the Kafka server connection. Some properties are not supported and will cause the configuration to fail.

object.description: Kafka Cluster is responsible for messaging services for communicating applications by periodically monitoring/polling topics, by ensuring that sent messages are directed to the correct receive topic, or that messages are routed to another server.

property.description: <p>Enter the name of the request topic associated with the Kafka cluster object supported by this protocol handler.</p><p>The handler monitors the request topic for incoming client requests. Upon message receipt, the handler forwards the extracted message to the DataPower object that will process the message.</p>

<p>Enter the name of the response topic associated with the Kafka cluster object supported by this protocol handler.</p><p>The response topic will receive the response message after DataPower finishes progressing the original client request message.</p><p>Configuration of a response topic is optional.</p><p>A response topic should be configured if server replies are expected; if reply messages are not expected, a response topic need not be configured.</p><p>In the absence of a response topic, any processed response messages are dropped.</p>

IdleTimeout
property.summary: Timeout in seconds for idle LDAP connections
property.description: Indicates the length of time that an LDAP connection can remain idle in the LDAP connection pool before the connection is removed from the connection pool. Enter a value in the range 1-86400. The default value is 120.

property.name: MaxPoolSize
property.summary: The maximum number of LDAP connections for a server:port:BindDN combination
property.description: Indicates the maximum number of LDAP connections that can exist for a server:port:BindDN combination in an LDAP connection pool. Enter a value in the range 1-2000. The default value is 35.

property.name: RejectOnPoolLimit
property.summary: Whether to reject an incoming LDAP connection when pool limit is reached
property.description: Determines whether to reject an incoming LDAP request when the LDAP connection pool reaches the maximum pool size for a server:port:BindDN combination.

object.description: The LDAP Connection Pool settings specify the LDAP connection pool to use.

value.description: Searches the entry-level of the tree and any of its descendants.

base

property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state

property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: LDAPBaseDN
property.summary: LDAP base distinguished name
property.description: <p>The base distinguished name to begin the search. This value identifies the entry level of the tree used by the <b>LDAP Scope</b> property.</p>

property.name: LDAPReturnedAttribute
property.summary: The LDAP attribute to be returned
property.description: The attribute name whose value will be returned for each entry that matches the search filter. The default is dn.

property.name: LDAPFilterPrefix
property.summary: The LDAP search filter prefix
property.description: <p>Specifies the prefix of the LDAP filter expression. An LDAP filter expression is composed by <tt>prefix + user name + suffix</tt> .</p><p>If the prefix is <tt>(&amp;(uid=</tt> and the user name is <tt>bob</tt> , the LDAP search filter would be <tt>(&amp;(uid=bob</tt> .</p>

<p>You can optionally specify a suffix for the LDAP filter expression.</p><p>If the prefix is <tt>(&amp;(uid=</tt> , the user name is <tt>bob</tt> , and the suffix is <tt>)(objectClass=person))</tt> , the LDAP search filter would be <tt>(&amp;(uid=bob)(objectClass=person))</tt> .</p>
property.summary: The LDAP search filter suffix
property.name: LDAPFilterSuffix
LDAPScope
property.summary: The LDAP scope
property.description: The depth of the LDAP search. The default is Subtree.

object.description: An LDAP Search Parameters object is a container for the parameters to use to perform an LDAP search operation. When used with authentication, the search retrieves the distinguished name (DN) for the user. When used with credential authorization mapping, the search retrieves the group name (DN or attribute value) based on the DN of the authenticated user.

value.description: The configuration uses IPv4 autoconfiguration with DHCP.

value.description: The configuration uses IPv6 autoconfiguration with SLAAC.

property.description: <p>Specify the IP address and netmask for each destination network address. The netmask is in CIDR format is the integer that specifies the prefix length.</p><ul><li>For IPv4, the prefix length can be in the range 0 - 32.</li><li>For IPv6, the prefix length can be in the range 0 - 128.</li></ul>
property.summary: IP address and netmask
property.name: Destination

property.description: Specify the IP address of the next-hop router.
property.summary: IP address of next-hop router
property.name: Gateway
Metric
property.summary: Preference for the route
property.description: <p>Optionally specify the preference for the route. The lesser the value, the greater the preference. For each IP family, the supported range differs.</p><ul><li>For IPv4, enter a value in the range 0 - 255. The default value is 0.</li><li>For IPv6, enter a value in the range 0 - 65536. The default value is 512.</li></ul>

value.description: The weighted least connection algorithm uses an internal CPU-based weight with the number of current connections to each member to distribute incoming connections among available member. A member receives a new connection that is based on a combination of its weight (or preference) and its number of active connections. The algorithm attempts to balance the connection completion rate across members so that each member has the same number of active connections.
value.name: wlc

value.description: The round robin algorithm maintains a list of members and evenly distributes incoming connections among available members. The algorithm attempts to balance the incoming connection rate across members.
value.name: rr

value.description: Link aggregation is active-backup. One link is active, and the other link is backup. If the active link is lost, switches to the backup link.
value.name: active-backup

value.description: Link aggregation uses transmit-based load balancing. This mode uses a single link for incoming traffic but distributes outgoing traffic among all links.
value.name: transmit

value.description: Link aggregation uses the Link Aggregation Control Protocol (LACP). The IEEE 802.1AX-2008 standard defines LACP. This mode requires support on the network switch.
value.name: LACP

value.description: The policy never changes aggregators. The aggregator remains constant even when a better one is available.
value.name: stable

value.description: The policy selects the aggregator with the most NICs.
value.name: count
value.summary: Use the aggregator with the most NICs.

value.description: The policy selects the aggregator with the highest bandwidth.
value.name: bandwidth
value.summary: Use the aggregator with the highest bandwidth.

value.description: The hash function uses only MAC addresses, which is layer 2 data.
value.name: mac
value.summary: Hash function uses only MAC addresses.

value.description: The hash function uses both MAC addresses and IP addresses. MAC addresses are layer 2. IP addresses are layer 3.
value.name: mac-ip
value.summary: Hash function uses both the MAC addresses and IP addresses.

value.description: The hash function uses both IP addresses and TCP/UDP ports. IP addresses are layer 3. TCP/UDP ports are layer 4. This approach is not strictly compliant to the LACP standard.
value.name: ip-port
value.summary: Hash function uses IP addresses and TCP/UDP ports.

value.description: Uses the fast link aggregation control protocol rate (every 1 second)
value.name: fast

value.description: Uses the slow link aggregation control protocol rate (every 30 seconds)
value.name: slow
