object.name: NetworkSettings

property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>
A descriptive summary for the configuration.
property.summary: Enter a descriptive summary for the configuration.
property.name: UserSummary
BlockNonmanagementTraffic
property.summary: Indicate whether to block nonmanagement traffic for invalid interface configuration.
property.display: Block nonmanagement traffic for invalid interface configuration
property.hoverhelp: <p>When at least one network interface has an invalid configuration, indicate whether to block nonmanagement traffic or allow all network traffic.</p><ul><li>When enabled, the appliance blocks nonmanagement traffic.</li><li>When disabled, the appliance allows all network traffic.</li></ul><p>For a production appliance, always enable this property. With this setting, the appliance supports only management traffic over Telnet, SSH, web management interfaces (WebGUI and Blueprint Console), and the XML management interface. Until you correct the problem, the appliance cannot accept and process client requests.</p>
property.description: <p>When at least one network interface has an invalid configuration, whether to block nonmanagement traffic or allow all network traffic.</p><ul><li>When enabled, the appliance blocks nonmanagement traffic.</li><li>When disabled, the appliance allows all network traffic.</li></ul><p>For a production appliance, always enable this property. With this setting, the appliance supports only management traffic over Telnet, SSH, web management interfaces (WebGUI and Blueprint Console), and the XML management interface. Until you correct the problem, the appliance cannot accept and process client requests.</p>

property.name: ICMPDisable
property.summary: Indicate which ICMP replies to disable.
property.description: Which Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) requests to disable the generation of ICMP reply messages.

property.name: ECNDisable
property.summary: Indicate whether to disable ECN TCP indication.
property.description: Whether to disable the generation of ECN-capable TCP sessions. By default, TCP sessions are ECN enabled.

property.name: DestinationRouting
property.summary: Indicate how the appliance determines the route to return the response to the originating client.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Indicate how the appliance determines the route to return the response to the originating client. Enable destination-based routing only if an upgrade disables existing connectivity.</p><ul><li>When enabled, interface selection is based on the best path to the client, irrespective of the service or receiving interface.</li><li>When disabled, interface selection is based on the interface that is bound to the address of the service that generated the response.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>How the appliance determines the route to return the response to the originating client. The route to return the response is the outbound packet. The originating client is the destination of the outbound packet.</p><ul><li>When enabled, interface selection is based on the best path to the client, irrespective of the service or receiving interface. The best path is determined by static routes that are bound to the available interfaces. <p><b>Note:</b> Destination-based routing is for compatibility with an earlier version only. Enable destination-based routing only if an upgrade disables existing connectivity.</p></li><li>When disabled, the default, interface selection is based on the interface that is bound to the address of the service that generated the response. <ul><li>If the service is bound to a single address, responses are routed through the interface that is assigned to that address.</li><li>If the service is bound to multiple addresses, responses are routed through the receiving interface instead of the interface for the service that generated the response.</li></ul></li></ul>

property.name: AllowCrosstalkOnSubnet
property.summary: Indicate whether to allow packets from a wrong interface when both interfaces are on the same subnet.
property.hoverhelp: Indicate whether to allow packets from a wrong interface when both interfaces are on the same subnet. Relax interface isolation when destination-routing is enabled.
property.description: Whether to relax the restriction on interface isolation. As a security policy, the interface that receives a packet must be configured with the IP address that is the destination address of the packet. Enabling this option relaxes that restriction. The packet is allowed if the interface it arrives on contains an IP address in the same subnet as the destination address of the packet. Relax interface isolation when destination-routing is enabled.

property.name: AllowAllCrosstalk
property.summary: Indicate whether to allow packets from one interface that are destined for a service on another interface.
property.description: Whether to allow interface isolation. By default the appliance refuses to accept a packet on an interface other than the one bound to the destination address of the packet. As a security policy, the interface that receives a packet must be configured with the IP address that is the destination address of the packet. Enabling interface isolation relaxes the restriction.

property.name: TCPSYNRetries
property.summary: Set the number of times to send a failed TCP SYN request.
property.hoverhelp: Set the number of times the local system attempts to send a TCP SYN that receives no response. Enter a value in the range 1 - 32.
property.description: The number of times the local system attempts to send a TCP SYN that receives no response. Enter a value in the range 1 - 32. The default value is 5.

property.name: ArpRetries
property.summary: Set the number of times to attempt a failed ARP request.
property.hoverhelp: Set the number of times that the appliance attempts a failed ARP request. Enter a value in the range 1 - 64.
property.description: The number of times that the appliance attempts a failed ARP request. Enter a value in the range 1 - 64. The default value is 8.

property.name: ArpInterval
property.summary: Set the interval between ARP attempts.
property.hoverhelp: Set the interval between ARP attempts. The appliance waits the defined time before it tries a failed ARP request again. Enter a value in the range 500 - 5000.
property.description: The interval between ARP attempts. The appliance waits the defined time before it tries a failed ARP request again. Enter a value in the range 500 - 5000. The default value is 500.

property.name: ReversePathFiltering
property.summary: Indicate whether to ignore incoming packets with a source address that the interface cannot route.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Indicate whether to ignore incoming packets with a source address that the interface cannot route.</p><ul><li>When enabled, the interface ignores incoming packets with a source address that it cannot route.</li><li>When disabled, the interface accepts and processes incoming packets with a source address that it cannot route.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>Whether incoming packets with a source address that cannot be routed by that interface are accepted and processed. Enabling this option effectively disables source routing because the appliance ignores such packets.</p><ul><li>When enabled, the interface ignores incoming packets with a source address that it cannot route.</li><li>When disabled, the default, the interface accepts and processes incoming packets with a source address that it cannot route.</li></ul>

property.name: TCPWindowScaling
property.summary: Indicate whether to enable TCP window scaling.
property.hoverhelp: Indicate whether to enable TCP window scaling. Window scaling allows the negotiation of window sizes greater than 64 KB. Disabling this option might help to work around TCP systems that do not understand or misinterpret window scaling.
property.description: Whether to enable TCP window scaling. Window scaling allows the negotiation of window sizes greater than 64 KB. Disabling this option might help to work around TCP systems that do not understand or misinterpret window scaling.

property.name: EphemeralPortRange
property.summary: Set the starting port for the ephemeral port range.
property.hoverhelp: Set the starting port of the ephemeral port range. The appliance can use ephemeral ports in the range 10000 - 61000 to send data over TCP and UDP. You can define a subset of ephemeral ports to not be ephemeral ports. These ports are ephemeral ports in the range 10000 - 32768. The appliance always has control of the ephemeral ports in the range 32769 - 61000.
property.description: The starting port of the ephemeral port range. The appliance can use ephemeral ports in the range 10000 - 61000 to send data over TCP and UDP. You can define a subset of ephemeral ports to not be ephemeral ports. These ports are ephemeral ports in the range 10000 - 32768. The appliance always has control of the ephemeral ports in the range 32769 - 61000.

object.description: Configure appliance-wide network settings.

value.description: Uses IBM API Connect as the OAuth provider.
value.name: native

value.description: Uses an OAuth provider other than IBM API Connect.
value.name: third_party

value.description: In the implicit flow, the client receives the access token directly from the resource owner.
value.name: implicit
value.summary: Uses the implicit grant type to obtain authorization

value.description: In the resource owner password credentials flow, the client uses password credentials of the resource owner to obtain authorization.
value.name: password
value.summary: Uses the password credential of the resource owner to obtain authorization

value.description: In the JWT flow, the client uses a previously obtained JSON Web Token to obtain authorization.
value.name: jwt
value.summary: Uses JSON Web Token (JWT) Bearer Token to obtain authorization

value.description: In the client credentials flow, the client uses its own credentials to obtain authorization.
value.name: application
value.summary: Uses client credentials to obtain authorization

value.description: In the authorization code flow, the client directs the resource owner to an intermediary authorization server. The server issues access token to the client after authenticating the client.
value.name: access_code
value.summary: Uses authorization codes to obtain authorization

value.description: Confidential clients are capable of maintaining the confidentiality of their credentials, or capable of secure client authentication using other means. A web application is a confidential client.
value.name: confidential

value.description: Public clients are incapable of maintaining the confidentiality of their credentials, and incapable of secure client authentication via any other means. Native applications and user-agent-based applications are public clients. <ul><li>A native application is installed and executed on the device used by the resource owner.</li><li>In a user-agent-based application, the client code is downloaded from a web server and executes within a user-agent (for example, a web browser) on the device used by the resource owner.</li></ul>
value.name: public
value.summary: Public client - native application or user-agent-based application

value.description: When you use basic authentication header, you require users to provide valid user name and password to access the endpoint.
value.name: basic-auth

value.description: Supports request of ID Token as well as AZ Code from authentication endpoint.
value.name: code_id_token

value.description: Supports request of Access Token as well as AZ Code from authentication endpoint.
value.name: code_access_token

value.description: Supports request of ID Token and Access Token as well as AZ Code from authentication endpoint.
value.name: code_id_token_access_token
value.summary: AZ Code, ID Token and Access Token

value.description: Generates Bearer access tokens.
value.name: Bearer

value.description: An HTTP GET request is sent to the authentication URL and the metadata is returned in specified response headers.
value.name: authentication_url
value.summary: From the response headers received from the authentication URL

value.description: An HTTP GET request is sent to an external metadata URL and the metadata is returned in specified response headers. Metadata obtained from the metadata URL overwrites any existing metadata obtained from the authentication URL.
value.name: external_url
value.summary: From the response headers received from an external metadata URL

value.description: Uses the cache behavior that is defined by the <tt>Cache-Control</tt> header on the response from the external service.
value.name: Protocol
value.summary: Uses the cache behavior that is defined by any returned Cache-Control header.

value.description: Does not cache documents. This setting is the default value.
value.name: NoCache

value.description: Keeps documents in the cache for the specified time.
value.name: TimeToLive

value.description: Manage and store security token details using an internal token manager.
value.name: native

value.description: Delegate token management operations to an external service.
value.name: external

value.description: Connected successfully to the third-party endpoint.
value.name: connected

value.description: Connected successfully to the third-party endpoint and the access token is valid.
value.name: active
value.summary: Connected successfully and access token is valid

object.name: OAuthProviderSettings
object.summary: Configure and manage the provider of OAuth tokens

property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>
Enter a descriptive summary for the configuration.
property.summary: A brief descriptive summary for the configuration
property.name: UserSummary
EnableDebugMode
property.summary: Whether to enable debug mode to put security error details in response headers
property.description: When you use a validation endpoint, specifies whether to enable debug mode. In debug mode, security error details are sent in the <tt>x-apic-debug-oauth-error</tt> and <tt>x-apic-debug-oauth-error-desc</tt> response headers.

property.name: ProviderType
property.summary: The type of the provider
property.description: Specifies the type of the OAuth provider.

Specifies the scopes that the access token is valid to access. To specify multiple scopes, use a space between each scope. The order of scopes does not matter. Scopes ensure that the granted access token is valid to access only specific protected resources.
property.summary: The scopes that the access token is valid to access
property.name: ScopesAllowed
DefaultScopes
property.summary: The default scopes to apply when the request does not contain a scope
property.description: <p>Specifies the default scopes to apply when the request does not contain a scope. To specify multiple scopes, use a space between each scope. The order of scopes does not matter.</p><p>The default scopes must be a subset of the allowed scopes that are defined by the API security OAuth requirement configuration. When no default scope is defined and the request does not contain a scope, an invalid scope error is returned for the request.</p><p>Scopes ensure that the granted access token is valid to access only specific protected resources.</p>

property.name: SupportedGrantTypes
property.summary: Supported methods to grant authorization
property.description: Specifies the supported grant types where each grant type defines a method to grant authorization to client applications.

property.name: SupportedClientTypes
property.summary: Types of client who can obtain access tokens
property.description: Specifies the supported client types that are authorized to obtain an access token.

property.name: APICProviderBasePath
property.summary: Base path URL for the OAuth provider API
property.description: When the provider type is API Connect, specifies the base path on which the OAuth provider API is served. The default base path is <tt>/</tt> .

property.name: APICAuthorizeEndpoint
property.summary: URL to the authorization endpoint
property.description: When the provider is API Connect, specifies the endpoint where the client application obtains authorization grant. The default authorization endpoint is <tt>/oauth2/authorize</tt> .

property.name: APICTokenEndpoint
property.summary: URL to the token endpoint
property.description: When the provider is API Connect, specifies the endpoint where the client application exchanges an authorization grant for an access token. The default token endpoint is <tt>/oauth2/token</tt> .

property.name: APICEnableIntrospection
property.summary: Whether to enable introspection of access tokens
property.description: When the OAuth provider is API Connect, specifies whether to enable the introspection of access tokens. When enabled, authorized protected resources can introspect the access token to determine the metadata for making appropriate authorization decisions. By default, token introspection is disabled.

property.name: APICIntrospectEndpoint
property.summary: URL to the introspection endpoint
property.description: When the provider is API Connect, specifies the endpoint through which the token introspection operation is accomplished. The default introspection endpoint is <tt>/oauth2/introspect</tt> .

property.name: APICEnableRevocation
property.summary: When to enable token revocation
property.description: When the OAuth provider is API Connect, specifies whether to enable the revocation of access tokens. When enabled, users can revoke the access token when they change their mind and decide that they do not want the client application to continue to have access to their resources. By default, token revocation is disabled.

property.name: APICRevocationEndpoint
property.summary: URL to the revocation endpoint
property.description: When the provider is API Connect, specifies the endpoint through which the token revocation is accomplished. The default revocation endpoint is <tt>/oauth2/revocation</tt> .

property.name: APICTokenSecret
property.summary: The secret of the token
property.description: When the provider is API Connect, specifies the secret of the generated token.

property.name: APICOneTimeUseAccesstoken
property.summary: Whether to enable the one-time use of an access token.
property.description: When the OAuth provider is API Connect, controls whether to set access tokens to one-time use.

property.name: APICAccessTokenTTL
property.summary: The lifetime for the access token
property.description: When the provider is API Connect, specifies the time that an access token remains valid in seconds. The default value is 3600.

property.name: APICAuthCodeTTL
property.summary: The lifetime for the authorization code
property.description: When the provider is API Connect, specifies the time that an authorization code remains valid in seconds. The default value is 300.

property.name: APICEnableRefreshToken
property.summary: Whether to enable the use of refresh tokens
property.description: When the OAuth provider is API Connect, controls whether to enable issuing refresh tokens. Refresh tokens are issued to the client. Refresh tokens are used to obtain a new access token when the current access token becomes invalid or expires or are used to obtain additional access tokens with identical or narrower scope. By default, this setting is disabled.

property.name: APICOneTimeUseRefreshtoken
property.summary: Whether to disable the one-time use of a refresh token.
property.description: When the OAuth provider is API Connect, controls whether a refresh tokens is one-time use. <ul><li>When enabled, the refresh token is one-time use. This setting is the default value.</li><li>When disabled, the refresh token can be reused until it expires or is revoked.</li></ul>

property.name: APICRefreshTokenLimit
property.summary: The maximum number of refresh tokens allowed
property.description: Specifies the number of refresh tokens allowed to be generated. The default value is 10.

property.name: APICRefreshTokenTTL
property.summary: The lifetime for the refresh token
property.description: When the provider is API Connect and the refresh token is enabled, specifies the time that a refresh token remains valid in seconds. The default value is 5400.

property.name: APICMaximumConsentTTL
property.summary: The lifetime for the consent
property.description: When the provider is API Connect, specifies the time that a consent remains valid in seconds. The default value is 0 which disables maximum consent.

property.name: AdvScopeValidationEnabled
property.summary: Whether to enable advanced scope validation
property.description: Indicates whether to enable advanced scope validation that you can use to provide additional scope checking.

property.name: AdvancedScopeURLOverride
property.summary: Whether to use the URL from the API Security Definition or from the OAuth Provider Settings.
property.display: Use URL from API Security Definition
property.description: Indicates whether to use the URL from the API Security Definition or from the OAuth Provider Settings.

property.name: AdvancedScopeURL
property.summary: Advanced scope URL to send updated scope for validation.
property.description: Adds the ability to send scope information to an external endpoint where the given scope is verified. The property is required when advanced scope validation is enabled.

property.name: AdvScopeTLSProfile
property.summary: TLS client profile to secure the HTTPS connection to the advanced scope URL
property.display: TLS profile to access advanced scope URL
property.description: When the advanced scope URL uses the HTTPS protocol, specifies the TLS client profile to secure the connection.

property.name: AdvScopeURLSecurityEnabled
property.summary: Whether to enable security on the advanced scope endpoint
property.description: Indicates whether to secure connections to the advanced scope endpoint.

property.name: AdvScopeURLSecurity
property.summary: How to secure the advanced scope endpoint
property.description: Specifies how to secure connections to the advanced scope endpoint.

property.name: AdvScopeBasicAuthUserName
property.summary: User name for authentication
property.description: When the security type is basic authorization header, specifies the user name for authentication.

property.name: AdvScopeBasicAuthPassword
property.summary: Password for authentication
property.description: When the security type is basic authorization header, specifies the password for authentication.

property.name: AdvScopeBasicAuthHeaderName
property.summary: Header name to use for sending encoded or non-encoded authentication string in the header
property.description: When the security type is basic authorization header, specifies the header name to use in the <tt>curl</tt> command when you want to append encoded or non-encoded authentication string in the header. For example, <tt>x-basic-authorization-header</tt> .

property.name: AdvancedScopeCustomHeaders
property.summary: Custom headers to send with the advanced scope validation request
property.description: Adds ability to send additional headers in the advanced scope validation step. Use a regular expression match to include headers from the initial request.

property.name: AdvancedScopeCustomContexts
property.summary: Custom context variables that can be selected with the advanced scope validation request
property.description: Adds ability to save headers in the advanced scope validation step as context variables. Use a regular expression to include headers from the advanced scope endpoint response.

property.name: APICEnableOIDC
property.summary: Whether to enable OIDC for authentication
property.description: When the OAuth provider is API Connect, specifies whether to enable OIDC to verify the identity of the user. When enabled, the client application verifies the identity of the user based on the requirement of an OIDC provider before requesting access to client resources. By default, OIDC token generation is enabled. OIDC is only available for Implicit and Authorization Code grant types.

property.name: APICOIDCHybridResponseTypes
property.summary: Which artifacts are supported with the OIDC Hybrid Flow
property.description: When the OAuth provider is API Connect, specifies which OIDC Hybrid Flow artifacts can be returned from the authorization endpoint.

property.name: APICSupportPKCE
property.summary: Whether application will support PKCE
property.description: When the grant type is Authorization code, indicates whether the application should enforce PKCE if provided by the client. For more information, see RFC 7636.

property.name: APICRequirePKCE
property.summary: Whether application must enforce PKCE
property.description: When the grant type is Authorization code, indicates whether the application must enforce PKCE. For more information, see RFC 7636.

property.name: APICSupportPKCEPlain
property.summary: Whether to support the PKCE 'plain' code challenge transform method
property.description: When the grant type is Authorization code, indicates whether to support the PKCE <tt>plain</tt> code challenge transform method. For more information, see RFC 7636.

property.name: APICTokenTypeToGenerate
property.summary: The type of access token to generate
property.description: When the provider is API Connect, specifies the type of access token to generate.

property.name: MetadataFrom
property.summary: Where to obtain custom metadata
property.description: When the provider is API Connect, specifies where to obtain custom metadata of the access tokens.

property.name: MetadataURL
property.summary: The URL to a remote server where to obtain the metadata
property.description: When the provider is API Connect, specifies the URL to a remote server where the custom metadata is stored.

property.name: MetadataSSLProfile
property.summary: TLS client profile to secure the HTTPS connection to a remote metadata provider
property.display: TLS profile to access metadata URL
property.description: When the external metadata URL uses the HTTPS protocol, specifies the TLS client profile to secure the connection.

property.name: MetadataHeaderForAccessToken
property.summary: Response header for access token
property.description: Specifies which value, among the response header values that the authentication or metadata URL returns, to place in the access token.

property.name: MetadataHeaderForPayload
property.summary: Response header for payload
property.description: Specifies which value, among the response header values that the authentication or metadata URL returns, to place in the response payload.

property.name: ExternalRevocationURL
property.summary: URL to an external management endpoint
property.description: Specifies an external endpoint through which the token management is accomplished.

property.name: ExternalRevocationSSLProfile
property.summary: TLS client profile to secure connection to the external management service
property.description: Specifies the client profile to use for TLS connection to the external management service.

property.name: ExternalRevocationURLSecurity
property.summary: How the external management endpoint is secured
property.description: When the native OAuth provider uses an external management service, specifies how to secure connections to the service endpoint.

property.name: ExternalRevocationBasicAuthUserName
property.summary: User name for authentication
property.description: When the security type is basic authorization header, specifies the user name for authentication.

property.name: ExternalRevocationBasicAuthPassword
property.summary: Password for authentication
property.description: When the security type is basic authorization header, specifies the password for authentication.

property.name: ExternalRevocationBasicAuthHeaderName
property.summary: Header name to use for sending encoded or non-encoded authentication string in the header
property.description: When the native OAuth provider uses an external management service, specifies the header name to use in the <tt>curl</tt> command when you want to append encoded or non-encoded authentication string in the header. For example, <tt>x-introspect-basic-authorization-header</tt> .

property.name: ExternalRevocationCustomHeaderFormat
property.summary: Pattern of header names to use for sending additional information in the header
property.description: When the native OAuth provider uses an external management service, this specifies the pattern of header names to include from the original message. For example, <tt>x-external-management-*</tt> .

property.name: ExternalRevocationCacheType
property.summary: How to cache external management service responses
property.description: When the native OAuth provider uses an external management service, controls how to cache management responses.

property.name: ExternalRevocationCacheTimeToLive
property.summary: The validity period for external management service responses in the cache.
property.description: Sets the validity period in seconds for external management service responses in the cache. The default value is 900.

property.name: ExternalRevocationFailOnError
property.summary: Indicates whether to stop processing if connection to external management service fails.
property.description: Whether to stop processing if external management query fails. If failed, stops the token generation or use and returns an error.

property.name: EnableTokenManagement
property.summary: Specify if security token details should be managed and stored.
property.description: Enabling token management for security token details provides the ability to create one-time use tokens, prevent AZ code reuse, and support allow listing through the use of the token manager.

property.name: TokenManagerType
property.summary: Token manager type
property.description: Specifies the token manager type to manage and store security token details.

property.name: APISecurityTokenManager
property.summary: The security token manager.
property.description: The security token manager that stores security token details. This property is read-only.

property.name: EnableApplicationRevocation
property.summary: Enable revocation by application.
property.description: Enabling application revocation will allow the application to revoke the consent provided before the token expires.

property.name: ApplicationRevocationEndpoint
property.summary: The application revocation endpoint.
property.description: The endpoint that will process application revocations.

property.name: EnableOwnerRevocation
property.summary: Enable revocation by resource owner.
property.description: Enabling resource owner revocation will allow the resource owner to revoke the consent provided before the token expires.

property.name: OwnerRevocationEndpoint
property.summary: The resource owner revocation endpoint.
property.description: The endpoint that will process resource owner revocations.

property.name: TokenValidationReq
property.summary: Requirement to indicate when a token is valid
property.description: When checking responses from the third-party endpoint, specify the requirement that must be satisfied to prove that a token is valid.

property.name: ThirdPartyAZURL
property.summary: URL to the authorization endpoint
property.description: When the OAuth provider type is third-party, specifies the endpoint where the client application obtains authorization grant.

property.name: ThirdPartyTokenURL
property.summary: URL to the token endpoint
property.description: When the OAuth provider type is third-party, specifies the endpoint where the client application exchanges an authorization grant for an access token.

property.name: ThirdPartyIntrospectURL
property.summary: URL to the introspection endpoint
property.description: When the OAuth provider type is third-party, specifies the endpoint through which the token introspection operation is accomplished.

property.name: ThirdPartyIntrospectCacheType
property.summary: How to cache third-party provider responses
property.description: When the OAuth provider type is third-party, controls whether to cache successful responses on the gateway, and for how long.

property.name: ThirdPartyIntrospectCacheTimeToLive
property.summary: The validity period for third party provider responses in the cache.
property.description: Sets the validity period in seconds for third-party provider responses in the cache. The default value is 900.

property.name: ThirdPartyAuthorizationHeaderPassThru
property.summary: Controls whether to retain the Authorization header for a bearer token.
property.description: When the OAuth provider type is third-party, whether to retain or remove the <tt>Authorization</tt> header for a bearer token. The default behavior is to remove this header.

property.name: ThirdPartyIntrospectURLSecurity
property.summary: How to secure the introspection endpoint
property.description: When the OAuth provider type is third-party, specifies how to secure connections to the introspection endpoint.

property.name: ThirdPartyIntrospectBasicAuthUserName
property.summary: User name for authentication
property.description: When the security type is basic authorization header, specifies the user name for authentication.

property.name: ThirdPartyIntrospectBasicAuthPassword
property.summary: Password for authentication
property.description: When the security type is basic authorization header, specifies the password for authentication.

property.name: ThirdPartyBasicAuthHeaderName
property.summary: Header name to use for sending encoded or non-encoded authentication string in the header
property.description: When the OAuth provider type is third-party and the security type is basic authorization header, specifies the header name to use in the <tt>curl</tt> command when you want to append encoded or non-encoded authentication string in the header. For example, <tt>x-introspect-basic-authorization-header</tt> .

property.name: ThirdPartyCustomHeaderNameFormat
property.summary: Pattern of header name to use for sending additional information in the header
property.description: When the OAuth provider type is third-party, specifies the pattern of header name to use in the <tt>curl</tt> command when you want to append additional information in the header. For example, <tt>x-introspect-*</tt> .

property.name: ThirdPartyIntrospectSSLProfile
property.summary: TLS client profile to secure connection to a remote endpoint
property.description: Specifies the client profile to use for TLS connection.

object.description: <p>An OAuth provider settings configuration defines how a client application is authorized to access resources on behalf of the resource owner.</p>

value.description: For requests, the DataPower Gateway is the authorization server endpoints: authorization endpoint and token endpoint.
value.name: azsvr
value.summary: Role is authorization server endpoints: authorization endpoint and token endpoint

value.description: For requests, the DataPower Gateway is the enforcement point for a resource server.
value.name: rssvr
value.summary: Role is the enforcement point for the resource server

value.description: Use the authorization code grant type to obtain authorization.
value.name: code

value.description: Uses the implicit grant type to obtain authorization.
value.name: implicit

value.description: Uses the resource owner password credential grant type to obtain authorization.
value.name: password
value.summary: Resource owner password credential to obtain authorization

value.description: Uses the client credentials grant type to obtain authorization.
value.name: client

value.description: Uses the JWT grant type to obtain authorization.
value.name: jwt

value.description: Disables the use of validation grant type to verify an access token.
value.name: novalidate

value.description: Supports OpenID Connect.
value.name: oidc
value.summary: ID token for OpenID Connect support

value.description: Clients can maintain the confidentiality of their credentials or can secure client authentication through other means.
value.name: confidential

value.description: Clients cannot maintain the confidentiality of their credentials or cannot secure client authentication through other means.
value.name: public

value.description: Uses the client secret for authentication.
value.name: secret

value.description: Uses the client certificate from a mutual TLS communication for authentication.
value.name: ssl
value.summary: Client certificate from a mutual TLS communication

value.description: Validates the JWT that the client sends for authentication.
value.name: jwt

value.description: Uses replay cache to prevent replay attacks.
value.name: replay

value.description: Uses system memory to support revocation.
value.name: system

value.description: Uses a custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file that defines how to handle revocation.
value.name: custom

value.description: Uses storage associated with the Quota Enforcement server.
value.name: diststore

value.description: Credential validation is not needed when honoring a validation grant type. You must provide an alternative mean to protect this endpoint.
value.name: noauthen

value.description: The format is defined in OAuth introspection endpoint. <tt>token_type_hint</tt> is a MUST. This feature can be enabled with the setting of var://context/oauth/validation to "introspect".
value.name: introspect

value.description: Creates the DP-OWNER HTTP header. This header contains the information about the resource owner.
value.name: owner
value.summary: DP-OWNER header with resource owner information

value.description: Creates the DP-CLIENTID HTTP header. This header contains the information about the client_id.
value.name: clientid

value.description: Creates the DP-SCOPE HTTP header. This header contains the information about the scope.
value.name: scope

value.description: Creates the DP-MISCINFO HTTP header. This header contains the information provided by customer.
value.name: miscinfo

value.description: Returns verbose details and the error description if an error occurs. This feature can be enabled by setting the var://context/oauth/features variable to "verboseerror".
value.name: verboseerror

value.description: Indicates that the access token is a one-time use token, which requires the support of token cache, distributed cache, or external caching support.
value.name: onetimeuse
value.summary: Access token is a one-time use token

value.description: Indicates application must use Proof Key for Code Exchange for Authorization Code Grant Type.
value.name: pkce
value.summary: Proof Key for Code Exchange must be used for Authorization Code Grant Type

value.description: Indicates whether the refresh token can be reused until it expires or is revoked.
value.name: multipleusesrefreshtoken
value.summary: Refresh token can be reused until it expires or is revoked

object.name: OAuthSupportedClient

property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>
Specifies a brief comment that describes the configuration.
property.summary: Brief, descriptive summary of the configuration
property.name: UserSummary
Customized
property.summary: Whether the configuration is for a customized OAuth client
property.description: Indicates whether the configuration is for a customized OAuth client. The configuration of the customized OAuth client is defined in a stylesheet or GatewayScript file in the local: or store: directory.

property.name: CustomizedProcessUrl
property.summary: Location of the stylesheet or GatewayScript file that defines the customized OAuth client
property.description: <p>Specifies the location of the stylesheet or GatewayScript file that defines the customized OAuth client. The stylesheet or GatewayScript file must be in the local: or store: directory</p><p>When creating a customized OAuth client, the stylesheets or GatewayScript files must define all implementation details based on the role of the client. For information about these stylesheets or GatewayScript files, see the topic in IBM Knowledge Center.</p><p>You should provide support for the following operations: <ul><li>verify-az-request: determine whether the initial OAuth request is supported or not.</li><li>issue-az-code: issue a temporary authorization code (for the authorization code grant).</li><li>verify-az-code: verify a temporary authorization.</li><li>issue-access-token: issue an access_token.</li><li>verify-access-token: verify an access_token.</li><li>verify-refresh-token: verify a refresh_token.</li><li>client-revoke-request: handle client revocation request.</li><li>owner-revoke-request: handle owner revocation request.</li></ul></p>

property.name: OAuthRole
property.summary: Role of the OAuth client
property.description: Identifies the role of the client when interacting with a request to access a protected resource.

property.name: AZGrant
property.summary: How to obtain an authorization grant
property.description: Identifies the method to obtain the access token for authorization based on the grant type.

property.name: ClientType
property.summary: Type of client based on how it authenticates with authorization server endpoints
property.description: Sets the type of client based on its ability to authenticate securely with authorization server endpoints. The client type is based on the definitions that the authorization server endpoints use for secure authentication and acceptable exposure of client credentials. If the client can securely authenticate, its classification is <tt>confidential</tt> .

property.name: CheckClientCredential
property.summary: Whether to verify the client credentials
property.description: Identifies whether to verify the client credentials when the DataPower Gateway protects the resource server by using access tokens.

property.name: UseValidationUrl
property.summary: Use Validation URL
property.description: Uses a remote URL to validate the access token.

property.name: ClientAuthenMethod
property.summary: How to authenticate this OAuth client
property.description: Identifies the method to authenticate this client.

property.name: ClientValCred
property.summary: OAuth Client TLS Credentials
property.description: An TLS credential used to authenticate the OAuth client sent by remote TLS peer during the TLS handshake.

property.name: GenerateClientSecret
property.summary: Whether to generate the client secret for the OAuth client
property.description: <p>Indicates whether to generate the client secret for the OAuth client. The specification refers to the client secret as <tt>client_secret</tt> .</p><ul><li>If you generate the passphrase, the passphrase becomes the client secret.</li><li>If you do not generate the passphrase, you must explicitly define the client secret.</li></ul>
Specifies the client secret for the OAuth client. The specification references the client secret as <tt>client_secret</tt> .
property.name: ClientSecret
property.summary: Client secret for the OAuth client

property.name: Caching
property.summary: Caching Mechanism
property.description: Specifies the caching mechanism to be used.
Specifies the validation url.
property.name: ValidationURL
property.summary: Validation URL

property.name: ValidationURLSSLProfile
property.summary: The validation TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use a validation TLS client profile.
property.description: Specifies the TLS proxy profile for the validation URL.

property.name: ValidationFeatures
property.summary: Indicate how to customize the validation grant type
property.description: Customize how to handle the validation grant type.

<p>Defines redirection URIs that the OAuth client supports to exchange tokens. Specify each redirection URI as a PCRE.</p><p>Redirection URIs help to detect malicious clients and prevent phishing attacks. The authorization endpoint must have the registered redirection URIs before the authorization endpoint can validate the authorization request from the client. For mobile applications, the redirection URI can be an application URL; for example, <tt>mobiletrafficapp://</tt> that is defined with the <tt>^mobiletrafficapp:\/\/?</tt> PCRE.</p>
property.name: RedirectURI
property.summary: Set of redirection URIs for the OAuth client

property.name: CustomScopeCheck
property.summary: Whether to use a stylesheet or GatewayScript file to check the scope
property.description: <p>Indicates how to check the scope for authorization grants and access tokens.</p><ul><li>When checking the scope with custom processing, specify the location of the stylesheet or GatewayScript file with the <b>Scope Customized Process</b> property. The stylesheet or GatewayScript file must be in the local: or store: directory.</li><li>When checking the scope with a PCRE, specify the expression with the <b>Scope</b> property.</li></ul><p>You should use a custom scope check in the following situations. <ul><li>An authorization request where the OAuth client requests an authorization code.</li><li>An access request where the OAuth client requests an access token.</li><li>A resource request where the OAuth client requests a resource.</li></ul></p>
Specifies the PCRE to check the scope. The minimum length of the expression is 1 character. The maximum length of the expression is 1023 characters.
property.name: Scope
property.summary: PCRE that checks the scope

property.name: ScopeUrl
property.summary: Location of the stylesheet or GatewayScript file that checks the scope
property.description: Specifies the location of the stylesheet or GatewayScript file for a custom scope check. The stylesheet or GatewayScript file must be in the local: or store: directory. The stylesheet or GatewayScript file validates and sets the scope to check.

property.name: DefaultScope
property.summary: Default scope if none is specified in the request
property.description: Specifies the default value of the scope if the client does not define any scope value in the request.

property.name: TokenSecret
property.summary: Shared secret key to protect tokens
property.description: Assigns the shared secret key to protect tokens that use the OAuth protocol. The shared secret must be at least 32 bytes in length.

property.name: LocalAZPageUrl
property.summary: Location of the stylesheet or GatewayScript file that generates the authorization form and the error page
property.description: <p>Specifies the location of the stylesheet or GatewayScript file that generates the authorization form for the resource owner and handles errors. The file must be in the local: or store: directory. You can use the <tt>OAuth-Generate-HTML.xsl</tt> stylesheet in the store: directory or copy this file to the local: directory and modify as needed.</p><p>The stylesheet or GatewayScript file must be on the DataPower Gateway in the local: or store: directory. The HTML authorization form remains operational for the duration defined with the <b>DataPower State Lifetime</b> property. If the user does not submit the request before the duration elapses, the authorization from the OAuth client is rejected.</p>

property.name: DPStateLifeTime
property.summary: Duration for the authorization page for the resource owner
property.description: <p>Sets the operational duration in seconds for the local authorization page. Enter a value in the range 1 - 600. The default value is 300.</p><p>If the user does not submit the request before the duration elapses, the authorization request from the OAuth client is rejected. The location of the stylesheet or GatewayScript file that defines the local authorization page and the error handling is set with the <b>Authorization Form</b> property.</p>

property.name: AUCodeLifeTime
property.summary: Lifetime for an authorization code
property.description: <p>Sets the lifetime for an authorization code in seconds. Enter a value in the range 1 - 600. The default value is 300.</p><p>An authorization code is the intermediary result of a successful authorization. The client uses authorization codes to obtain the access token. Instead of sending tokens to a client, clients receives authorization codes on their redirection URI. Each supported redirection URI for the client is defined with the <b>Redirect URI</b> property.</p>

property.name: AccessTokenLifeTime
property.summary: Lifetime for the access token
property.description: Sets the lifetime for the access token in seconds. Enter a value in the range 1 - 63244800. The default value is 3600.

property.name: RefreshTokenAllowed
property.summary: Maximum number of refresh tokens that can be generated for a specific permission set
property.description: <p>Sets the maximum number of refresh tokens that can be generated for a specific permission set. A permission set is defined as a combination of the resource owner, application, and protected resources. For example, <tt>jack,mobileapp1,scope1</tt> and <tt>john,mobileapp1,scope1</tt> are different permission sets. When an application asks the resource owner for access to protected resources again, the application receives a new permission set with its own counter for refresh tokens.</p><p>Enter a value in the range 0 - 4096. The default value is 0. Remember that refresh tokens and access tokens are distributed in pairs.</p>

property.name: RefreshTokenLifeTime
property.summary: Lifetime for the refresh token
property.description: Sets the lifetime for the refresh token in seconds. Enter a value in the range 2 - 252979200. The default value is 5400. The lifetime for a refresh token must be longer than that for the corresponding access token.

property.name: MaxConsentLifeTime
property.summary: Maximum lifetime before an application must gather consent again
property.description: <p>Maximum lifetime that the permission is valid before the application must gather consent again. Enter a value in the range 0 - 2529792000. The default value is 0, which disables this feature.</p>

property.name: CustomResourceOwner
property.summary: Whether to use a stylesheet or GatewayScript file to extract information about the resource owner
property.description: <p>Indicates whether to use a stylesheet or GatewayScript file to extract information about the resource owner. When extracting using custom processing, use the <b>Resource Owner Process</b> property to specify the location of the file. The stylesheet or GatewayScript file must be in the local: or store: directory.</p><p>By default, the resource owner is the user name from the extracted identity. For custom handling, you must provide a stylesheet or GatewayScript file that overrides information about the resource owner.</p><ul><li>For AAA identity extraction, the extraction method can be basic authentication or forms-based login.</li><li>For custom handling, the stylesheet or GatewayScript file overrides data about the resource owner with information from authentication.</li></ul><p>You should use custom handling in the following situations: <ul><li>When presenting the authorization form to the resource owner</li><li>When issuing a code for an authorization code grant type</li><li>When issuing an access token</li></ul></p>

property.name: ResourceOwnerUrl
property.summary: Location of the stylesheet or GatewayScript file to extract information about the resource owner
property.description: Specifies the location of the stylesheet or GatewayScript file to extract information about the resource owner. The file must be in the local: or store: directory.

property.name: AdditionalOAuthProcessUrl
property.summary: Location of the stylesheet or GatewayScript file to process after successfully processing an OAuth request
property.description: <p>Specifies the location of the stylesheet or GatewayScript file to process after generating a code, after generating an access token, or after generating an access token but before sending it to the resource server. The stylesheet or GatewayScript file must be in the local: or store: directory.</p><p>You can use custom additional OAuth processing in the following situations.</p><ul><li>An authorization form request allows custom processing to handle the consent form with the <tt>authorization_form</tt> operation. This operations allows custom handling of the consent form.</li><li>An authorization request after successfully generating a code for an authorization code grant with the <tt>authorization_request</tt> operation. Processing returns a node set. This information becomes part of the query string and is returned to the OAuth client during authorization code grant type.</li><li>An access request after successfully generating an access token with the <tt>access_request</tt> operation. Processing returns a node set. This information becomes part of the JSON object that contains the access token.</li><li>A resource request after successfully verifying an access token but before sending the request to the resource server with the <tt>resource_request</tt> operation.</li><li>A revoke request allows custom handling of a revocation request with the <tt>revoke_request</tt> operation. For example, this operation provides a way to persist the revocation information in a persistent store off the DataPower Gateway.</li><li>A check revocation request verifies whether an access request was revoked previously with the <tt>check_revocation_request</tt> operation. For example, this operation can be used to check against the persistent store off the DataPower Gateway to determine whether an access permission was revoked previously.</li><li>A pre-approval request allows the consent form to be by-passed in either an authorization code or implicit grant type with the <tt>preapproved_check</tt> operation. Depending on the result of this operation, the client's request is approved, denied, or the consent form to be presented.</li><li>A validation request allows custom handling of a validation request grant type with the <tt>validate_request</tt> operation. The response must be in a node set that can be converted into a JSON response, in responding to a validation request.</li><li>A miscinfo request allows the OAuth client to add miscellaneous information to the token with the <tt>miscinfo_request</tt> operation. The authorization server adds the response to the token and returns it to the OAuth client. The maximum number of characters in this information is 512.</li></ul>

property.name: RSSetHeader
property.summary: HTTP headers to set for the resource server
property.description: Identifies which HTTP headers to create and send to the remote resource server.

property.name: ValidationURLSSLClientType
property.summary: Validation TLS client type
property.description: The TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

property.name: ValidationURLSSLClient
property.summary: Validation TLS Client Profile
property.description: Specifies the TLS Client Profile for the validation URL.

property.name: JWTGrantValidator
property.summary: Specify how to verify a JWT authorization grant
property.description: <p>Specify the JWT validator configuration to verify a JWT for JWT authorization grant. The JWT validator configuration must meet the following requirements.</p><ul><li>Must treat the "sub" claim as the resource owner.</li><li>Must check the "iss" claim.</li><li>Must check the "aud" claim. The "aud" claim can be a client ID or the redirect URI.</li><li>Must be configured to verify a signed JWT.</li></ul>

property.name: ClientJWTValidator
property.summary: Specify how to verify the client credentials
property.description: <p>Specify the JWT validator configuration to verify the client credentials. The JWT validator configuration must meet the following requirements.</p><ul><li>The "sub" claim must be the same as client ID.</li><li>Must check the "iss" claim.</li><li>Must check the "aud" claim.</li><li>Must be configured to verify a signed JWT.</li></ul>

property.name: OIDCIDTokenGenerator
property.summary: Specify the JWT generator configuration that generates an ID token.
property.description: <p>Specify the JWT generator configuration that generates an ID token. The JWT generator configuration must meet the following requirements.</p><ul><li>Must configure "Issuer" for the "iss" claim.</li><li>Must support "Issued at" for the "iat" claim.</li><li>Must support signing of the JWT.</li></ul><p>The following items are added to the JWT.</p><ul><li>Authenticated resource owner is added as the value of the "sub" claim.</li><li>Client ID is added as part of the "aud" claim.</li><li>"Validity period" is used to generate the value of the "exp" claim.</li><li>Requested "nonce" is used for the "nonce" claim.</li></ul>
Specify which features to enable.
property.summary: Specify which features to enable
property.name: OAuthFeatures

object.description: <p>An OAuth client profile is the basic building block for an OAuth client group. When you create an OAuth client profile, you define its role. As you select the role, the WebGUI refreshes to display the appropriate properties.</p><p>You can create the following types of OAuth client profiles. <ul><li>A client profile for authorization server endpoints: authorization endpoint and token endpoint.</li><li>A client profile for the enforcement point for the resource server.</li><li>A client profile for both authorization server endpoints and the enforcement point.</li></ul></p><p>When creating an OAuth client profile, you can use stylesheets or GatewayScript files for customization.</p><p>You can create a customized OAuth client profile that defines any combination of roles. Customization uses stylesheets or GatewayScript files that must be in the local: or store: directory. For information about the operations that these stylesheets or GatewayScript files must define, see the topic in IBM Knowledge Center.</p>

value.description: Uses a custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file to define all the details of the OAuth client configuration.

value.description: For requests, the DataPower Gateway is the authorization server endpoints: authorization endpoint and token endpoint.

property.name: TemplateProcessUrl
property.summary: Location of the stylesheet or GatewayScript file that defines the OAuth client.
property.description: <p>Specifies the location of the stylesheet or GatewayScript file that defines the OAuth client. You can define parts of the configuration parameters in the stylesheet or GatewayScript file and then specify an OAuth client template to derive the remaining information. Note that the stylesheet or GatewayScript file must at least provide the "client-id" node. The stylesheet or GatewayScript file must be in the local: or store: directory.</p><p>The stylesheet or GatewayScript file must follow the guidelines when it returns the information: <ul><li>The stylesheet or GatewayScript file must return the &lt;client-id> element.</li><li>If the &lt;customized> element value is set to "on", the &lt;customized-process-url> element value must be provided by either the stylesheet or GatewayScript file or the template.</li><li>If the &lt;customized> element value is set to "on" in the client template, the &lt;customized-process-url> element cannot unset this value.</li><li>If the &lt;use-validation-url> element value is set to "on", the &lt;validation-url> element value must be provided by either the stylesheet or GatewayScript file or the template.</li><li>If the &lt;custom-scope-check> element value is set to "on", the &lt;scope-url> element value must be provided by either the stylesheet or GatewayScript file or the template.</li><li>If the &lt;custom-resource-owner> element value is set to "on", the &lt;resource-owner-url> element value must be provided by either the stylesheet or GatewayScript file or the template.</li><li>If the &lt;role> element value is set, the value must be the same or a subset of what is defined in the template.</li><li>If the &lt;client-type> element value is set, the value must be the same or a subset of what is defined in the template.</li><li>If the &lt;az-grant> element value is set, the value must be the same or a subset of what is defined in the template.</li><li>If the &lt;az-grant> element value is set to "+code+" or "+token+", the &lt;local-az-page-url> element value must be provided by either the stylesheet or GatewayScript file or the template.</li><li>If the &lt;caching> element value is set to "custom", the &lt;additional-oauth-processing-url> element value must be provided by either the stylesheet or GatewayScript file or the template.</li><li>If the &lt;refresh-token-allowed> is set to a non-zero value, the &lt;refresh-token-lifetime> element value must be provided by either the stylesheet or GatewayScript file or the template.</li><li>If the &lt;check-client-credential> element value is set to "on", the &lt;client-authen-method> element value must be provided by either the stylesheet or GatewayScript file or the template.</li><li>If the &lt;client-authen-method> element value is set to "secret", the &lt;client-secret> element value must be provided by either the stylesheet or GatewayScript file or the template.</li><li>If the &lt;client-authen-method> element value is set to "ssl", the &lt;client-valcred> element value must be provided by either the stylesheet or GatewayScript file or the template.</li></ul></p>

property.name: ClientTemplate
property.summary: Template to derive the configuration parameters of the OAuth client
property.description: <p>Specifies the OAuth client template that is used to derive the configuration parameters that are not specified in the stylesheet or GatewayScript file of the OAuth client.</p>

object.description: <p>To support the OAuth 2.0 protocol, an AAA policy requires the configuration of an OAuth client group. An OAuth client group contains the configured OAuth clients that the DataPower Gateway accepts requests from.</p><p>When creating an OAuth client group for an AAA policy, the OAuth client group consists of one or more OAuth clients with the same OAuth roles.</p>

Enter a descriptive summary for the configuration.

property.name: UserSummary
OdrServerName
property.summary: Name of the ODR routing rules server
property.description: <p>Enter the name of the ODR routing rules server that is used to determine whether routing rules are delivered to the DataPower Gateway. If the DataPower Gateway is not using routing rules, you can use any server name.</p><p>You must define the <tt>RoutingRulesConnectorClusterName</tt> custom property to set the name of the ODR connector group from which routing rules are accepted.</p><p>The web server name is configured in on one of the following ways. <ul><li>In a Liberty Collective, defined as an attribute of the <tt>routingRules</tt> element.</li><li>In a WebSphere cell as the value of the <tt>serverName</tt> parameter of <tt>WebServerRoutingRule</tt> command.</li></ul></p>

property.name: ODRConnectorGroups
property.summary: Connector groups
property.description: Define one ODR connector group for each WebSphere cell or Liberty Collective. Each connector group establishes the communications with an Intelligent management service. The DataPower Gateway retrieves topology information, application information, routing rules, and other information over the connectors in the connector group.

property.name: ODRCustomProperties
property.summary: Custom property name-value strings to connect to Liberty Collective or WebSphere cell
property.description: <p>Defines custom property name-value strings to connect to Liberty Collective or WebSphere cell to define which ODR connection group accepts routing rules.</p><ul><li>The scheme that the DataPower ODR feature uses to connect to WebSphere Application Server does not apply to Liberty Collective. For any HTTP or HTTPS request to connect to Liberty Collective, you must define the <tt>profileType</tt> property. <ol><li>Set the <b>Name</b> to <tt>profileType</tt> .</li><li>Set the <b>Value</b> to <tt>Liberty</tt> .</li></ol></li><li>To set the name of the ODR connector group from which routing rules are accepted, you must define the <tt>RoutingRulesConnectorClusterName</tt> property. The following example shows setting the <tt>liberty-collective-node03</tt> connector group as the group that accepts routing rules. <ol><li>Set the <b>Name</b> to <tt>RoutingRulesConnectorClusterName</tt> .</li><li>Set the <b>Value</b> to <tt>liberty-collective-node03</tt> .</li></ol></li></ul><p>Beyond these situations, use custom properties only when directed by IBM Support.</p>

object.description: <p>Specifies an on demand router (ODR). The ODR feature acts as a collection of load balancer groups that distribute traffic to various clusters within a WebSphere cell or Liberty Collective. If multiple ODR connector groups are defined, the ODR distributes traffic to any of the clusters.</p><p>The ODR feature on the DataPower Gateway supports a subset of On Demand Router in Intelligent Management.</p>

property.name: ODRGroupConnectors
property.summary: Define the ODR connectors that are used to retrieve ODR information
property.description: The ODR connectors that are used to retrieve ODR information. An ODR connector defines a connection to the Intelligent Management service. The DataPower Gateway retrieves topology, weights, session affinity, and other information from the WebSphere cell over the connection. If multiple connectors are configured, the top most connection is tried first, followed by the second, and so on. After a connection is established, other endpoints might be retrieved and used if the configured connector endpoint is down. You must define at least one connector in an ODR connector group but cannot define more than 16 connectors.

property.description: Indicates the name of the rate limit scheme.

property.name: Name

property.description: Indicates the maximum number of requests that the API Gateway can handle within a time interval. The value of 0 indicates no limit.
property.summary: Maximum number of requests to handle
property.name: Rate
Interval
property.summary: Time interval for the rate limit
property.description: Indicates the time interval for the rate limit. Specify a value that is greater than or equal to 1. The default value is 1.

property.name: Unit
property.summary: Time unit for the rate limit
property.description: Indicates the time unit for the rate limit. The default value is second.

property.name: HardLimit
property.summary: Whether to enable hard limit
property.description: <p>Indicates whether to reject requests when the specified rate limit is reached.</p><ul><li>When enabled, the API Gateway rejects requests when the limit is exceeded.</li><li>When disabled, the API Gateway still handles the requests but produces a warning message.</li></ul><p>By default, the API Gateway does not reject requests when the limit is exceeded.</p>

property.name: CacheOnly
property.summary: Use the local cache first to enforce the rate limit
property.description: Specifies whether to use the local cache first to enforce the rate limit. In peer group mode, using the local cache first can prevent transaction delays if communication problems arise across the peer group. However, the transaction count is less precise when this setting is enabled.

property.name: IsClient
property.summary: Whether to apply the rate limit to the client
property.description: Indicates whether to apply the rate limit to the client or to an internal component. Client rate limits return a 429 error when exceeded. Non-client rate limits return a 503 error when exceeded. When set to <tt>off</tt> , rate limit information is not included in the response header.

property.name: UseApiName
property.summary: Whether to use the API name as part of the rate limit key

property.description: Indicates whether to use the application ID as part of the rate limit key.

property.summary: Whether to use the client ID as part of the rate limit key

property.name: DynamicValue
property.summary: The dynamic value for the rate limit
property.description: Indicates the dynamic value string for the rate limit, which should contain one or more context variables. The dynamic value makes it possible to use a context variable to enforce the rate limit based on parameters other than those defined in the rate limit scheme, such as a user name, incoming IP address, or server name. The context variable can be set in a GatewayScript action and then included in the dynamic value. <p>The following example uses the context object in a GatewayScript action to add the <tt>my.server</tt> variable to the API context.</p><p><tt>context.set("my.server", "server34")</tt></p><p>The dynamic value can then include the variable <tt>my.server</tt> , which resolves to the server name <tt>server34</tt> .</p><p>The default value is an empty string.</p>

property.name: Weight
property.summary: Expression determining how much weight to apply to the limit.
property.description: Specifies a JSONata expression that assigns a weight value to the transaction. For each API call, the value computed by the weight expression is applied to the rate limit. The default value is 1. If the weight expression evaluates to a value that is less than or equal to 0, it is set to 1. An empty string results in an error.

The default is 300.</p><p><b>Note:</b> Some mail servers restrict the number of times an account can establish a connection during a specific time period. property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.

A descriptive summary for the settings
property.summary: Enter a descriptive summary for the settings.
property.name: UserSummary
DocumentType
property.summary: Type of document to parse
property.description: Specifies the type of document to parse. By default, the document type is automatically detected.

property.name: DocumentSize
property.summary: Maximum document size that the parse action accepts
property.description: Specifies the maximum document size in bytes that the parse action accepts. This setting provides threat protection by enforcing the maximum document size. Enter a value in the range 0 - 5368709121. The default value is 4194304. A document is rejected when its size exceeds the maximum size. A value of 0 indicates an unlimited document size. When you set the value to 0, the action result does not return the document size. This setting is applicable to binary, JSON, XML, or GraphQL input documents.

property.name: NestingDepth
property.summary: Maximum nesting depth of the XML, JSON, or GraphQL message that the parse action accepts
property.description: <p>Specifies the maximum level of nested element depth in an XML, JSON, or GraphQL message that the parse action accepts. This setting provides threat protection by enforcing limits in the message. <ul><li>For XML, it is the maximum level of element depth.</li><li>For JSON, it is the maximum number of nested label-value pairs, the maximum number of nested arrays, or the maximum number of combination of label-value pairs and arrays.</li><li>For GraphQL, the nesting depth specifies the maximum level of nested selection sets.</li></ul></p><p>Enter a value in the range 0 - 4096. The default value is 512. A document is rejected when its nesting depth exceeds the maximum depth. A value of 0 indicates unlimited nesting depth. When you set the value to 0, the action result does not return the nesting depth of a document.</p>

property.name: Width
property.summary: Maximum width of a payload that the parse action accepts
property.description: <p>Specifies the maximum width of a payload that the parse action accepts. This constraint is relevant only when the input document is XML, JSON, or GraphQL. <ul><li>When the input document is XML, this property specifies: <ul><li>The maximum number of attributes on an element</li><li>The maximum number of child elements for an element</li></ul></li><li>When the input document is JSON, this property specifies: <ul><li>The maximum number of properties on a JSON object</li><li>The maximum number of JSON items in a JSON array</li></ul></li><li>When the input document is GraphQL, this property specifies the maximum number of selections in a selection set.</li></ul></p><p>Enter a value in the range 0 - 65535. The default value is 4096. The document is rejected when its width exceeds the maximum width. A value of 0 indicates unlimited width. When you set the value to 0, the action result does not return the width of the document.</p>

property.name: NameLength
property.summary: Maximum name length that the parse action accepts
property.description: <p>Specifies the maximum name length in bytes that the parse action accepts. This constraint is relevant only when the input document is XML, JSON, or GraphQL. <ul><li>For XML, it is the length of the name portion of a tag.</li><li>For JSON, it is the length of the label portion of the JSON label-value pair.</li><li>For GraphQL, it is the length of the identifiers, including field names and directive names.</li></ul></p><p>The length includes any white space that is contained between tags in XML or quotation marks in JSON. Enter a value in the range 0 - 8192. The default value is 256. A document is rejected when its name length exceeds the maximum length. A value of 0 indicates unlimited name length. When you set the value to 0, the action result does not return the name length of a document.</p>

property.name: ValueLength
property.summary: Maximum value length that the parse action accepts
property.description: <p>Specify the maximum value length in bytes that the parse action accepts. This constraint is relevant only when the input document is XML, JSON, or GraphQL. <ul><li>For XML, it is the length of an attribute or the length of a text value.</li><li>For JSON, it is the length of a string value.</li><li>For GraphQL, it is the number of bytes in any string from which GraphQL is composed.</li></ul></p><p>The length includes any white space that is contained between tags in XML or quotation marks in JSON. Enter a value in the range 0 - 5368709121. The default value is 8192. A document is rejected when its value length exceeds the maximum length. A value of 0 indicates unlimited value length. When you set the value to 0, the action result does not return the value length of a document.</p>

property.name: UniquePrefixes
property.summary: Maximum number of unique prefixes that the parse action accepts
property.description: Specifies the maximum number of unique XML namespace prefixes in a document that the parse action accepts. This limit counts multiple prefixes defined for the same namespace, but does not count multiple namespaces defined in different parts of the input document under a single prefix. Enter a value in the range 0 - 262143. The default value is 1024. A document is rejected when the number of unique prefixes in the document exceeds the maximum number. A value of 0 indicates an unlimited number of unique prefixes. When you set the value to 0, the action result does not return the number of unique prefixes in a document.

property.name: UniqueNamespaces
property.summary: Maximum number of unique namespaces that the parse action accepts
property.description: Specifies the maximum number of unique XML namespace URIs that the parse action accepts. This limit counts all XML namespaces, regardless of how many prefixes are used to declare them. Enter a value in the range 0 - 65535. The default value is 1024. A document is rejected when the number of unique namespaces in the document exceeds the maximum number. A value of 0 indicates an unlimited number of unique namespaces. When you set the value to 0, the action result does not return the number of unique namespaces in a document.

property.name: UniqueNames
property.summary: Maximum number of unique names that the parse action accepts
property.description: <p>Specify the maximum number of unique names that the parse action accepts. <ul><li>For XML, it is the number of unique XML local names.</li><li>For JSON, it is the number of unique JSON labels.</li></ul></p><p>Enter a value in the range 0 - 1048575. The default value is 1024. A document is rejected when the number of unique names in the document exceeds the maximum number. A value of 0 indicates an unlimited number of unique names. When you set the value to 0, the action result does not return the number of unique names in a document.</p>

property.name: NumberLength
property.summary: Maximum number length that the parse action accepts
property.description: The maximum number length limits the number of bytes in the value portion of a label-value pair when the value is a number. The number must be a contiguous string of bytes that contain no white space. The number can include a minus sign and a positive or negative exponent. Enter a value in the range 0 - 256. The default value is 128. A document is rejected when the number length in the document exceeds the maximum length. A value of 0 indicates unlimited number length. When you set the value to 0, the action result does not return the number length in a document.

property.summary: Enter the plaintext password to alias.
property.description: Enter the plaintext password to alias.

object.description: <p>The Password Map Alias provides the mapping of an alias to a plaintext password. The alias is a publicly known reference that is included in configuration files and exports. With an alias you keep the real password secret because the plaintext value for the password is stored in an encrypted file. The password for the alias cannot be viewed or accessed by anyone. Only the appliance can extract the password that it uses internally.</p><p>No passwords that are aliased are written to configuration files. The mapping of aliases to passwords is not part of a backup or export operation, but it is part of the secure backup-restore operations.</p>
