property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>
Specify a brief, descriptive summary.
property.summary: Descriptive summary
property.name: UserSummary
Type
property.summary: Type of log target
property.description: Specify the type of the log target. The default type is file.

property.name: Priority
property.summary: Log target priority
property.description: Control the log scheduling priority. When system resources are in high demand, "high" priority operations will be favored over lower priority operations.

property.name: SoapVersion
property.summary: SOAP version for log target
property.description: Specify the SOAP version for SOAP log targets.

property.name: Format
property.summary: Format of log entries
property.description: Specify the format in which to represent log entries.

property.name: TimestampFormat
property.summary: Format of log timestamp
property.description: Specify the format of the timestamp for log entries. The default format is ISO UTC format.

property.name: FixedFormat
property.summary: Fix the format of logs
property.description: Makes the format of logs unchanging. The log format fixed at V6.0.1. New fields added to log formats afterwards are ignored.

property.name: LocalIdentifier
property.summary: Local system identifier
property.description: Specify a descriptive string that identifies the log target to remote recipients. For syslog destinations, do not include spaces.

property.name: EmailAddress
property.summary: Email address
property.description: Specify the email address to which to send log entries.

property.name: SenderAddress
property.summary: Email address
property.description: Specify the email address of the sender. The value must match the email address of the cryptographic key if email messages are signed.

property.name: SMTPDomain
property.summary: SMTP client domain
property.description: Specify the fully-qualified domain name of the SMTP client. This information will be part of the SMTP session initiation (HELO command).

property.name: Size
property.summary: Maximum log size
property.description: Specify the maximum size of file-based log targets. Enter a value in the range 100 through 50000. The default value is 500.

property.name: URL
property.summary: POST URL
property.description: Specify the HTTP URL to which to send log entries. The DataPower Gateway sends the entries with the POST method. The DataPower Gateway uses the default User Agent.

property.name: NFSMount
property.summary: Instance of the NFS Static Mount
property.description: Specify the name of an NFS Static Mount over which to write the log.

property.name: SSLProxyProfile
property.summary: The TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use a TLS client profile.
property.description: The TLS proxy profile with the cryptographic profiles to secure connections.

property.name: LocalFile
property.summary: Name of the file for the file-based log target
property.description: Specify the name of the log file. Examples: <tt>logtemp:///filename.log</tt> or <tt>logstore:///filename.log</tt> .

property.name: NFSFile
property.summary: Path to the file for the NFS-based log target
property.description: Specify the path to the log file. The path is relative to the NFS mount. Use a regular expression in the <tt>^[_a-z0-9A-Z/][-_a-z0-9A-Z/.]*$</tt> format. Do not end the path with a forward slash (/).

property.name: ArchiveMode
property.summary: Method to archives
property.description: Specify the method to create archives.

property.name: UploadMethod
property.summary: Protocol to upload log files
property.description: Specify the protocol to upload log files. If you use SCP to upload multiple log targets at the same time, a system error might occur. The DataPower Gateway supports only one SCP connection at a time. To minimize the risk when using SCP, configure log targets with different settings, such as different event subscriptions and different log sizes.

property.name: Rotate
property.summary: Maximum number of rotations
property.description: Specify the maximum number of rotations to permit. Enter a value in the range 1 through 100. The default value is 3.

property.name: UseANSIColor
property.summary: Use ANSI color scheme
property.description: Enables the use of ANSI X3.64 escape sequences to color-code messages by log level.

property.name: RemoteAddress
property.summary: Host name or IP address
property.description: Specify the host name or IP address of the remote server. To establish a secure TLS connection to the server, set this value to the value of the remote host of a TLS Proxy service on the DataPower Gateway. The local TLS Proxy service then securely forwards the log entries to its configured remote server.

property.name: RemotePort
property.summary: Port number
property.description: Specify the listening port on the remote server. If using a local TLS Proxy service to establish a secure TLS connection, set this value to the value of the remote port of the TLS Proxy service.

property.name: RemoteLogin
property.summary: Account (user name)
property.description: Specify the account or user name to access the remote server.

property.name: RemotePassword
property.summary: Password
property.description: Specify the password for the account or user name for non-public key authentication. Public key authentication can be configured through the default instance of the User Agent.

property.name: RemoteDirectory
property.summary: Directory on the remote server
property.description: <p>Specify an existing writable directory on the remote server to which to upload files.</p><ul><li>To denote an absolute directory from the root directory, specify a single forward slash character (/) or equivalent encoded character (%2F) before the fully qualified path. <ul><li>For SCP or SFTP, enter / to resolve to //.</li><li>For FTP, enter %2F to resolve to /%2F.</li></ul></li><li>To denote a directory that is relative to the user's home directory, do not specify a forward slash character or encoded character before the fully qualified file name.</li></ul>

property.name: LocalAddress
property.summary: Local interface address
property.description: Specify a host alias or IP address of a local interface.

property.name: SyslogFacility
property.summary: syslog facility
property.description: Set the log facility (per RFC 3164) to include in messages sent to the syslog log target.

property.name: RateLimit
property.summary: The maximum number of events logged
property.description: <p>Set the maximum number of events to be logged per second. Enter a value in the range 1 - 1000. The default value is 100.</p><ul><li>Remote log targets might receive more than this number of events within a second, depending on network latency and buffering. syslog over TCP log targets are exclusive, because only a single TCP connection is made to the server.</li><li>In the case of syslog over TCP log targets, the rate limit is the maximum number of events transmitted over the connection within one second. A value of 0 disables rate-limiting by the logging target.</li></ul>

property.name: ConnectTimeout
property.summary: Number of seconds to wait for a connection to the server to be established before generating an error.
property.description: Set the number of seconds to wait for a connection to the server to be established before generating an error. A log message will be generated in the default log and connection retry attempts will be made. Enter a value in the range 1 - 90. The default value is 60.

property.name: IdleTimeout
property.summary: Number of seconds to wait before closing an established but inactive connection to the server.
property.description: <p>Set the number of seconds to wait before closing an established but inactive connection to the server. Enter a value in the range 1 - 600. The default value is 15.</p><p>Attention: If multiple log targets have the following configuration, they might share connections.</p><ul><li>The same local address and port</li><li>The same remote address and port</li></ul><p>Because of potential connection-sharing, set the same idle timeout value for these log targets.</p>

property.name: ActiveTimeout
property.summary: Number of seconds to wait before closing an established and active connection to the server.
property.description: <p>Set the number of seconds to wait before closing an established and active connection to the server. Enter a value in the range 0 - 60. A value of 0 allows the log target to most efficiently send messages to the server by maintaining a healthy connection indefinitely. The default value is 0.</p><p>Attention: If multiple log targets have the following configuration, they might share connections.</p><ul><li>The same local address and port</li><li>The same remote address and port</li></ul><p>Because of potential connection-sharing, set the same active timeout value for these log targets.</p>

property.name: FeedbackDetection
property.summary: Whether to suppress events from logging subsystem
property.description: Indicate whether to suppress events from the logging subsystem itself. A log target always suppresses its own events, but will record events from other log targets. Under certain circumstances with multiple log targets, these events could create a positive feedback loop that could cause resource contention. Enable to suppress all log events from the logging subsystem and prevent resource contention.

property.name: IdenticalEventSuppression
property.summary: Suppress identical events
property.description: Indicate whether to suppress identical events from the same object over a set time period. When enabled, the log target records only one instance of the event until the suppression period expires.

property.name: IdenticalEventPeriod
property.summary: Duration to suppress identical events
property.description: Set the duration of the suppression period. The default value is 10.

property.name: LogEventCode
property.summary: Filter to log specific event codes
property.description: Subscription filters allow only those log messages that contain the configured event codes to be written to this log target. With this filter, it is possible to create a log target that collects only log messages for a specific set of event codes.

property.name: LogEventFilter
property.summary: Filter to suppress specific event codes
property.description: Suppression filters suppress those log messages that contain the configured event codes to be written to this log target. With this filter, it is possible to create a log target that collects a wide range of log messages except for a specific set of event codes.

property.name: LogObjects
property.summary: Filter to log events for specific objects
property.description: Object filters allow only those log messages for specific objects to be written to this log target. Object filters are based on object classes. With this filter, you can create a log target that collects only log messages generated by particular instances of the specified object classes.

property.name: LogIPFilter
property.summary: Filter to log events for specific IP addresses
property.description: IP address filters allow only those log messages from specific IP addresses to be written to this log target.

property.name: LogTriggers
property.summary: Event Trigger Points
property.description: <p>Event triggers perform actions only when triggered by a specified message ID or event code. With this filter, it is possible to create a log target that collects only the results of the specified trigger action. For example, to trigger the generation of an error report when a certain event occurs use the <b>save error-report</b> command.</p>

property.name: SSLClientProfile
property.summary: Set the TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets
property.description: The TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

property.name: SSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets
property.description: The TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

property.name: RetryInterval
property.summary: Time to wait before attempting to reestablish a failed connection
property.description: Specify the number of seconds to wait before attempting to reestablish a failed connection to the syslog server. Enter a value in the range 1 - 600. The default value is 1.

property.name: RetryAttempts
property.summary: The number of attempts to retry the failed connections
property.description: <p>Specify the number of attempts for a failed connection to the syslog server. After the number of attempts is reached, connection attempts use the value set by <b>Long Retry Interval</b>. When the long interval is disabled, the log target repeatedly attempts to reconnect to the syslog server with the value set by <b>Retry Interval</b>.</p><p><b>Note:</b> 0 means the <b>Long Retry Interval</b> will not be used and will retry forever using <b>Retry Interval</b>.</p>

property.name: LongRetryInterval
property.summary: Long retry interval before retrying the failed connections
property.description: <p>Specify the time to wait before attempting to reestablish a failed connection to the syslog server after the number of attempts is reached. Enter a value in the range 0 - 600. The default value is 20.</p><p><b>Note:</b> The <b>Long Retry Interval</b> must be greater than the <b>Retry Interval</b> or it will take no effect.</p>

property.name: LogPrecision
property.summary: Log Timestamp Precision
property.description: Log Timestamp Precision configuration of the format of the timestamp of the log messages.

property.name: Backup
property.summary: Backup Trace Target
property.description: Allows setting of a backup trace target to redirect events to in case of an error on the current trace target

property.name: LogEvents
property.summary: Trace event subscription
property.description: Defines the log events the current trace target is subscribed to

object.description: Allows the configuration of a trace target.

property.name: Type
property.summary: Rule type
property.description: Select the type of rule for the URL Rewrite Policy.

property.name: MatchRegexp
property.summary: PCRE
property.description: <p>Specify a PCRE that defines the match condition that triggers the rewrite rule. Depending on the rule type, a candidate URL or header field is matched against the expression.</p><ul><li>For <b>absolute-rewrite</b> , <b>content-type</b> , and <b>post-body</b> , defines the expression to be matched against the URL. For example, .* or * matches any string, while (.*)xsl=(.*)\?(.*) matches a text subpattern followed by xsl= followed by a text subpattern followed by a ? followed by a text subpattern.</li><li>For <b>header-rewrite</b> , defines the expression to be matched against the contents of a specific header field. For example, *.* matches any value.</li></ul><p>PCRE documentation is available at http://www.pcre.org</p>

property.name: InputReplaceRegexp
property.summary: Perl-style replacement expression
property.description: <p>Specify a Perl-style replacement that defines the rewritten URL, header field, or HTTP POST body.</p><ul><li>For <b>absolute-rewrite</b> , defines the rewritten URL. If the match pattern is *, specify the complete replacement. If the match pattern is (.*)xsl=(.*)\?(.*), specify the evaluation replacement for any text subpattern or retain the original subpattern. To retain the first subpattern, specify $1; to retain the second text subpattern, specify $2; and so forth. To replace the second text subpattern only, specify $1xsl=ident.xsl$3. <p>If a rewritten URL begins with a host name or port that is different from the configured remote address, the host name or port portion of the rewritten URL is ignored.</p></li><li>For <b>content-type</b> , define the replace value for the Content-Type header.</li><li>For <b>header-rewrite</b> , define the replacement value for the specified header.</li><li>For <b>post-body</b> , define the rewritten body of the HTTP POST. If the match pattern is .*, specify the complete replacement. If the match pattern is (.*)xsl=(.*)\?(.*), specify the evaluation replacement for any text subpattern or retain the original subpattern. To retain the first subpattern, specify $1; to retain the second text subpattern, specify $2; and so forth. To omit the second text subpattern only, specify $1$3.</li></ul>

property.name: StyleReplaceRegexp
property.summary: Perl-style replacement expression
property.description: <p>Specify a Perl-style replacement that identifies the replacement stylesheet. This option is available for <b>absolute-rewrite</b> and <b>post-body</b> only.</p><p>If the match pattern is .*, specify the complete replacement. If the match pattern is (.*)xsl=(.*)\?(.*), specify the evaluation replacement for any text subpattern or retain the original subpattern. To retain the first subpattern, specify $1; to retain the second text subpattern, specify $2; and so forth. To retain the second text subpattern only and not use the third text subpattern, specify http://mantis:8000$2.</p>

property.name: InputUnescape
property.summary: Decode/encode input URLs
property.description: Replace URL-encoded characters (for example, "%2F") with the equivalent literal character. Select on to replace escape sequences, or off to retain them.

property.name: StylesheetUnescape
property.summary: Decode/encode stylesheet URLs
property.description: Replace URL-encoded characters (for example, "%2F") with the equivalent literal character. Select on to replace escape sequences, or off to retain them.

property.name: Header
property.summary: Name HTTP Header to Rewrite

property.name: NormalizeURL
property.summary: Normalize URL
property.description: Normalize URL by converting '\' to '/' and compressing '.' and '..'

value.name: absolute-rewrite
value.summary: Rewrites the entire URL or a portion of the URL based on a URL match.

value.name: post-body
value.summary: Rewrites the body of an HTTP POST request. The POST body contains the input values for a basic HTTP POST request.

value.name: header-rewrite
value.summary: Replaces the value of an arbitrary header based on its value.

value.name: content-type
value.summary: Rewrites the value of the Content-Type header based on a URL match.

property.name: SnmpCreds
property.summary: Manage SNMP V3 credentials for the user account.
property.description: <p>SNMP V3 users are a type of user account with SNMP V3 credentials. This type of user account creates an account and adds SNMP V3 credentials. Each account can have multiple SNMP V3 credentials, one for each SNMP V3 engine that is identified by an engine ID value. The current implementation supports an SNMP V3 credential for the local engine ID only. Therefore, define only one SNMP V3 credential for each account.</p><p>SNMP V3 requests can use authentication with the <tt>AuthKey</tt> and can use privacy (encryption and decryption) with the <tt>PrivKey</tt> . The use of these keys is between the user and the local SNMP engine. <ul><li>The <tt>AuthKey</tt> provides data integrity and data origin authentication.</li><li>The <tt>PrivKey</tt> provides data encryption and decryption.</li></ul></p><p>The <tt>AuthKey</tt> and the <tt>PrivKey</tt> can be explicit values or be generated by the DataPower Gateway. Specifying explicit values is useful when the key is created on another system. <ul><li>When the authentication protocol is MD5, enter the hex representation of the 16-byte key.</li><li>When the authentication protocol is SHA, enter the hex representation of the 20-byte key.</li><li>When the DataPower Gateway generates and stores the appropriate length key, enter a plaintext string that is at least 8 characters long as the hash.</li></ul></p>

To create access policies, enter a correctly formatted policy statement.</p><p>A policy statement takes the <tt><i>address</i> / <i>domain</i> / <i>resource</i> ?Access= <i>privileges</i> &amp; <i>field</i> = <i>value</i></tt> general format.</p><dl><dt><i>address</i></dt><dd>The complete local IP address or host alias. Use an asterisk (*) to designate any address.</dd><dt><i>domain</i></dt><dd>The complete name of the application domain. Use an asterisk (*) to designate any application domain.</dd><dt>resource</dt><dd>The complete value for the resource type. Use an asterisk (*) to designate any resource type.</dd><dt><i>privileges</i></dt><dd>The privileges to apply. Separate permissions with the plus sign (+). For example, <tt>a+d+x+r+w</tt> defines add, delete, execute, read, and write privileges.</dd><dt><i>field</i></dt><dd>The complete name of a specific property in the configuration; for example, <tt>Name</tt> .</dd><dt><i>value</i></dt><dd>The PCRE match expression for the property value; For example, <tt>foo(.*)bar</tt> .</dd></dl>

IPConfigMode
property.summary: Set the configuration mode for the interface.

Although you can set multiple modes, only one mode is supported.</p><ul><li>With static configuration, you must define the configuration for the physical interface.</li><li>With DHCP autoconfiguration, the appliance ignores configuration data about the physical interface.</li><li>With SLAAC autoconfiguration, the appliance ignores configuration data about the physical interface.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>The configuration mode of the interface. Although you can set multiple modes, only one mode is supported.</p><ul><li>With static configuration, you must define the configuration for the physical interface. <ul><li>Assign the primary network address.</li><li>Manage secondary, or auxiliary, network addresses.</li><li>Assign the default IPv4 gateway.</li><li>Assign the default IPv6 gateway, if you define IPv6 IP addresses.</li><li>Manage static routes in the routing table.</li></ul></li><li>With DHCP autoconfiguration, the appliance ignores configuration data about the physical interface.</li><li>With SLAAC autoconfiguration, the appliance ignores configuration data about the physical interface.</li></ul>

property.name: StaticRoutes
property.summary: Manage the static routes in the routing table.
property.hoverhelp: Manage the static routes in the routing table. Add a static route to a remote IP prefix through a router connected to this network.
property.description: The static routes in the routing table. Add a static route to a remote IP prefix through a router connected to this network. When the appliance connects to a remote address, the static route with the longest prefix match is used. If multiple routes have the same prefix match, the static route with the lowest metric is used. If the metric is the same, the static route is chosen randomly.

property.name: DADTransmits
property.summary: Set the number of IPv6 duplication address detection attempts.
property.description: The number of IPv6 duplication address detection (DAD) attempts. The default value is 1.

property.name: DADRetransmitTimer
property.summary: Set the delay between IPv6 neighbor discovery (ND) attempts.
property.hoverhelp: Set the delay between IPv6 Neighbor Discovery (ND) attempts. This property affects duplication address detection (DAD) and other ND operations.
property.description: The delay between IPv6 Neighbor Discovery (ND) attempts. The default value is 1000. This property affects duplication address detection (DAD) and other ND operations.

property.name: StandbyControl
property.summary: Indicate whether to allow a standby configuration.
property.description: <p>Whether to allow a standby configuration. The standby configuration defines the policies for the group that this interface is a member. A standby group is the collection of interfaces on different appliances in the multicast domain that share the responsibility for one virtual IP address. When at least one member of a standby group can reach the multicast domain, the virtual IP group receives the traffic.</p><p><b>Attention:</b> Virtual IP addresses in a standby configuration must be IPv4 addresses.</p>

property.name: Group
property.summary: Set the number of the standby group in the multicast domain.
property.description: <p>The number of the standby group in a multicast domain. The multicast domain is a group of interfaces that receive traffic from each other on the IP address 224.0.0.2 (the all-routers IP multicast group). If the multicast domain becomes partitioned, which is an unusual situation, a member in each partition becomes the active member to handle connections in its partition.</p><p><b>Attention:</b> Do not use a group number that conflicts with the number of an existing standby group or any network group that uses Hot Standby Router Protocol (HSRP).</p><p>The interfaces of a standby group are on the same network segment and share the responsibility for one virtual IP address. Interfaces in the standby group require the following configuration.</p><ul><li>Belong to the same group.</li><li>Use the same primary virtual IP address.</li><li>Use the same authentication, or security token.</li></ul>

property.name: VirtualIP
property.summary: Set the primary virtual IP address of standby group.
property.description: <p>The primary virtual IP address of the standby group. The active member of the standby group uses this IP address. All interfaces in the standby group must use the same virtual IP address. External clients that contact the active member of the standby group should use this IP address.</p><p><b>Attention:</b> Virtual IP addresses in a standby configuration must be IPv4 addresses.</p>

property.name: SecondaryVirtualIP
property.summary: Manage secondary virtual IP addresses that follow the active virtual IP address to the active interface.
property.description: <p>Auxiliary, or secondary, virtual IP addresses to the standby configuration. Secondary addresses follow the active virtual IP address to the active interface. Secondary addresses are on the same interface as the primary address and are enabled and disabled in coordination with the primary address.</p><p><b>Attention:</b> Virtual IP addresses in a standby configuration must be IPv4 addresses.</p>

property.name: Preempt
property.summary: Indicates whether to support preemption in the standby group.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Indicates whether to support preemption in the standby group. <b>Attention:</b> Do not enable preemption.</p>
property.description: <p>Whether to support preemption in the standby configuration for the initially active interface. Depending on the preemption setting, the follow activity occurs when the initially active member returns to service after a failure.</p><ul><li>When preemption is enabled, the interface resumes its active role. The standby interface becomes a passive member.</li><li>When preemption is disabled, the interface is a passive member.</li></ul><p><b>Attention:</b> Do not enable preemption.</p>

property.name: Priority
property.summary: Set the priority of the interface in the standby group.
property.hoverhelp: Set the priority of the interface in the standby group. Enter a value in the range 0 - 255. Use the default value unless one system or interface is in some way better than another one.
property.description: <p>The priority of the interface in the standby group. Enter a value in the range 0 - 255. The default value is 100. Use the default value unless one system or interface is in some way better than another one.</p><p>For each standby group, there is one active member and one or more passive members. The interface with the highest priority seeks to be the active member. If multiple interfaces have the same priority, one becomes the active member.</p>

property.name: SelfBalance
property.summary: Indicates whether to use self-balancing in the standby group.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Indicates whether to use self-balancing in the standby group.</p><ul><li>When enabled, the active member distributes connections to available members.</li><li>When disabled, all connections go to the active member. The active member receives all TCP connections and processes all requests and responses. If the active member becomes unavailable, the standby member becomes the active members.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>Whether to use self-balancing in the standby group.</p><ul><li>When enabled, the active member distributes connections to available members.</li><li>When disabled, all connections go to the active member. The active member receives all TCP connections and processes all requests and responses. If the active member becomes unavailable, the standby member becomes the active members.</li></ul><p>The active member manages all TCP connections to virtual IP addresses. When a client initiates a new TCP connection, the active member selects a member to act as the connection endpoint. The active member tracks member capabilities to distribute traffic appropriately. The selected member completes the establishment of the connection. The active member forwards all segments of the TCP connection to the member that is acting as the connection endpoint.</p><ul><li>In a non-graceful transition, if the active member becomes unavailable, the passive member with the next highest priority becomes the active member. The active member might become unavailable because of network issues, an appliance crash, power outage, or similar cause.</li><li>In a graceful transition, such as for scheduled maintenance, most connections can be preserved if the appliance that terminates the connection remains available. In practice, quiesce the active appliance to ensure that established connections complete before you start maintenance; for example, apply firmware. In some environments, the time for the takeover exceeds the client timeout value. Similarly, if the appliance timeout value is aggressive, connections can be lost because the appliance terminated the connection because of a timeout.</li></ul>

property.name: Authentication
property.summary: Set the authentication string for the interface in the standby group.
property.hoverhelp: Set the authentication string, or security token in hex. Every member in the standby group must use the same security token.
property.description: The authentication string, or security token in hex. The default value is 0x5841333500000000. Every member in the standby group must use the same security token.

property.name: HelloTimer
property.summary: Set the frequency to broadcast hello messages
property.hoverhelp: Set the frequency to broadcast hello messages. Set this value to at least one third the duration of the hold timer. Enter a value in the range 2 - 40.
property.description: The frequency to broadcast hello messages. Set this value to at least one third the duration of the hold timer. Enter a value in the range 2 - 40. The default value is 3.

property.name: HoldTimer
property.summary: Set the duration to wait before the standby member attempts a failover.
property.hoverhelp: Set the duration to wait before the standby member attempts a failover. Set this value to at least three times the interval of hello messages. Enter a value in the range 6 - 120.
property.description: The duration to wait before the standby member attempts a failover. Set this value to at least three times the interval of hello messages. Enter a value in the range 6 - 120. The default value is 10.

property.name: DistAlg
property.summary: Set the distribution algorithm for incoming connections when self-balancing is enabled.
property.description: The algorithm to distribute incoming connections to available members when self-balancing is enabled.

property.name: OverType
property.summary: Set the parent interface type.
property.description: The parent interface type for the VLAN interface.

property.name: EthernetInterface
property.summary: Set the parent Ethernet interface.
property.description: The parent Ethernet interface for the VLAN interface.

property.name: LinkAggInterface
property.summary: Set the parent link aggregation interface.
property.description: The parent link aggregation interface for the VLAN interface.

property.name: Identifier
property.summary: Set the unique VLAN identifier.
property.hoverhelp: Set the VLAN identifier that is unique among all VLAN interfaces on the same Ethernet interface. Enter a value in the range 1 - 4094.
property.description: The unique VLAN identifier to send and receive traffic. The identifier must be unique among all VLAN interfaces on the same Ethernet interface. Enter a value in the range 1 - 4094. The default value is 2.

property.name: DefaultOutboundPriority
property.summary: Set the priority for outbound packets.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Set the priority value for outbound VLAN headers for packets. These packets are sent on this VLAN interface. This value is placed in the <tt>user_control</tt> field of the Tag Control Information (TCI). Enter a value in the range 0 - 7.</p>
property.description: <p>The priority value for outbound VLAN headers for packets. These packets are sent on this VLAN interface. This value is placed in the <tt>user_control</tt> field of the Tag Control Information (TCI). The exact interpretation of the value depends on the VLAN switch configuration. Enter a value in the range 0 - 7. The default value is 0.</p>

property.name: MTU
property.summary: Set the maximum transmission unit for the VLAN interface.
property.hoverhelp: Set the maximum transmission unit for the VLAN interface. Enter a value in the range 576 - 16128.
property.description: The maximum transmission unit (MTU) for the VLAN interface. The MTU for the VLAN interface cannot be greater than the MTU of the parent interface. The MTU is determined regardless of the length of the layer 2 encapsulation. Enter a value in the range 576 - 16128. The default value is 1500.

property.name: HardwareOffload
property.summary: Indicate whether to offload TCP/IP packet processing to hardware.
property.hoverhelp: Indicate whether to offload TCP/IP packet processing to hardware. Disable this option only when IBM Support diagnoses that you are encountering a problem.
property.description: <p>Whether to offload TCP/IP packet processing. By default, offloading is enabled.</p><ul><li>When enabled, offloads TCP/IP packet processing of VLAN device drivers and chips. Hardware offload can improve performance.</li><li>When disabled, does not offload TCP/IP packet processing. Disable this option only when IBM Support diagnoses that you are encountering a problem.</li></ul><p>If you disable the hardware offload and then re-enable offloading, you must restart the appliance for the change to take effect.</p>

object.description: A VLAN interface allows multiple logical LANs to coexist on the same Ethernet segment. VLAN packets are identified by the IEEE 802.1Q protocol. You can define multiple VLAN interfaces on a single parent interface. The parent interface can be an Ethernet interface or a link aggregation interface.

value.description: The WebSphere Cell information is retrieved on a fixed time interval regardless of whether the WebSphere Cell configuration has changed.
value.name: poll

value.description: The WebSphere Cell information is retrieved with a request that waits for either the duration of the Time Interval to expire or for the WebSphere Cell information to change, whichever occurs first. After the DataPower Gateway receives the response, the DataPower Gateway immediately sends another request that again awaits for either the time interval expiration or an update. This method might result in several updates within a short amount of time. It consumes more resources on the DataPower Gateway and also on the server that is running the ODCInfo application. This method is more appropriate when application routing is enabled.
value.name: subscribe

object.name: WCCService

property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Contains a brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: ODCInfoHostname
property.summary: Host name or IP address
property.description: Host name or IP address of the Deployment Manager. It is used to communicate with the ODCInfo servlet. The ODCInfo servlet must be installed in a WebSphere Application Server environment.

property.name: ODCInfoPort
property.summary: Destination port of ODCInfo servlet
property.description: Specifies the listening port of the ODCInfo servlet on the deployment manager. To determine the listening port number, log in to the WebSphere Application Server administrative console and click System Administration > Deployment Manager > ports. From the list, use the port associated with WC_adminhost for HTTP or the port associated with WC_adminhost_secure for HTTPS.

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: The TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use a TLS client profile.
property.description: You must select a TLS proxy profile if you are using TLS (HTTPS) to connect to the ODCInfo servlet. If you do not specify a profile, an HTTP connection is used.

property.name: UpdateType
property.summary: Method for retrieving WebSphere information
property.description: Specifies the method for retrieving WebSphere information. The method defines the responsiveness of the updates received by the DataPower Gateway. The method also affects the amount of system resource used for providing those updates. The default is poll.

property.name: TimeInterval
property.summary: Interval for updates
property.description: <p>If the update method is poll, the time interval specifies the amount of time in seconds between poll requests.</p><p>If the update method is subscribe, the time interval specifies the maximum duration of the request in seconds.</p><p>Use any value of 1 - 86400. The default is 10.</p>

property.name: SSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets
property.description: The TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

property.name: SSLClient
property.summary: Set the TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets
property.description: The TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

object.description: Use the WebSphere Cell configuration to retrieve configuration information and runtime information from a Network Deployment or Virtual Enterprise product. Load balancer groups use this information to automate configuration and updates.

object.name: WSEndpointRewritePolicy
object.summary: Create or edit WS Endpoint Rewrite Policies

property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.description: Add, edit, or delete a local endpoint rewrite rule. These rules evaluate services in a deployed WSDL file and specify the URL the appliance should use locally for matched services. They convert addresses in WSDL files to local endpoints.
property.name: WSEndpointLocalRewriteRule

property.description: Add, edit, or delete a remote endpoint rewrite rule. These rules evaluate services in deployed WSDL file and specify the URL the appliance should use remotely for matched services. They convert address in WSDL files to remote endpoints.
property.name: WSEndpointRemoteRewriteRule

property.description: Add, edit, or delete a publish endpoint rewrite rule. These rules evaluate services in deployed WSDL file and specify the URL the appliance should publish when producing its own WSDL files. Use this if you wish to publish an address different from the local address, for example the address of a load balancer in front of appliance.
property.name: WSEndpointPublishRewriteRule

property.description: Add, edit, or delete a subscription rewrite rule.
property.name: WSEndpointSubscriptionLocalRule

property.description: Add, edit, or delete a subscription rewrite rule.
property.name: WSEndpointSubscriptionRemoteRule

property.description: Add, edit, or delete a subscription rewrite rule.
property.name: WSEndpointSubscriptionPublishRule

object.description: Create or edit WS Endpoint Rewrite Policy

value.description: A service or transaction assigned this priority setting will receive above normal scheduling priority and resource allocation.
value.name: high

value.description: A service or transaction assigned this priority setting will receive normal scheduling priority and resource allocation.
value.name: normal

value.description: A service or transaction assigned this priority setting will receive below normal scheduling priority and resource allocation.
value.name: low

property.description: Select the direction of the message.
property.name: Direction
property.summary: Direction of the message

property.description: Enter the name of the header to inject. Even though the headers are not defined in the original request, the device provides the specified headers to the backend server.
property.name: HeaderTag
property.summary: Name of the injected header

property.description: Enter the value for the header tag.
property.summary: Value for the injected header
property.name: HeaderTagValue

property.description: Select the direction of the message.
property.name: Direction
property.summary: Direction of the message

property.description: Enter the name of the header to suppress. When these headers are defined in the original request, the device removes the specified headers before forwarding the request to the backend server.
property.name: HeaderTag
property.summary: Name of the suppressed header

property.description: <p>Specify the name for the stylesheet parameter. The following list identifies common stylesheet parameters:</p><ul><li>decrypt-key: For decryption operations, the name of the Key object to be used.</li><li>keypair-key: For signing operations, the name of the Key object to be used.</li><li>keypair-cert: For signing operations, the name of the Certificate object to be used.</li><li>recipient: For encryption operations, the name of the Certificate object for the intended recipient.</li><li>valcred: For authentication, the name of the Validation Credentials object to be used.</li></ul>
property.name: ParameterName
property.summary: Name of stylesheet parameter

property.description: Specify the value for the parameter. Typically, the value is the name of a configuration object.
property.summary: Value for stylesheet parameter
property.name: ParameterValue

value.description: Monitors execute in the order in which they are listed. After any monitor either shapes (buffers to delay) or rejects a message, no further monitors will execute. If there are six monitors and the second monitor executes and rejects the message, the remaining monitors (three to six) do not execute.
value.name: terminate-at-first-throttle

value.description: Monitors execute in the order in which they are listed. After any monitor matches a message and takes any action at all, no further monitors will execute. If there are six monitors and the second monitor executes and logs the message, the remaining monitors (three to six) do not execute.
value.name: terminate-at-first-match

value.description: Allows messages attachments in streaming mode, but provides limited processing. Client requests in the form of a SOAP message package (that is, a SOAP message transmitted together with accompanying attachments) are supported. Processing can be applied to each attachment individually. The system will not build a manifest of all attachments and attachments must be accessed and processed in the order in which they appear in the document.
value.name: streaming

value.description: Allows messages with attachements but but does not process the attachments. This option permits forwarding of large attachments. root part of the message (typically containing a SOAP message) is subject to filter or transform actions. Accompanying documents can be passed intact to the server. No processing on parts other than the root part is possible.
value.name: unprocessed

type.name: dmRootPartNotFirstAction

value.name: process-in-order
value.summary: Process the attachments and root part in the order they appear in the original message. All parts are still processed in streaming mode even though only attachments after the root will be streamed from the network.

value.name: buffer
value.summary: Buffer attachments before the root into memory. Then process the root part, buffered attachments, and subsequent attachments.

value.name: abort
value.summary: Abort the transaction and return an error

type.summary: Action to take when MIME message root part is not first

value.name: dynamic
value.summary: Deduce attachment format (MIME or DIME) from content

value.name: detect
value.summary: Detect attachment format from the message data

value.description: Buffers submitted messages until all processing is verified as complete. When verified, forward the messages.
value.name: buffer-until-verification
value.summary: Buffer messages until processing is complete

value.description: <p>Forwards messages before all processing is verified as complete. This setting can potentially increase speed.</p><p>If the XML Manager associated with this service has streaming enabled, select this option to be certain that the device will stream messages end-to-end.</p><p>If streaming of attachments is enabled, select this option.</p>
value.name: stream-until-infraction

value.description: The parser forbids external references. An external reference causes the XML parser to stop when the document contains external references. This setting is the default value.
value.name: forbid

value.description: The parser accesses and resolves external references, but replaces each for further processing with an empty string. This setting can be a security risk.
value.name: ignore

value.description: The parser allows and resolves external references. This setting is a security risk.
value.name: allow

value.description: Enables the probe to contain the number of transactions that is defined by the debug history.
value.name: on
value.summary: Enables the probe to contain a specified number of transactions

value.description: Disables the probe.
value.name: off

value.description: Enables the probe to contain 250 transactions. This property is equivalent to specifying a debug history value of 250 transactions.
value.name: unbounded
value.summary: Enables the probe to contain 250 transactions

type.description: Select the behavior of the probe.
type.name: dmDebugMode

property.description: Specify a PCRE to match against client IP addresses. Requests from clients with matching IP addresses will trigger the probe. To create a match for all IP addresses, specify .* instead of * as the PCRE.
property.name: ClientIP
property.summary: PCRE to match client IP addresses

property.description: Specify a PCRE to match against the inbound URLs. Requests from clients with matching URLs will trigger the probe. To create a match for all URLs, specify .* instead of * as the PCRE.
property.name: InURLMatch
property.summary: PCRE to match inbound URL requests

property.description: Specify a PCRE to match against the outbound URLs. Responses from servers with matching URLs will trigger the probe. To create a match for all URLs, specify .* instead of * as the PCRE.
property.name: OutURLMatch
property.summary: PCRE to match outbound URL responses

property.description: Select the rule direction or type that will trigger the probe.
property.name: RuleType
property.summary: Processing rules direction or type to match

property.description: Specify a PCRE to match against names of processing rules. Rules with matching names will trigger the probe. To create a match for all names, specify .* instead of * as the PCRE.
property.name: RuleMatch
property.summary: PCRE to match names of processing rules

property.description: Specify an XPath expression of use the XPath Tool to define an XPath expression to match against messages. Messages that contain the expression will trigger the probe.
property.name: XPath
property.summary: XPath expression to match element in message

value.description: Enforces serial processing of the actions defined for request processing, excluding serial transmission of messages to the backend request queue. An action always sends messages to queue-based destinations in the order that they were pulled from the front-side request queue. If a later message arrives for processing by the action before an earlier message, the service buffers this message until after the action completes processing for the earlier message.
value.name: Request
value.summary: Runs actions in request rule in order

value.description: Enforces serial transmission of messages to the backend request queue. The output of request processing always sends messages to the backend request queue in the order that they were pulled from the front-side request queue. If a later message arrives for transmission before an earlier message, the service buffers this message until after transmitting the earlier message.
value.name: Backend

value.description: <p>Enforces serial processing of the actions defined for response processing, including serial transmission of messages to the front-side reply queue.</p><ul><li>An action always sends messages to queue-based destinations in the order that were pulled from the backend reply queue.</li><li>The output of response processing always sends messages to the front-side reply queue in the order that were pulled from the backend reply queue.</li></ul><p>If a later message arrives for processing by the action before an earlier message or a later message arrives for transmission to the front-side reply queue before an earlier message, the service buffers the message at this point until after processing the earlier message.</p>
value.name: Response
value.summary: Runs actions in response rule in order

type.name: dmWSAModeType

value.description: Mediates transport of messages between host devices that use WS-Addressing to server devices that use traditional addressing. The host device messaging is fully processed as WS-Addressing. You can strip the WS-Addressing headers, or use rewrite rules to modify them.
value.name: wsa2sync
value.summary: Mediate transport from WS-Addressing to traditional addressing

value.description: Mediates transport of messages between host devices using traditional addressing to server devices using WS-Addressing. The host device message is handled in normal synchronous mode. The communication to the server will include WS-Addressing headers.
value.name: sync2wsa
value.summary: Mediate transport from traditional addressing to WS-Addressing

value.description: <p>Mediates transport of messages between host devices using WS-Addressing to server devices using WS-Addressing. Note that all messages between the host and server are terminated and re-originated. The received client WS-Addressing is replaced by new WS-Addressing for the communication to the server. You must provide rewrite rules for the <tt>To</tt> , <tt>ReplyTo</tt> , and <tt>FaultTo</tt> elements. The <tt>To</tt> element needs to be rerouted to the server device, the <tt>ReplyTo</tt> and <tt>FaultTo</tt> elements must point back to the mediator from the server device.</p>
value.name: wsa2wsa
value.summary: Mediate transport between devices that use WS-Addressing

value.description: <p>Disables WS-Addressing support. WS-Addressing SOAP headers are ignored. You can use XSLT to modify any WS-Addressing SOAP headers. This option provides minimal processing overhead but should not be selected if you require any asynchronous responses.</p><p>When selected, no additional configuration is required.</p>
value.name: sync2sync
value.summary: Disable support for processing of WS-Addressing

type.summary: Select how WS-Addressing transactions should be transported

type.description: Select how responses to WS-Addressing messages are returned to the DataPower device.

value.description: Indicates a synchronous exchange model. The server response is received over the same communication channel that the DataPower service uses to convey the client request.
value.name: sync
value.summary: Responses are returned synchronously to the device

value.description: <p>Indicates an asynchronous exchange model. The server response is received over a different communication channel than the one that was used by the DataPower service to convey the client request.</p><p>When selected, use the WS-Addressing Reply Point property to identify the handler to convey the responses to the originating client, and use the WS-Addressing asynchronous reply timeout property to define the maximum time to allow for a server response.</p>
value.name: async
value.summary: Responses are returned asynchronously to the device

value.description: <p>Indicates an out-of-band exchange model. The routing of the response to the originating client is handled by the target server. The response bypasses the DataPower device.</p><p>When selected, the values for the client-supplied <tt>ReplyTo</tt> and <tt>FaultTo</tt> elements must be explicit (non-anonymous). value.description: <p>When selected, this option modifies message validation to accept messages where base64-encoded binary content was optimized according to the MTOM/XOP specifications. XOP binary-optimization replaces base64-encoded binary data with an xop:Include reference element that references the unencoded binary data located in an attachment.</p><ul><li>When disabled, such optimized messages are rejected by validation of the optimized form. Rejection occurs because the schema specifies a simple type that accepts base64-encoded data, such as xs:base64Binary or xs:string, but the message contains an xop:Include element instead.</li><li>When enabled, an xop:Include element can optionally appear in place of content for any XML Schema simple type that validates base64-encoded binary data. The xop:Include element itself is validated according to the built-in schema in store:///schemas/xop.xsd.</li></ul><p>This option is enabled by default.</p>
value.name: AllowXOPInclude

property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for user annotation.

property.name: Priority
property.summary: Service scheduling priority
property.description: Control the service scheduling priority. When system resources are in high demand, "high" priority services will be favored over lower priority services.

property.name: FrontProtocol
property.summary: Protocol handler
property.description: Specify a protocol handler to determine the network communication protocol, address, port, and other protocol-specific settings.

property.name: XMLManager
property.summary: XML manager
property.description: <p>An XML Manager manages the compilation and caching of style sheets, the caching of documents, and provides configuration constraints on the size and parsing depth of documents. You can enable streaming operation by configuring an XML Manager to use a Streaming Compile Option Policy.</p><p>Optionally, an XML Manager can employ a User Agent. The User Agent settings, in turn, can affect the behavior of the gateway when communicating with remote servers or with clients when sending back responses.</p>

<p>Define a URL Rewrite Policy that defines rules for the following rewrite and replacement operations:</p><ul><li>Rewrite the entire URL or a portion of the URL</li><li>Replace a header value in a message</li><li>Rewrite the HTTP POST body in a message</li></ul><p>The rewrite rules are applied before document processing. Therefore, the evaluation criteria in the Matching Rule is against the rewritten value.</p>
property.summary: URL rewrite policy
property.name: URLRewritePolicy
SSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets
property.description: The TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

property.name: SSLProxy
property.summary: The TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use a TLS client profile.
property.description: The TLS proxy profile with the cryptographic profiles to secure connections.

property.name: SSLClient
property.summary: Set the TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets
property.description: The TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

Specify a credentials list for the service. The credentials specify which keys and certificates are available to support processing. In the absence of credentials, all locally-stored key and certificates are available to the service.
property.summary: Crypto Credentials list
property.name: FWCred

property.description: Style sheets used in processing policies can take stylesheet parameters. These parameters can be passed in by this object. You can define more than one parameter.
property.name: StylesheetParameters

property.description: If a stylesheet parameter is defined without a namespace (or without explicitly specifying the null namespace), then this is the namespace into which the parameter will be assigned.
property.name: DefaultParamNamespace

property.description: The namespace in which to put all parameters that are specified in the URL query string.
property.name: QueryParamNamespace
BackendUrl
property.label: URL
property.summary: Backend address and port
property.hoverhelp: Specify the URL of the static destination. The format of the URL determines the protocol that is used for communicating with the destination.
property.description: <p>Specify the URL of the static backend server. The URL is parsed to determine the protocol to use.</p><p>To use a load balancer, specify the name of an existing Load Balancer Group instead of the address-port pair in the URL.</p><p>To use the on demand router, specify http://ODR-LBG instead of the address-port pair in the URL.</p><ul><li>When the URL starts with http://, the DataPower service uses the HTTP protocol.</li><li>When the URL starts with https://, the DataPower service uses the HTTPS protocol to secure connections.</li><li>When the URL starts with ftp://, the DataPower service uses the FTP protocol. <ul><li>For a relative path to the login directory of the user, specify the URL in the ftp://user:password@host:port/path format.</li><li>For an absolute path to the root directory, specify the URL in the ftp://user:password@host/%2Fpath format. %2F is the URL encoding of a forward slash.</li></ul><p>Include a password in the URL with caution. The use of user:/password@host results in a server connection. However, with this configuration, the connection could be unable to send multiple commands to the FTP server. For a stable connection, define a basic authentication policy in the user agent. The user agent is in the XML manager associated with the DataPower service.</p></li><li>When the URL starts with sftp://, the DataPower service uses the SSH FTP protocol. <ul><li>For an absolute path to the root directory, specify the URL in the sftp://host:port/path format.</li><li>For a relative path to the login directory of the user, specify the URL in the sftp://host:port/~/path format.</li></ul><p>If password authentication is desired, specify the password in the SFTP Client Policy of the User Agent. If Public key authentication is desired, specify the user's private key in the SFTP Client Policy of the User Agent. When no SFTP Client Policy is specified, the Basic-Auth Policy and Pubkey-Auth Policy take effect.</p></li><li>When the URL starts with dpnfs://, the DataPower service uses the NFS protocol. <ul><li>For static mounts, specify the URL in the dpnfs://MountObjectName format, where MountObjectName is the name of an existing NFS mount.</li><li>For dynamic mounts, specify the URL in the dpnfs://host or dpnfs://host/path format.</li></ul></li><li>When the URL starts with dpmq://, the DataPower service uses the IBM MQ protocol. The IBM MQ Queue Manager that is referenced in the URL must exist in the current application domain. <p>When the URL starts with mq://, the protocol is for a dynamic backend server.</p></li><li>When the URL starts with dpwasjms://, the DataPower service uses the WebSphere JMS protocol to secure connections. The server object that is referenced in the URL must exist.</li><li>When the URL starts with dpims:// or dpimsssl://, the DataPower service uses the IMS protocol. <p>These protocols are available with the IMS feature.</p></li><li>When the URL starts with dptibems://, the DataPower service uses the TIBCO EMS protocol to secure connections. The server object that is referenced in the URL must exist. <p>When the URL starts with tibems://, the protocol is for a dynamic backend server.</p><p>These protocols are available with the TIBCO EMS feature.</p></li></ul><p>For assistance in building a URL, click the appropriate Helper button.</p>

property.name: PropagateURI
property.summary: Controls URI propagation
property.description: <p>URI propagation is meaningful only when:</p><ul><li>The service uses a static backend.</li><li>The service uses a dynamic backend and routing is set with a route with stylesheet (route-action) action. In this case, use dp:set-target() to define the backend server. <p>For the other routing options that are available with route-action and route-set, the URI is absolute.</p></li></ul><p>When set to <b>on</b>, the service rewrites the URI of the backend URL to the URI in the client request. If the client submits http://host/service and the backend URL is http://server/listener, the URL is rewritten to http://server/service.</p><p>If the backend URL employs IBM MQ, TIBCO EMS, or WebSphere JMS, set to <b>off</b>.</p>

Specifies a list of Web Services Monitors for the service. Web Services Monitors target Web Services endpoints. Use the Web Services wizard on the Control Panel to supply a WSDL and configure a Monitor for an endpoint. The Monitor collects statistics, establishes count and duration monitors and can take action when thresholds are met or exceeded. A Monitor must be included here to be activated. Note that this is not the same Monitor as a Service Level Monitor (SLM) that can be included in the Processing Policy of this service.
property.name: ServiceMonitors

property.description: Specify the count monitors to define messaging events and increment counters each time the event occurs. When a certain threshold is reached, the monitor can either post a notification to a log or block service for a configured amount of time.
property.name: CountMonitors

property.description: Specify the duration monitors to watch for events that meet or exceed a configured duration. When a duration is met or exceeded, the monitor can either post a notification to a log or block service for a configured amount of time.
property.name: DurationMonitors
MonitorProcessingPolicy
property.summary: Monitors evaluation method
property.description: Select the way that the system behaves when more than one monitor is attached to a service.

property.name: RequestAttachments

property.description: Select how to treat client requests with attachments. The default is strip.

property.name: ResponseAttachments

property.description: Select how to treat server responses with attachments. The default is strip.

property.description: Specify whether to enable or disable flow control for attachments in requests to servers. The default is off.
